text: I have 4 dogs so it seems like there‚Äôs always a reason to visit the vet. Recently, my oldest was diagnosed with cancer and needed surgery. Then, a few days later they reached out to me to ask how my dog was doing and to send well wishes. I think that should tell you everything you need to know. I can‚Äôt recommend them enough.
title: the best

text:
Absolutely disappointed with Healthy Paws pet insurance! I purchased their policy with high hopes of ensuring the health and well-being of my beloved dog, but was left with a feeling of complete betrayal. My poor dog had broken teeth which required expensive dental work. Imagine my shock when I discovered that Healthy Paws not only refused to cover the costs, but also did not provide any refunds!

Their advertisements boast full coverage of unexpected accidents and illnesses, but when it came to actual medical necessity, they easily found a loophole to refute my claim. Paying your insurance premiums in good faith only to be disappointed when it really matters is just disappointing.

I strongly advise anyone considering pet insurance to look elsewhere. Healthy Paws may claim to have your pet's best interests at heart, but their actions speak louder than words. Save yourself the headache and find a company that actually delivers on its promises. And also, to my great regret, I began to read reviews about this company only when I was faced with this situation; if I had read the reviews before taking out an insurance policy for my dog, I would never have bought a policy from this company. Stay away from this company.
title: Absolutely disappointed with Healthy‚Ä¶

text:
My cat Roland needed emergency surgery that totaled over $6,000.  It was such a relief to know that I had Healthy Paws, where reimbursement is 70% and they don't give you a hard time about what happened to your pet when you're already stressed about their wellbeing.  I submitted my claim and I got an answer (a reimbursement of about $4,600) by the next day.  I know I will have the payment before my credit card payment is due, which means that between my emergency savings and this reimbursement, I have less stress. 
It's not perfect, of course-- I wish Healthy Paws would cover the expense in the moment like human health insurance does, and of course I wish vet care was more affordable in general.  But until we have that, I'm grateful for what Healthy Paws has made available for me.
title: Reimbursement is 70% and quick!

text: Our sweet tripod Moe has had two tplo surgerys, a cancer/tumor removal, and teeth extractions over the 5 years we've had him. Healthy Paws has always provided timely and effective support. text:
I'm glad my friend convinced me to get this insurance, because my sheltie (8 y/o) developed a gallbladder mucocele and needed surgery to get it removed. When they removed it, it looked on verge of rupture, which could've killed him.

Healthy Paws had always been consistent and quick to reimburse us for covered visits, so I didn't feel the financial pressure taking on a $7-9k surgery (he had complications during it so it turned into $11k). I got back about $9k with my 80% reimbursement plan. Totally worth it. Best of all, my dog is feeling much better!

My two dogs are able to get the best care because of healthy paws. Don‚Äôt think twice. You will never know when you have an emergency and will need to spend thousands. Thank you healthy paws!
title: Best decision ever!!!

text:
Healthy Paws is the BEST pet insurance!
We have had our little rescue dog insured through Healthy Paws going on 10 years.   Dudley is far from being a pet,  but a part of our family in which we provide him the best food, love and medical care.  Just like you have medical insurance for anyone in your family to be able to provide health care we feel it is just as important to provide it for Dudley.   I was recommended by a good friend when we first got Dudley to go with Healthy Paws and we are so glad we did.  Poor Dudley has gone through some tough times. Not to long after we got Dudley he had to go though surgery to repair his right Patella,  about the same time I under went surgery for Thyroid cancer.   The following year my Thyroid cancer came back again and as well he had to undergo another surgery for his Patella on his left leg.    Following that things we good for a number of years until he was diagnosed with having an enlarged Liver and elevated Kidney levels.  This required ultra sounds and being on medication.   Through the excellent medical care we were able to stabilize him and he has been living a very happy healthy life.   Fast forward again a number of years and now we are again at a rough time in Dudley's life as he has heart problems that has progressively gotten worse.   We have Vet visits with a Cardiologist for Dudley about every 3 months and on additional medications.  Even though he is now dealing with the heart issues he again is happy and healthy for what he can be in his condition.   Through all this we have been able to get the very best care for Dudley.  Having this insurance has allowed us to go see Specialist such as his Internal Medicne Doctor as well Cardiologist who both work together to make sure we are doing the very best for Dudley.  If we did not have the insurance I would not be able to provide the kind of care my wife and I are doing for Dudley and see the very best Vets.   I just had a visit yesterday at the Cardiologist and like my other visits I submitted the copy of the receipt on line yesterday and less than 24 hours latter it was approved.  
If you want the best insurance you can get for your loved friend get Healthy Paws.
title: Healthy Paws is the BEST pet insurance!

text: We definitely recommend HealthyPaws Pet Insurance.  We used it for years with our Lab who eventually got cancer.  HealthyPaws paid for all his surgeries and treatments at 80%, no questions asked.  This plan does not include wellness coverage, but that's exactly what we wanted.  After many emergencies/surgeries with our dogs, we realized insurance for emergencies and sickness was the way to go.  We'll pay for wellness care, but HealthyPaws is there for the emergencies.  We just had one!  Our new 5-month old puppy ate a sock and needed emergency surgery.  HealthyPaws covered everything (except exam) at 80% and the funds were deposited in my checking account the next day.

text: We tried two separate pet insurances when we got our beagle puppies in 2012 (Trupanion) and 2014 (HealthyPaws). I am based in Texas. When I called to correct the issue ($50 overdue for a month) and reinstate my account, which we've paid religiously every month prior to this issue for 6+ years, they claim they can neither reinstate, or give me a new policy with the same rate.  Probably surprising to nobody the new rate has more than DOUBLED.  I will not be renewing with this company because this behavior is so greedy/scammy and a really crappy way to treat loyal customers.

text: Our dog Ruby just turned 11 years old this past month.  For most of her life she has been very healthy and we only had one or two small claims up thru 2022.  Over the past calendar year, however, she has required two echocardiograms, a sonogram, a splenectomy (which turns out to be a pretty major surgical procedure) and a significant amount of condition related lab and blood work.  Healthy Paws stood behind their policy 100% with us and covered over 10K of costs. The claims were processed quickly (funds in my account within a few business days of submitting) and correspondence was handled courteously and clearly.  Naturally it helps to have a responsive and efficient veterinarian on your team to expedite things.  Yes, this is not low cost insurance coverage, and our monthly rates have gone up significantly over the course of Ruby's life as she has aged.  But the last year has convinced me that Healthy Paws coverage has been worth every penny.  It has enabled us to provide our little girl with the care she needed and given us the peace of mind that we will be able to continue to do the best we can for her (hopefully many) remaining years.

text: Thanks to Healthy Paws, it was easy to say, "Money is no object" when our Piper became sick. She had a large mass on her spleen that appeared cancerous and had probably metastasized. She needed a splenectomy ASAP, but her platelets were dangerously low. She wasn't suffering, so we were committed to anything it would take to make her well again. She spent a combined total of 10 days in the hospital with a few days at home in between, while being pumped with meds to try increasing her platelets. Nothing was working, so as a last resort, we were presented with the option of a platelet transfusion in order to do the surgery. Unfortunately, there was still a very good chance she wouldn't make it through, and even if she did, chemotherapy would not be an option due to her low platelets. NOT ONCE did we have to consider the cost of the surgery and/or chemotherapy because we had Healthy Paws standing behind us. But not wanting to put her through all of that, we switched to comfort care mode, until her symptoms returned with a vengeance and we knew it was time to say goodbye. My husband would have mortgaged our house for his baby girl if necessary, but after $20,000 invoiced, we were only out-of-pocket an affordable $4000. We will never get another dog WITHOUT Healthy Paws. The peace of mind alone is worth every penny.
title: Money was no object

text: Healthy Paws is the reason that my dog is alive, period.  I adopted a Lab/Pit mutt named Bagel when he was four months old.  Sadly, when bagel was 4y.o. he became paralyzed from the waist down due to degenerative disc disease.  The cost of surgery was $12,000.00 and it worked... until six months later it happened again.  The vet told me his odds of survival were low and I decided to do the surgery anyway, another $12,000.00.  This time... it worked. I'm so glad I made that choice.  Bagel was doing fantastic for two years and now my poor sweet dog at the young age of 7y.o. has a brain tumor.  He obviously has the worst luck.  Ending your dog's life is something you know you will have to do at some point but certainly not at 4 years old, and hopefully not at 7 years old. I decided to do radiation for Bagel and he is now recovering.  Radiation was $20,000.00.  Needless to say without Healthy Paws' contribution I could have never afforded all of these huge ticket treatments.  I submit my recent claims to healthy paws on a Tuesday and I had an approval Wednesday with money back in my bank on Thursday.  No questions asked.... just a follow up e-mail from them asking how Bagel is doing with treatment.  I couldn't recommend a better insurance company and if you have a dog these days it's absolutely necessary.

Really poor experience from Healthy Paws. They had no issues taking money from me for 7 years, but never helped when we needed it.

I've had multiple customer service interactions and am told if I can't get the soap notes, I'll need go to a vet to get a new checkup with "soap notes", and any claims that occurred before that time would not be valid.

text: My cat recently went through some health issues that required him to stay multiple days in the ER.  He needed many tests done to determine what was wrong as well as around the clock care that required an IV and catheter.  Needless to say, the treatment was very expensive.  Healthy Paws was incredible.  They have an easy system of submitting a claim, and reimbursed us so quickly and efficiently.  They always show great kindness and check in on Ollie. text:
Healthy Paws pet insurance is superlative. I have had a policy on both of my dogs as soon as I could get one when they were babies. Fast forward almost three years and Phoenix (large mixed breed) just needed major surgery. If not for Healthy Paws coverage he would have been unable to use his rear legs since the surgery itself cost more than I could afford. 

At first he had a partial crucial ligament tear in his rear left knee and was scheduled for surgery, but as he used his other rear right leg to support half of his body weight leading up to the surgery, he completely tore his rear right knee two days before the scheduled surgery on his rear left knee. As a result, the surgeon suggested it was best to operate on that completely torn rear right knee first. 

The TPLO surgery so far was a success and once this rear right knee has healed he will need another TPLO surgery for the rear left knee that was originally the only knee to need surgery. 

Within a week, I was reimbursed from Healthy Paws the 80% elected coverage from the surgery with ease. I cannot express how important it is to have a policy with Healthy Paws because like all insurance, you hope to never need to use it, but it is worth it when you need it.

With the cost savings by Healthy Paws of this single surgical procedure thus far, my policy has paid for itself and will continue to do so. 

Thank you Healthy Paws for the benefits with the policy coverage. Hands down, I highly recommend your coverage to all pet owners.
title: Healthy Paws pet insurance is superlative!

text: We've had Healthy Paws coverage for our dog for years, and they've been outstanding at providing quick, easy reimbursements for medical issues. So when my dog was considered critical for a bladder blockage and my vet sent us to the ER immediately, I knew this was going to be expensive. After a successful surgery to remove 50+ bladder stones, with 1 stuck in her urethra, she still would not urinate which had her hospital stay extended a few more days.  All I kept saying was thank goodness we have Healthy Paws Insurance.  The financial stress that would've been added during this time was eliminated.  I love that you pick your own plan; choose your deductible, and your splits...and payment is ALWAYS SUPER QUICK!  If this doesn't convince you enough to chose Healthy Paws for your pet insurance, how about them emailing me afterwards to check on Bailey!!!  What insurance company does that???  I highly, highly, highly, recommend Healthy Paws Pet Insurance!!

text:
I'm so thankful we chose Healthy Paws for our dog Wolfgang's health insurance when he was just a puppy! The contract was straightforward to understand -- and Healthy Paws has ALWAYS reimbursed what we agreed to and the percentage. There's no fine print loopholes, which is a tremendous relief.

The on-line claim submission is easy and reimbursements happen quickly -- usually within a week! Amazing. 

Premiums have risen, proportionate to overall cost of veterinary care. We were told upfront this would happen, but it would not be increased due to any claims. I've found this to be true.

Our first claim was after a bad car accident and Wolfgang was seen at an emergency vet. It was pretty late in a traumatic day so I called in the hopes someone could walk me through the process. A lovely, compassionate woman answered the phone and got the ball rolling. Rehab was recommended after the complex surgery, and Healthy Paws covered the number of visits the vet recommended. I am certain this is why Wolfgang doesn't have mobility issues at nearly 10 years old!

Eight years later, Wolfgang is having GI issues that our primary vet recommended we see a specialist for. Healthy Paws is still covering what we agreed to in the policy, in a timely manner and with compassion. 

If you're looking for pet health insurance (and you really should) Healthy Paws is the best company to use.
title: I'm so thankful we chose Healthy Paws‚Ä¶

text:
I will definitely recommend Healthy Paw to anyone who is searching for a pet insurance plan. I chose Healthy Paw because it is the pet insurance plan with the most prestigious reviews on a Chinese social media platform Xiaohongshu (The Red Book). 

My cat was diagnosed with urinary blockage one month ago, and we have brought him to the ER & primary care several times since his issue was a little bit complicated. So I even told myself not to be too surprised if my claims will not be processed.

I will definitely recommend Healthy Paw to my other peers.

title: Peace of Mind and Worth It

text:
Our 1yo French Bulldog required a major airway surgery due to his BOAS (Brachycephalic Obstructive Airway Syndrome). This operation entails a Soft Palate Resection, widening of his nares, a tonsillectomy and removal of his saccules and we also decided to neuter him at the same time so that he can avoid another round of anesthesia.

The operation was very stressful for us as a family - mainly because we were worried about the outcome and the recovery of such a major surgery but also due to the cost of the operation itself.

Because the operation is so invasive, he required an overnight stay for monitoring along with medication to follow during his recovery. The estimate of the surgery was between $6700 to $7600. 

Due to the tremendous impact that this surgery would have on his quality of life, we decided to move forward with the surgery and we are happy to report that he is healing very well and is a totally different dog who can actually breathe now! (It ended up costing just under $7100)

The plus was that Healthy Paws was there to help us with the cost of the surgery and we were reimbursed the promised 70% of our coverage! 

We are over the moon with the result of his surgery as well as Healthy Paw's insurance coverage. What a relief all the way around!

We recommend HealthyPaws to all of our friends with pets!
title: BOAS Surgery for 1 yo Frenchie

text: I‚Äôve had Healthy Paws insurance 10 years for my dogs.  It has been extremely ‚Äúuser friendly‚Äù for filing claims (takes me just a couple minutes online), has never given me a claim judgment that was not fair, and has seamlessly covered even very expensive conditions such as autoimmune disease, chronic gastrointestinal problems, eye issues, injuries, and complex surgeries including multiple mass removals and biopsies, correction of a spinal ("corkscrew" tail joint) malformation, severe malocclusion improvement (Boston Terrier, need I say more?), and more. I've had other insurances in the past that presented constant frustration regarding claims, but Healthy Paws has made my dogs' health care so much easier and less expensive.  As a senior, I daily appreciate that I can adopt dogs and not worry about future costly health issues affecting their care. Also, kudos to HP for promoting pet rescue and really meaning it!

title: Healthy Paws is good pet insurance

text: It's my belief that the people who tend to write reviews are the ones who are upset, who have an axe to grind (how often do you write a review because you're so darn satisfied!!). So I want to share my experience with Healthy Paws pet insurance. I've had Healthy Paws for my golden retriever since 2019. We purchased the policy when she was 1 year old, so prior to any pre-existing conditions. She had an unexpected dental issue with what was basically the dog version of ingrown "wisdom" teeth in 2020. While the policy does normally cover most dental issues, we were pleasantly surprised when we submitted a claim for her issue for ~$3500 and it was reimbursed, with an explanation why - in this case - although it was dental it was covered under the policy (we did not expect that). Fast forward to 2023. We live in the SF Bay area, so an expensive place to live - including vet care. Accordingly our policy goes up a decent amount every year (we are at ~110/month right now). In October, our dog develop dilated cardiomyopathy. We're probably $5000-6000 in vet bills in the last 60 days and Healthy Paws has reimbursed us for every bill we've submitted. Not only that, the submission process is incredibly easy and they typically direct deposit the funds into my bank account within 48 hours. I sincerely wish we were the customers who paid for nothing more than peace of mind, because our dog never got sick. Unfortunately, we're the customers who get to be thankful we purchased and maintained pet insurance for our pup who ended up with a chronic and expensive health condition. Our experience with Healthy Paws has been nothing short of wonderful and has made this very difficult time a little easier.
title: Excellent Experience

text:
Been with them 10 years. 1 dog for 10, 2nd for 7. Paid out lots of $$ over $16,000. Reimbursement- $656.52 after deductibles. They used to have late payment option by a few days. Removed it without notifying anyone. Noticed this was after they lost a BIG class action lawsuit. Have a medical emergency in my family and requested a 3 day late payment. 3 days. Denied. Customer service non existent. Had asked about this before and they kept saying I wasn‚Äôt a customer and couldn‚Äôt find my account but they could keep getting direct payments. There‚Äôs other companies out there now with more services. Recommend new people search for better options. We pay more $$$ per month for pet insurance than ours. Get less consideration for loyal customer. 3 days delay. 3. Seriously. It‚Äôs not like they‚Äôre not going to get their money.

Update: regarding their reply. They missed the point of my complaint. 1. I paid out a large amount over the years and used them very little because I kept our dogs healthy. I did not complain about the reimbursement it was in comparison to what I paid in. 2. They never notified customers of a change in policy. 3. A 3 day grace period for a long time customer is hardly an imposition or impossibility.

To others: there‚Äôs many new companies that offer wellness services etc now. Check them out. I  recommended HPI prior. They want loyalty but don‚Äôt extend it. You can also set aside the same amount you‚Äôd pay an insurance company every month - and if you keep your pets healthy - you‚Äôd have plenty to take care of them as they age. 
When a company loses a large lawsuit regarding practices, the company doesn‚Äôt pay. The customers do. Choose your company wisely. My two cents.
title: Been with them 10 years

text:
I am so thankful I decided to purchase Healthy Paws insurance when I first got my pup and have nothing but gratitude for the quick and professional manner in which this company operated in processing a recent claim. title: A company with Integrity and Compassion

text:
This company is really great - at avoiding paying for claims by wearing you down until you finally give up. Trying to explain to a brick wall how the word ‚Äúurine‚Äù on a claim does not mean it is related to a history of urinary tract health has been among the most painful experiences of my life, and my cat is still very, very sick. Not, however, due to a pre-existing condition. But yeah, sure, let me do all the leg work to prove it is unrelated, since you can‚Äôt read and have no idea how labs work. Convenient for a (pet) health insurance company. A quick rundown - both humans and pets have a couple of commonly tested fluids, specifically blood, saliva, and urine. Urinalysis is not only completed to evaluate urinary tract health. I really just want to shout ‚ÄúDUH‚Äù at the morons processing these claims, and even more at the people writing their guidelines and training them. I pay money to this company with the idea that it will REDUCE stress in the event of horrible illness or accident for one of my pets, but time and again it only INCREASES the stress. I have paid far more in premiums than I will ever get back, which is obviously their goal, but the years they have taken off my life are more than they are allowed to collect. You can‚Äôt be there for your pet if the insurance company drives you off a cliff. Don‚Äôt do it.

As you can see from the response, they do respond when you complain enough. The submission of claims on the website says you can attach additional information if you like, but how many of us are provided with the vet‚Äôs chart notes at a visit? Perhaps they could ask for that before just denying a claim? The system is flawed. Easier to blame the policyholder.
title: Needs work

text:
Brownie's been my best friend for almost nine years. We've shared countless tail wags, muddy paw prints, and a whole lot of love. I always knew I needed the best insurance to protect her health, so I picked Healthy Paws ‚Äì and let me tell you, it's been the smartest decision ever.

For eight years, things were easy. Brownie was as healthy as a pup can be, just needing routine checkups and shots. Healthy Paws was there in the background, like a silent superhero ready to leap if trouble ever showed up.

But nine months ago, everything changed. Brownie got hit with bone cancer. My heart broke, but I knew we had to fight. That's when Healthy Paws became more than just an insurance company ‚Äì they became our partners in this battle.

Filing the first claim was a breeze. No endless paperwork, no hoops to jump through, just quick and understanding support. Every single claim ‚Äì all $30,000+ for radiation, chemo, surgery, even her heartbreaking amputation ‚Äì was approved and in my bank account within 10 days! It was like a financial superhero delivering a truckload of cash, letting me focus on what mattered most ‚Äì getting Brownie better.

But it wasn't just about the money. The Healthy Paws team was amazing. They called to check on Brownie, offered words of encouragement, and treated her like their own furry family. Their compassion was a lifesaver during those dark days.

Recently, Brownie's had another setback ‚Äì congestive heart failure, likely from the chemo. And guess what? Healthy Paws is right there again, ready to fight alongside us.

My experience with Healthy Paws has been incredible. They've gone above and beyond, making them way better than any other insurance company I've ever dealt with, for pets or people. They're not just a policy, they're a promise of support, a safety net when the world throws you a curveball.

If you have a furry friend you adore, don't think twice. Get Healthy Paws Pet Insurance. It's not just insurance, it's peace of mind. It's knowing that no matter what life throws your pup's way, they won't face it alone.

Thank you, Healthy Paws, for being Brownie's miracle. You gave me the strength to fight, the hope to keep believing, and the unwavering support to never give up. You're not just an insurance company, you're heroes with furry-friend hearts.

A forever Healthy Paws customer and Brownie's biggest cheerleader.
title: Brownie's been my bBrownie's Journey: Why Healthy Paws Became My Rockest friend for‚Ä¶

text: I have been with this company since January 2019 . I had 2 dogs covered paying over $300 monthly. I never made a claim and never missed a payment before a debit card change in July. They couldn't care less about the fact that we have been long term clients with no claims and now my dogs are older and it will be hard to get reasonable coverage for them .They are supposed to care about pets , they are part of a non-profit , but they are really just concerned about their bottom line and no concern at all for the fact that my dogs are older now 12yrs and 10yrs and more likely to be having a claim in the later years of their life with absolutely no consideration for the fact that they have made thousands of dollars off of my dogs youth and health.The new quote is double the payment amount with 30-40 percent less coverage with 4x the deductible - Total RIP OFF from a company that has made thousands off of these two dogs with 0 claims for so many years. The reps got real rude and defensive when I let them know I wanted to escalate a complaint.They would not give me a viable method to file a formal complaint.He first gave a PO Box to mail a complaint. I asked for other options and whether somone could contact me . He sarcastically suggested BBB so I have complained there as well. Don't subscribe to Healthy paws. If you love your dogs, keep researching and get coverage with a company that loves pets too!!!

text: I have been a very happy Healthy Paws customer since 2018, about 6 months after I got my Boxer puppy, who is now almost 6 years old. I did a lot of research before getting a dog on the pros and cons of pet insurance and everyone had strong opinions on the matter. Some felt it was a scam and you should just "budget for vet bills" when getting a dog. This would be ideal for all of us, but sometimes unexpected things happen, no matter how much you plan and budget. Others simply don't have the resources to pay for thousands of dollars in vet bills. Some felt pet insurance was a great idea as it provided critical support for their pet's health needs. I initially decided to wait, and after 6 months of "puppy things" that brought me to the vet on several occasions, I decided to purchase pet insurance. I did a lot of digging and came across Healthy Paws. I was drawn to them for a few reasons: they had great reviews on their customer service and there were various choices for pet owners, including annual deductible amounts and reimbursement rates (70-90%). Up until very recently, my dog has been fairly healthy with a few minor things/medications, etc. I have never had any issues being reimbursed at the 80% rate I selected. The claims process is SO simple and I generally receive funds in my account within 48-72 hours of filing. Most recently, my dog has had several vet visits and procedures to rule out bladder cancer. It was terrifying, however, knowing I had Healthy Paws made it SO much easier to handle. I was able to get all the testing and procedures needed to get an official diagnosis that was NOT CANCER (!!!) And I received reimbursement for all of it. Getting pet insurance with Healthy Paws was one of the best decisions I have made in my dog mom life and I am so grateful to the Healthy Paws family for all they have done.
title: Happy Healthy Paws Customer - 6 Years & Counting

text:
I've been a customer of Healthy Paws Pet Insurance & Foundation for over five years for my growing family of animals.  During that time, I'd (fortunately) never encountered any situation where the support of Healthy Paws was needed.

A few weeks ago, one of my cats became very ill, very quickly, and upon arriving at the emergency veterinarian, I learned that he needed surgery to treat an intestinal blockage caused by the sudden onset of a condition called intussusception.  After two surgeries and five days in the ICU, I was blessed to get my little guy back home, safe and sound, and he is currently fantastic and back to normal, making a full recovery.

I was prepared to spend whatever money necessary out of my own pocket to ensure that my little guy received the best care he possibly could, not knowing whether Healthy Paws would honor the claims I would submit. This thinking was influenced by stories I've read about other pet insurance carriers, as well as personal experiences with human health insurance carriers.

I ended up spending north of $15k on his care, which I would do again in a heartbeat.  Healthy Paws honored ALL of my claims, reimbursed the maximum to which I was entitled under my particular coverage, and did this within a few days of my submission of these claims.  The direct deposits cleared within 24 hours of the claims being processed.  Each claim was incredibly clear about what would, and would not, be reimbursed, and there were no surprises whatsoever.  When speaking on the phone with Healthy Paws representatives to answer questions I had, the team was incredibly kind, compassionate, responsive, and helpful.

I am so thankful for the support of the team at Healthy Paws Pet Insurance & Foundation during this time and the peace of mind they've given me, and the support they've provided to ensure that my animals can receive the best care possible when it is needed.  I will be a customer for life.
title: Customer for Life

text:
I highly recommend buying Healthy Paws Pet Insurance for your pets.

First of all, you should always buy pet insurance, especially for a first-time parent like me, and it is never too early! You can rule out more pre-existing conditions. Also, even a young pet can get unexpected diseases. My cat Felix got diagnosed with cancer even though he is only 5 yo. Without my insurance, I could hardly afford the diagnosis procedure (lab test, blood work, etc.), let alone any treatment plan. But since I have the insurance, I can work with my vet to have some treatments for Felix to help him feel better, and seek help from more expensive specialists, without worrying too much about the financial impact.

Second, from my personal experience, Healthy Paws Insurance feels pretty decent. The premium is not that expensive (at least for young pets, my cat was still young so I don't know how it will turn out for more senior pets) in my case. I didn't set a super low deductible though, you might need to pay more if you want a lower deductible, but I feel good with mine. It covers the diagnosis and treatment of almost every disease, as long as it is not a pre-existing condition. I know it doesn't cover any dental treatment, which I do feel kind of disappointing. But I don't know if there is anyone in the market who covers it so I am fine with it. It doesn't cover the office visit fee or consultation fee, which is a bummer, as I live in a place where the office visit fee is quite expensive. For the pre-existing condition, I don't think you should turn around if your pet already has any condition (unless it is lethal), because it can still have you covered in other situations. And one tip, if you plan to buy the insurance and your pet is healthy without any medical record, take it for examination as soon as possible to rule out any pre-existing conditions. The reimbursement process is also very quick in Healthy Paws. I usually get my reimbursement 2~3 days after I file the claim, and it is pretty smooth. And I like the fact that they don't have any cap for the reimbursement. Some diseases can get very expensive. I remember when I quoted all the companies, there are quite some that have a maximum reimbursement amount (yearly or lifetime). Some have adjustable caps based on the premium. And I would say those caps are usually too low for situations like accidents and cancers. Maybe it is because of where I live, but still, I feel it is very easy to exceed the cap in quite common situations.

Therefore, I would recommend buying Healthy Paws Pet Insurance because of my experience and the fact that I believe it is a necessity to buy pet insurance. I hope my experience can help you make the correct decision.
title: Recommend

text: I can't recommend Healthy Paws enough! I've had their insurance for both of my dogs for years and it's the number one thing (and number one company) I recommend to all my friends and family who are pet owners. Their policies are clear, their site is easy, and it's so nice to know that you'll have one less headache to deal with when all you want to do is focus on your pet's health. My dog went in for surgery on Thursday, I submitted the invoice online in about 2 mins, and I had a direct deposit for my reimbursement on Monday. You can't get better service than that. I even got an email from the Healthy Paws team asking after my dog and wishing him a speedy recovery. Highly recommend!
title: Such great insurance!

text: My dog was very sick and her treatment started with being admitted through the ER in the middle of the night. While I did not know what was ahead of us, I was positive that I wanted the vet to do everything they could to save her life. What I also did not know, is that she was far sicker than I was aware. I was surely worried about my dogs well being and the medical costs associated with her treatment. Healthy Paws was right there at the plate to assist empathetically with reimbursement of my dogs medical costs. Admittedly, I was not prepared for this veterinary expense, I honestly have no idea what I would have done without Healthy Paws caring attitude and expedient response. text: healthy paws will price you out of the market as your pet gets older.  They will take your premiums when the likelihood of needing to file a claim is less and when your dog ages they will raise premiums astronomically until most people have to drop it. text: Warning to customers.. do not submit cremation/end of life receipt until you have a chance to submit all other receipts. They will cancel your policy immediately and you will not have access to your account. Thankfully, I had pet insurance for Zeppelin. He was diagnosed with osteosarcoma at 5 yrs old. This led to several surgeries and chemo. I was happy with Healthy Paws until they canceled my account before I had a chance to submit all of my receipts. After Zeppelin's last surgery, which was front leg amputation, he lost the use of his back leg. This led to him only having the use in 2 legs. There was nothing left to do, I had to say goodbye to the love of my life. I had a mobile vet come to my house to send him to Heaven peacefully. Within a very short amount of time (same day) that I submitted the receipt for his cremation, they immediately canceled my account. I couldn't access it to see what claims had been submitted. I was satisfied with them until they did this at the end. I wanted to leave my review so that others will know what to expect.
title: Warning to customers..

text:
I have been a customer with Healthy Paws for over 7 years now and unfortunately they have gone from excellent to a headache. Claims that were covered in the past now are no longer covered. The constant having to call their customer service and fight has become exhausting. They have turned into the typical insurance company, denying claims and hoping that people won‚Äôt call and dispute it. On top of that my rates have doubled from the quote they originally gave me. Since posting I had a rep reach out to me and explain the coverage and benefits. While I still feel exams for specific bloodwork (bloodwork based on his current covered disease ) should be covered I understand now that it is not. Thank you again for reaching out.

text:
Expressing Appreciation for Healthy Paws' Support for My Service Dog.

I am writing to extend my profound appreciation for the remarkable support your team at Healthy Paws has consistently offered. I am particularly grateful for the attention and care that my service dog, has received.

My companion and service dog  is not just a well-trained working dog, but also my closest companion. He serves as my eyes, providing essential support given my limited vision, and greatly aids me in managing my other disabilities. 

However, lately, my best friend and service dog has been under the weather and is currently under medical attention.

Notably, his medical condition has attracted a collaborative response from veterinary specialists spanning Washington, Oregon, and even as far as the UC Davis Veterinary Teaching Medical Center in California. All of them are working tirelessly to aid his recovery, and we are hopeful for positive results.

In all of our interactions with these professionals, Healthy Paws Insurance has been prominently listed on service dog companion intake forms. Often, I am asked about the quality of service provided by Healthy Paws. My answer remains constant and resoundingly positive: aligning with Healthy Paws has been one of the best decisions I've ever made.

The exceptional care and support my best companion service dog and I have received from Healthy Paws have made a significant difference in our lives. Therefore, I take this opportunity to express my deepest gratitude for your services. It is comforting to know that as we navigate this difficult time, we can rely on the unwavering support from the Healthy Paws family.

Thank you once again for your extraordinary commitment to my dogs health and wellbeing.
title: Expressing Appreciation for Healthy‚Ä¶

healthy paws is just a scam
do not trust them. they will take your money for years and then once you have a problem make it impossible to get a reinbursment. you only see how dishonest and deceiving this health insurance is when you file your first claim! even if your dog is super healthy and it is 100% obvious the problem was just an accident.

Even if they end up accepting this specific claim I think this is very DISHONEST. text: I'm always a bit cynical about insurance companies and their coverage, but I could fill a page with accolades for Healthy Paws.We took our cat Aspen to our vet because he was having a problem urinating, he was diagnosed with bladder stones which required surgery, ended up being two surgeries because some of the stones were attached to his bladder. We filed two claims, one for the original diagnosis and one for the two surgeries and two night stay at the vets. Both of these claims totaled $7164.68 and Healthy Paws covered $6911.07 of this and paid 90%, for a total of $6219.96 and received the first check in about a week, did automatic deposit to my checking account for the second payment and had it in about three days. I wasn't even expecting half of this. Also, Healthy Paws has contacted me at least twice checking on how Aspen is doing. I know nothing about other pet insurance companies, but I do know about Healthy Paws and I can't imagine that there is anyone better, if as good. Thank you Healthy Paws!

text: Our sweet boy had full CCL and meniscus surgery one week ago. Within 5 days, the claim for surgery was processed, approved and paid. Healthy Paws even sent an email to check on my dog. Thank you for making this process stress free!
title: Excellent service

text: Our ten year old Yorkie has been covered by Healthy Paws since age 2.  She had no significant health problems until age 8 when she was diagnosed with pancreatitis, diabetes, a pyloric mass and IBD all within one year.  She had no less than 6 hospital admissions in 2022.  I'm grateful to say our baby has since been stable and is doing well (still acts like a puppy!) - and we would not have gotten to this point without HP coverage.  Her care last year cost over $20k, of which we paid a small fraction. HP continues to assist with coverage of her daily meds, including insulin and supplies.  HP strong points: easy filing of claims and fast reimbursement (usually < 4 business days), compassionate and knowledgeable customer service, flexible coverage and deductible plans, and I've never once appreciated resistance from the insurer to cover under the terms of what was outlined in original policy documents.  Downsides include having to pay out of pocket upfront, no assistance with preventive care and exam fees (either regular vet visits or ER initial exam fees), but that's minor and I think fair considering what is covered.  I saw a review bemoaning the gradual increase in the cost of the plan, but that's expected as a dog ages and/or with the development of new medical problems.  Our plan has gradually increased a mere $100 since enrollment, which seems reasonable considering how much HP has saved us in medical expenses.  So, in short: strongly recommend.
title: Strongly recommend

text: Ive had healthy paws for 5 years coming up next month and submited a claim in 2018, healthy paws payed me for this claim without recieveing records even thou in their policy they REQUIRE records within 12 months of singing up. This is important because this record 12 months of signing up they use as a base line for your pet (would make more sense to only sign you up if they have this but it benifits them in the end). So if they dont request records like they should that first year or any of the following years informing you they need it when your dog gets a life changing diagnosis at 5 years old and lots of vet bills they can say this is their baseline now because your previous vet permanently closed and you have no coverage even thou you have been paying monthly for 5 years straight. I recomending staying away because they are very dodgy on the phone and dont see the logic in my dog physically not being able to have the same diagnosis at 1 years old and just keep repeating their flawed policies over and over again. EDIT: seeing as i cant reply to the comment, your company states in every email is some verbiage if this is the first claim we require records if the second or third we have them on file. So you make people think you have it already but you dont. Also its funny that you declined my 7th claim due to findings on my 2nd claim that you now consider my baseline exam but you approved my 2nd claim? Your entire buisness is structured around not recieveing the correct information until life threatning diseases are found then you enforce them. Ruining peoples lives that have relied on you for 5 YEARS..... thank you again for destroying my finacial life from trusting almost 100$ a month to you to cover nothing. Their staff also send emails requesting for records every claim i know this because on the phone trying to figure out my 6th claim they declined and now stating they are declining coverage on all futher claims they told me this. I also had to call multiple times to have them find this email and upload it into the records. So i know they requested it on the first claim and i know my vet that is now closed sent it but they lost it and now wont admit to their mistake.
title: Please read if you currently have or thinking about getting healthy paws

text: This was literally the worst pet insurance experience of my lifetime.  I recently changed the insurance I had for my two dogs to Healthy Paws.  When I filed my very first claim I received a long list of "pre-existing conditions" that I was informed would not be covered by my policy.  One included "hip issues."  My dog is 3 and has never experienced a hip issue.  What happened, and was documented in her record, was that I asked my vet when she was a puppy if I should give her glucosamine as a preventative to prevent any hip issues.  My vet endorsed that and documented that in my dog's record (that she's taking glucosamine).  This resulted in me being informed that if my dog ever had a hip issue it would not be covered by Healthy Paws.  They also went through a litany of other issues that would not be covered which were also questions that my vet documented. My dog is literally completely healthy but after changing insurance plans she is now tagged as having multiple pre-existing conditions that she won't be covered for.  I have canceled my policy and gone back to ASPCA.  I have never been so disappointed by an insurance plan.  In my opinion, this company is simply looking for ways to deny claims and collect premiums.  I absolutely do not endorse using this company under any circumstances and recommend avoiding them if you are looking for quality insurance coverage for your pet.
title: Worst pet insurance experience ever

The ease of the process allowed us to focus on our dogs recovery and not worry about the insurance process. I only wish our healthcare coverage was as efficient!

text: Worst experience ever with this company. Its a lie that they pay out whatever percentage you are paying for. They do not pay for any exam fees which when your pet has cancer is what costs the most. The actual part that they pay out of a $2500 bill is for the chemo which is only $115. Just about everything else that made up the $2500 bill was considered by Healthy Paws as an exam and therefore does not get paid back to the customer. Not only that, they do not actually pay out claims in the 2 day or even 10 days after submitting a claim. I submitted a claim back on 5.2.2023, today is 6.26.2023 and they still haven't paid for it. I called in, asked to speak to a manager who and I have it on recording, says there is no way to expedite my claim nor is there a set number of days where it would be considered to long to wait. In other words they can hold off on paying out a claim for over a year without you being able to escalate it to have it taken care of faster. You are at their mercy. I have been a customer since 2019 when i had the necessary exam done when I first signed up, and we had no issues or vet visits until recently and NOW they were telling us that exam we did after signing up wasn't eligeable because they didn't have the right medical records? All the records were uploaded. They wanted me to wait the 15 day grace period AGAIN starting 5.2.2023, even though I'd already been a paying customer for FOUR years at that point AND did the initial exam. I had to send the medical records for that 2019 exam several times until they decided they will look over my 2023 claims again to SEE if they can allow them to be covered. Why had I been paying for FOUR years when apparently they didn't have the information they needed? Only now do I find out? And now ALL of my claims (which I've had a lot now since my cat has cancer) are being held up. I'm over $6K down, thinking I was going to be ok because they'd cover 70% of the bills only to find out I've been basically lied to and IF they cover things, it'll be a small amount, and I could be waiting for them to even pay THAT out for basically ever. DO NOT use these people. I regret signing up and believing the reviews. I don't see how they're made by real people. I'm happy to send anyone who wants the video recording of my call to anyone who request it. Send me an email to retteg39gmailcom.  Oh and you can never speak with the same person. The supervisor will also refuse to transfer you to their manager. They hung up on my and never called me back. also have a recording of that.
title: Don't believe their marketing - they flat out lie.

text: My dog started having trouble breathing so we took her to our local pet ER. After tests, xrays, and an ultraound, they diagnosed her with pyothorax (fluid in her chest cavity). We transferred her to another vet that could do a CT scan then her surgery. After surgery, she was in the ICU for 10 days with a chest tube then another 2 days after the tube was removed, a total of 12 days. The total discharge bill was $20k plus a $5k ER bill. The plan we have has a $500 yearly deductible then 90% plan paid/10% customer paid. Our total out of pocket ended up being around $3k out of the $25k total bill. They saved her life because there was no way we would‚Äôve been able to afford it without knowing we‚Äôd be reimbursed. And they made the reimbursement process so easy. They called the vet and got the confirmation they needed and I got a direct deposit a few days later. Thank you so much Healthy Paws!
title: Healthy Paws saved my dogs life...

text: Have had them for 2 dogs and about to switch my other dog to them. My late dog had a brain tumor and they were awesome. When i terminated my insurance after my dog passed away they sent me a reimbursement check dor the cremation even though I had not filed a claim for that. My current dog has had valley fever and two ACL tears and they covered both surgeries and the valley fever tests and meds. When i submit a claim i get an answer within 2 days usually.

text:
Healthy Paws has always been with us in our times of struggle with our pets. We have a rare juvenile diabetic cat (pancreas stopped producing insulin suddenly at age 2) who spent nearly a month in the hospital due to multiple episodes of DKA and hypoglycemia.

Without Healthy Paws, although we make pretty good money, pet ownership would be financially challenging due to the incredibly expensive costs of emergency care where we live.

We also really appreciate the humanity of the foundation which regularly asks us how our diabetic cat is doing.

Healthy Paws has never rejected a claim related to these juvenile-diabetes-related incidents although you could easily buy a new car with the amount of money they reimbursed while the condition is rare enough that our very qualified vet needed to consult with a researcher from UPenn about the case.

Our other cat once needed an X-Ray after a fall gave him back pain, they also covered that without questions.

We are infinitely grateful that Healthy Paws helped us give a life to our little cat she would otherwise not have been able to have.
title: Excellent support through the worst crises.

text: Our puppy was electrocuted and was hospitalized for six days. If it wasn‚Äôt for our friends that recommended insurance through Healthy Paws, we would have had to put Odysseus down. Healthy Paws is affordable and covers almost everything. All we had to do is take a picture of the paid invoice and upload it to the app. It was also easy to speak to customer service on the phone. We can‚Äôt speak highly enough about the company.
title: Electrocuted Puppy

text: Healthy Paws has been amazing. They have clear and transparent rules, efficient and fast processing of claims and are friendly and caring! Getting reimbursed is not something you want to have to worry about when your pet is sick and Healthy Paws keeps the promise of making your life just that much easier. I have 2 cats and have had around 5 claims through Healthy Paws.
title: Healthy Paws has been amazing

text:
My cat passed away on 5/15/23. I received an email stating my policy has been cancelled on 6/1/23. I was charged for June on 6/7/23, but the payment declined because I moved money out of that account. I received an email stating they hoped me and my (deceased) cat were well and telling me my payment didn‚Äôt go through. I call, waste 1.5 hours on the phone with 2 supervisors. They can‚Äôt find the email THEIR company sent me. I have to forward it to them several times. And no one can answer why my card was erroneously charged, when my policy actually will be cancelled, or whether I may be charged again. I was actually told they could not guarantee that I don‚Äôt get charged again, for a cancelled policy for a cat who died last month. No one in customer service can turn off autopay or delete my billing info. They can‚Äôt even cancel the account. They have to send a request which can take 10 business days to some mysterious payment department that has no way to contact them. It was traumatizing to receive an email asking how my poor dead kitty was doing. And every email I‚Äôve received is an obvious form letter. No actual personalized customer service. This company doesn‚Äôt care about your pets, only their money. They‚Äôll even keep taking your money after they tell you the policy is cancelled because your animal died. Do not recommend to anyone.

UPDATE 6/9/23: Received an email from a Customer Liaison Manager stating they‚Äôve attached a notice of cancellation. They actually attached a copy of this 1-star review. That tells me two things: 1) this company has little to no QC process, even when dealing with incredibly frustrated customers. 2) the email I received was solely because I left a poor review. My several emails and calls did not matter. So if you review here, you‚Äôll get a response, but you still might not get what you need. I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôll get that cancellation notice someday‚Ä¶
title: Continues to charge me for cancelled policy for dead cat

text:
I can't say enough about Healthy Paws and the care they have enabled me to give my dogs! They came through every time. My dogs ended up being pretty high maintenance and there were many expensive hospital and vet bills over there lifespan. The peace of mind is invaluable in knowing that whatever procedure is needed to help your pet, can be given without hesitation knowing that Healthy Paws will be there for you and your pets! That is invaluable!! All of  their many Vets know that whatever procedure or treatment they think my dogs need, I would not hesitate to say: "Yes, do it!" They always have to ask anyway. I thank them so much for their kindness and consideration thought all the challenges and especially my Fur Angel's last days.! I just received a condolences card from them that brought the tears flowing again as they are right now in writing this! My dogs are my joy, stress and purpose and as soon as I feel I am ready for more, Healthy Paws will be my first email!
God Bless You Healthy Paws!
R/Larry

text:

Currently shopping for another carrier but I am beginning to think these pet insurance companies are all scam artists taking advantage of people because they know we'd do whatever we could for our pets. 

Update as requested: I2259722A Submit date: 12/28/22.  I am using my middle name on this site, just fyi. Please contact me privately from here on out.

text: Getting pet insurance with Healthy Paws for our dog has been one of the best decisions we have made!  We have never had any issues with submitting a claim and getting reimbursed for it (after deductible is met of course).  I will admit, their rates compared to other pet insurance companies is not the lowest, but they are comparable, and that is OK because of the great benefits they provide!  One of the best benefits of Healthy Paws is that they do not have a cap on maximum annual or lifetime payouts.  Our dog has had two costly surgeries, and we have been reimbursed for a majority of the costs, based on the plan we have.  In most cases, the only thing not covered was the vet exam fee, which is OK because that is noted as something not covered when you sign up.  We will continue using Healthy Paws for as long as we own pets.
title: Best Pet Insurance Around

text: Throughout my adult life I have been owned by 4 dogs.  The first 3 dogs all went through cancer treatments and I had no insurance.  When I got Max as a puppy, I decided to get Healthy Paws pet insurance for him.  Ten years later and I know this was one of the best decisions I have ever made.   Max has undergone 4 surgeries, 2 difficult mass removals and 2 ruptured CCL replacements.  i opted for a 500.00 deductible with an 80% reimbursement rate.  Healthy Paws settled all 4 claims very quickly and without any issues.  Their website is easily navigated and the claim submission process is very simple.  I am so thankful I chose Healthy Paws.  If you love your pets and are willing to go to any lengths to keep them healthy. Pet insurance is a must.

title: Healthy Paws is peace of mind

text:
I have had Healthy Paws for YEARS. In the past I have rated them 5/5 and had claims processed quickly and any issues handled swiftly. Customer service was second to none. Until my pet passed away.....
My dog passed away on the 16th of the month, I notified HP right away. I filed a claim for the cremation expenses, as covered by her medical condition. They still took out my premium on the 21st and have not processed my claim. I understand that things happen - however my communications with them have been less than helpful. The first time I emailed, they said it would be taken care of in a timely manner. 7 days go by, so I call customer service. They proceed to tell me that my claim will be processed on the 25th and my account will be closed and they will refund my premium. On the 26th I called back and and the gentleman on the other end of the phone proceeds to tell me that no one should have said that and that there are a 'lot of other sick dogs' so we will process your request as soon as possible.
I have been really nice in my communication with them, as I know things happen but this is a little ridiculous at this point. I also felt it was a little insensitive to say that my claim was being held up because there are a 'lot of other sick dogs'.
I really expected better, Healthy Paws... you were a big part of helping us when we needed it. Now I feel like we don't matter because you're not going to get a monthly premium from us anymore.
title: Making a bad situation WORSE

text: I am so happy I decided to get pet insurance for my dog and I'm even happier that I chose Healthy Paws as the insurance for my dog. I'm embarrased to admit that I've submitted more pet insurance claims than I wished. My dog is very high maintenence and he seems to get himself checked into the vet a lot... or perhaps he loves vet visits and does what he can to keep going back. Either way, knowing that this insurance is supporting us financially makes me feel better.  Their website and app are very easy to use and I look forward to seeing my reimbursement checks in the mail. So if your dog/dog breed is known to be on the higher vet-visiting side, I highly recommend signing up with Healthy Paws. Thank you Healthy Paws for helping me keep my dog healthy and alive.

text: We've had Healthy Paws insurance for a few years, and plenty of places recommended not having pet insurance, but we never got rid of it. Then our 2 year old black cat Manny got bitten by a rattlesnake, and we had to rush him to the ER. The hospitalization and medication cost over $3000, but when we got him back, he was very depressed and sitting in the litterbox. It turns out the stress from the whole situation caused a urinary blockage, so we had to rush him back to the vet to remove the blockage and hospitalize him until the numbers on the bloodwork looked better. That cost us over $4000, but after several claims which were processed fairly fast, Healthy Paws paid for the lion's share of our costs, and checked in with us to ask how Manny was doing (he's back to his old self now). There were definitely times we were worried we wouldn't be able to cover his costs, but Healthy Paws helped us through the entire time.

title: Healthy Paws Pet Insurance is great!

text:
I have had healthy paws since 2017. It used to be quick and easy to submit claims via the app and get reimbursed when I first got insurance for my 2 cats. In the past few years, I have had progressive difficulty in getting claims processed. Specific issues:
1) You can only have 3 pets per email account. I have 4 pets, so couldn't get my fourth pet added to the same account. 
2) Issues getting claims processed: When additional information was requested, I emailed the documents, per their request. When I continued to get emails requesting the same information, I had to call so the operator could manually add the information to the claim. This happened for multiple claims. I shouldn't have to call for every claim to ensure the information I sent via the method they requested gets added to the claim. 
3) Claims getting denied: my most recent claim was denied. I have had 4 claims for the exact same issue (rehabilitation consult + treatment) approved for this pet. They are now making me appeal this claim because "consult" is not covered - even though rehabilitation services are covered and the exact same invoice item has been covered 4 times. 

Overall, I am disappointed in this company and no longer recommend them. They will do everything they can to deny claims and you have to call repeatedly to get claims approved.
title: Significant decline in service over time

text: Great service -- affordable, easy to file claims, good customer service, fair -- would highly recommend.

title: The ease of submitting a claim

text:
I only gave one star because there is no zero. (Updated to a two)

DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON PET HEALTH INSURANCE. They prove themselves to be a scam of epic proportions. 

I religiously paid my monthly fee to Healthy Paws Insurance for 9 years for my precious Wally, so in the event of an emergency I would be covered and not have to ask myself, "Can I afford this service for my beloved." 

Healthy Paws never ever ever covered any health services over the years. NOTHING. I had two emergencies over his nine years and they always had an excuse. 

Last month Wally was diagnosed with cancer. I wouldn't put him through chemo but there were emergency services just to figure out what was wrong with him. $4K later I had to say goodbye to my boy. Healthy Paws reimbursed me $375. That is $375 TOTAL over 9 YEARS and two emergencies.

So F YOU Healthy Paws. A big GARGANTUOUS F YOU. You don't care at all about your customers or their beloved fuzzy four-leggeds. You covered NOTHING over the course of nine years of paying every single month. A slap in the face to every pet owner. You are a scam. FAKES.

If you were even considering pet insurance, please just start your own pet savings account -- that is to say, put away some money every month in a separate account that you can access if/when your honey needs help. Pet insurance will cover next to nothing.  Healthy Paws isn't the only bad egg. They're all like this. 

@healthypaws F-you again.

To my beautiful Wally, may you rest in peace.

REPLY: Thank you for the reply. I talked to your claims team becuase it looks as though the entire emergency services invoice ($1700) was overlooked, therefore not included in my refund. It has been put back into claims so I might get more returned.
title: Don't even think about using Healthy Paws

text:
We have been using Healthy Paws since 2018, and I am so glad we chose this for our pet! As our cat is getting older he is needing more specialized care and increasingly more expensive.  Because we have pet insurance I feel more comfortable doing expensive surgeries (our bill went from $5,000 to $2000!) to actually get the care Alfie deserves! Without Healthy Paws we would definitely have  to make more considerations about treatment for Alfie. 

We have been able to do multiple rounds of ultrasounds and biopsies to get to the root cause of what is a typical cancer in cats as they age. If we didn't have insurance, we might not have been able to do these specialized treatments and had to stick to a broader less effective medication. It's already emotionally tolling to see him get older, so it's nice to have some of the financial burden lifted and do what's best for him.

text: Our Beagle had spinal surgery on 5/2/2023 due to her discs pressing up against the nerve causing her tremendous pain.  The vet recommended she be put down due to her extreme pain (8 years old) if after the MRI was completed (where the problem could be determined) if it couldn't be corrected.  Fortunately, surgery was an option and affording it was possible due to my having pet insurance with Healthy Paws.  They reimbursed my claim within one week of surgery through Direct Deposit.  When given the choice of being able to save our dog through surgery vs. having to put her down due to cost, that would have been difficult to handle.  She is coming along great and it makes me grateful to see her and spend time with her each day so she can live the rest of her normal life comfortably and happily.  Thank you!

text: I love Healthy Paws and the peace of mind it offers. My dog Winnie recently had to undergo an intense bladder surgery. I have received my reimbursements all well within a week of submitting my claims. I know a lot of people argue ‚Äúwhy not just put the monthly payment into a savings account‚Äù but I love being able to tell my vet ‚Äúdo whatever necessary‚Äù because I know it won‚Äôt ever cost me a lot of money. It‚Äôs a lot easier for me to make monthly payments to insurance knowing I‚Äôll have coverage no matter how large the cost versus hope that the amount I put into savings was enough. We have had coverage for Winnie since 2019, and if we had put the amount we pay into insurance for Winnie instead into savings, we would not have had the money to cover her bladder surgery, nor other vet treatments she has had in between 2019 to today. So incredibly worth it.
title: So Worth It

text:
I have used Healthy Paws since 2018. I have a large mixed breed dog and opted in for the premium coverage at 90%, paying $208.40 a month. In March 2023, I had a fraud detection on my credit card and needed to replace my credit card. I had auto payments set up on Healthy Paws and forgot to update payment on the app. 

This happened previously in Oct 2022 when my CC expiration date passed. They notified me via email and on the app notifications. I updated payment immediately and there was no issue, no lapse in the policy. This time however, I received no notifications of a missed payment (not via mail, email, phone call, or app). I asked for proof of notification and received none. Mind you, I have all other email correspondence receipts (every time the premium increased, every change to the policy, I have proof of all other emails with Healthy Paws), but there was not one notification of this missed payment for 2023. The only email I received was on April 23rd 2023, saying my policy was cancelled due to missed payment. 

I reached out immediately. They said they would not reinstate my policy even if I paid right away. Further more, because of my dog's age I was also not allowed to sign up as a new member. Over the last five years, I have not missed one payment, and I only filed 1 single claim in 2020. My claim got me a total of $15 refund and immediately increased my premium, so I never filed again and decided to only file should the worst happen (cancer at old age, etc.). None of this mattered. They would not reinstate or offer any help. I paid thousands of dollars for absolutely nothing. Now, as my dog is 10 years old, I am not able to sign up for a new policy at this or any other insurance provider. I have no recourse. They don't care, why would they? I already paid them over $8K.
title: Fraud

text: We purchased Healthy Paws Pet Insurance for our new puppy. Although, we expected that he is 100% healthy, that was not the case. The policy saved my thousands of dollars on the surgery. There were no "fine print" issues or "got'cha" technicalities.  Their coverage details were clear from day 1 and they delivered exactly as advertised when I needed them most. The health insurance is a gamble, but if you're looking for it, my experience with this company has been wonderful. They even sent out an email asking how my dog was doing about a week after his surgery. Healthy Paws came through when I needed them and filing claims with my phone and the app was simple. If you're questioning how reliable they would be if your pet had an issue, I couldn't ask for a better and easier experience than what they just provided for me and my dog.

text:
I've had Healthy Paws pet insurance for my oldest cat since we got him as a kitten in early 2019. They have been incredible in providing exceptional coverage and care for all the unexpected medical events an a couple (fortunately minor) emergencies. I recently got a plan for my new kitten as well after years of nothing but good things to say!

After getting neutered, a very minor surgery, my 8 month old kitten wouldn't eat and was not himself. What followed was a very stressful weekend of going from vet to vet for supportive care and next steps. We finally got a correct diagnosis: adverse reaction to anesthesia causing gastroenteritis. He was all set and back to normal after an overnight hospitalization with an amazing team and the right care for his needs. 

Through that horrible weekend, my husband and I didn't have to worry about the costs of our kitten's care because we knew Healthy Paws would help us. After roughly $4k in total expenses across multiple days and 3 vets, and having already met our deductible, we ended up paying $800 out of pocket in stead of $4000+. 

Healthy Paws is so fast to get through claims and answer any questions. On the phone, they've always been fantastic. I recommend everyone get Healthy Paws pet insurance and DO NOT WAIT. The sooner your pet is covered, the better. Trust me! The peace of mind when something unexpected happens is worth every penny of the monthly rate. They have different coverage options to help you find something that works. They will also reach out to vet offices for necessary records from claims you file so you're not chasing anyone around or playing middleman. 

Healthy Paws has even reached out to check on both kitties after their tougher experiences. I'm very grateful for their awesome service and care.

text:
Unfortunately, one of my cats has not been well recently. I have filed multiple claims - the first over a month ago. I have spoken/emailed SEVEN different representatives, and the issues are YET to be resolved.  They keep claiming I haven't submitted his medical records, and I keep resending them. Please note, the first time I submitted his medical records was when I enrolled, and I spoke with a representative to verify I had submitted everything needed. They are now trying to claim he has a pre existing GI issue, which is absolutely untrue. They are going off the date of his first claim because they are not organized enough to realize I have submitted his records multiple times and had multiple representatives verify they received them. This is starting to feel like a scam. I am starting to feel like they are purposely being difficult in the hopes that I stop try, and they get to save money. I am so tired of having the same unhelpful conversation with each representative. I truly am appalled at how disorganized this company is and can't even wrap my head around how poorly trained their staff are. I am hoping this issue will be resolved promptly, but I don't think I'll hold my breath. But hey, here's hoping the 7th time will be the charm.

In response to the reply: the first submission was indeed a line item record. I repeatedly submitted the rest of the records after I spoke to a rep in November and repeatedly throughout the claim‚Äôs process (once while actively on the phone with a representative, so she could verify it was what was needed). I finally took a screenshot of his most recent wellness exam (which I‚Äôd sent to records many times) and sent it directly to the claims rep and finally progress was made. The pre existing condition was removed from his chart, but boy was this a process.

Update #2: I will say, when I finally got through to a manager, he was very helpful. My subsequent claims have gone much smoother and been processed quickly.

text:
I have been with Healthy paws since September of 2014 for my dog, Opal, and recently purchased a 2nd policy in 2021 for my newest addition to the family Onyx. I am very happy with Healthy Paws coverage for both of my pets! Both were added when they were approximately 8 weeks old, and in our case there were no preexisting conditions. With two hard-headed Australian Cattle Dogs, we are no strangers to bumps, bruises, and surprise vet visits - most recently, my older dog needed surgery for two mass removals AND an ER visit when she had complications. Submitting a claim is as easy as snapping a few photos of the itemized invoices and medical records, and usually my claims are processes within 10 days. Honestly, having this insurance was a huge relief knowing that I didn't have to worry about the cost of treatment; I could just focus on Opal! Members from the Healthy Paws team even emailed us to ask how she was going following her visit, which meant a lot to me. Instead of a canned/generic check up email, it was genuine concern and details from her submitted claims, too so I know that real, pet-loving people are behind the the screen. 

I recommend Healthy Paws to everyone, and will continue to do so! 

I also recommend that new policy holders read over coverage so they understand what is/isn't in their policy, and try to gain coverage EARLY for their pets to avoid preexisting conditions. Pet Insurance doesn't replace preventative veterinary care, but is essential for when life throws its curveballs. 5/5 stars. We're members for life!

text: I have been a customer of Healthy Paws Pet Insurance since 2016, that's over 6 years.  I spend a ton of money with them. I still paid it since my dogs are older (10 and 15) and needed the coverage and I was under the impression this was a one time increase.  At the beginning of this month, I noticed that my bill had been increased another $91.07 per month bringing my monthly bill to over $400 per month!   I called on 2/3 when my new bill came out on 1/31 (only 3 days prior) and asked about why the increase happened.  I was told that it was due to my bills I was submitting which makes no sense.  Insurance is here to protect us from when things happen.  This is why every year I paid it year after year, not to just increase it to absorb the bills.  I ended up lowering my coverage and increasing my deductible to lower my monthly payment.  I simply asked that they make my request (3 days late) to be retroactive for the month of February and I was told no.  I asked to speak to a supervisor and the woman on the phone, clearly reading from a script, just said there's nothing she can do.  I submitted a complaint online that day.  Finally, today, 17 days later, I was called by a woman saying that she heard I needed to talk to a supervisor.  When I told her everything and asked just to make my changes retroactive for 3 days, it was the same "no" story over and over again.  This was the worst customer service I have ever experienced!  I would not suggest Healthy Paws to anyone!

I was only submitting the documents to have on record for future because these claims did not even meet the deductible. If it's this difficult to get claims just applied to deductible and they aren't actually having to pay anything I can't imagine having to file something they have to actually pay for. I pay way too much monthly for it to be this time consuming and difficult just to file a claim. I can just save the money and have it available in case it's needed instead of having to deal with them. I would not recommend the company. I would recommend just saving the money that you would be paying this company monthly instead of paying them to create more headaches for you if you ever actually need their services.

In response to the company reply: They can't find me in the system because I cancelled my account after leaving this review. I do not need to spend further time speaking to or emailing with customer service when this could have easily been handled over the past several months while the issues were ongoing and I expressed my frustrations directly to your representatives. This review was simply to let others know my experience. Hopefully they have a better experience than I did if they choose this company.

text:

text: Healthy Paws saved our cat. She was very sick and needed an extremely dangerous expensive surgery in order to save her life, as well as intensive care for about a week afterwards. We never had to deny any of the treatment on the basis of cost, and as a result our cat is still with us today. The process was simple -- we uploaded a PDF of the vet invoice and then a few days later had a deposit in our bank account. There was no back-and-forth, disputing of claims, etc. The only communication we received afterward was checking to see how our cat was doing, which was a nice gesture. Healthy Paws has been one of the more affordable options for us, and while it would be nice to have some extra things covered the current coverage is still incredible and painless to use.

text:
Healthy Paws is affordable and reliable-and they provide professional services! Their site is user friendly, it is easy to submit a claim, and to check a status of a claim.
