title: Look No Further Than Healthy Paws

text:
After having Healthy paws for 5 years without much of a need for them, my dog began having spinal issues and IVDD surgery twice which I was billed $9k each time! 

The first time expensing it to Healthy Paws was a little bit of an effort since they do need the official full historical report from your vet before paying anything out. However, the second time was seamless--I had made 5 easy claims up to the point of the surgery and they quickly paid me out each time, all they need is the official invoices. 

Something important things to be mindful of that may result in disappointment--but I think these are the case with any pet insurance:

1.  As far as I know--they do NOT COVER PRE-EXISTING CONDITIONS or VISITATION FEES. The first is a bummer, the latter can rack up without realizing it. 

2. Once you make a claim, you can't change your plan, so you're either locked in, or go somewhere else that won't cover any new pre-existing conditions that occurred while covered here.

Outside of these, Healthy Paws really has great customer service on the phone every time I've called, and they've paid out quite quickly and efficiently on every claim.

text:
I've been using Healthy Paws for years with all my dogs and my experience has been great.
Their claim submission portal is easy to use and doesn't require you itemize only the items you need reimbursement. They do it and you just have to review.
I never had issues with coverage and I already had to use the insurance for expensive treatments like cancer.
title: Reliable and easy to use

text: I have a delightful 11 year old Beagle.  I purchased health insurance for her from Healthy Paws.   It is somewhat expensive and premiums go up as she ages.  Recently, her Vet discovered a mass on her spleen and recommended a splenectomy.   That was done and thankfully the biopsy was negative.   I have submitted at least a half dozen claims with Healthy Paws in conjunction with the splenectomy (lab work, ultrasound, surgery, post op labs, and medications).  Each claim was handled promptly by Healthy Paws.  Making a claim was as easy as uploading a photo of the Vet's itemized bill on the Healthy Paws website.   All claims were processed in less than a week.  Two of the claims were processed the day I submitted the claims.  Healthy Paws even reached out to me by email to see how my pet was recovering after surgery.   All claims were processed quickly and in accordance with my insurance policy with Healthy Paws.  I insured my pet with Healthy Paws so that I would never have to make a medical decision on my beloved dog based on economics.
title: Healthy Paws pays off.

text: We joined Healthy Paws in October 2019 and signed up our two Scotties. We now have 3 on the policy. Our 7 year old, Ruckus, was diagnosed with TCC in September, 2021 and given his young age we decided to fight. We were referred to a wonderful oncology team here in Richmond, VA (here's a shameless plug for THE ONCOLOGY SERVICE!). I'm pleased to report that 13 months later, our Ruckus is still in the game and continuing to fight. Our association with Healthy Paws Pet Insurance has been every bit as good as that of our oncology team. They have supported our efforts flawlessly. Our claims have been processed quickly, and needed funds have always been received on time and in the correct amounts. All they've asked of us is to submit proper, complete invoices and medical records as required. Their website interface has made that simple and efficient. Lastly, and maybe most importantly, their people truly seem to care about our fur babies. Follow-up messaging asking us how it's going with our treatments and 'give Ruckus a hug' sentiments provide a personal touch that we didn't expect from an "insurance company". We don't know what the future holds for our boy, but between our oncology team and Healthy Paws Pet Insurance, we've been able to give him 13 months of quality life he surely would not have had otherwise. Thank you, Healthy Paws!
title: Able and Compassionate Allies in the Fight for our 'Ruckus'

text:

Then they say oh we got them, they just weren't attached to the claim. They later send out the exact same template "action needed, we need your pets complete medical record", which is exactly what was sent before. Call them back. Ah..shucks the records weren't attached to the claim so sorry.  Just a BS run around doing nothing nothing but shifting status back to action "required from you" and sending out the same template which tells me absolutely nothing about what they think is missing but isn't. We're now on the 3rd cycle of this nonsense. Stay away from this company at all costs, they very clearly want to play as many games as possible to see if you'll just go away before they pay out. Complete garbage.
title: The initial claim has been a nightmare

text:
I have this insurance for 6 years. Now that my pet is 12, he has cancer and for the first time I need to use it, I could not be more disappointed! Every time I submit a claim, I attached the medical records. And EVERY single week I receive a message saying that the medical records are missing. I have to call, they say they can see it, that they will merge the information and NOTHING. For the past 4 weeks that has been my life. Call and wait for help. I don't know what else to do. I‚Äôm updating my review because of the response below. Healthy Pet Paws is making it look like they need medical records and I didn‚Äôt submit it. So let me be MORE clear. Every single time I send an invoice (October 5, November 3rd and November 8) I attached full medical records. And every single time I received the same message: we are missing information. Then I call, the person tells me she can see that indeed I attached the medical records. And that now everything is okay. For 4 weeks I‚Äôve been attaching everything and still receiving messages and having to call. Yesterday was the 4th time and someone said there was a mistake in the system (they said it for the 3 time) and it was now fixed. So I already told one on my friends yesterday looking for insurance to not enroll with you. And one day I will have another pet and I won‚Äôt use your services.
I‚Äôm a business owner. The LEAST you could is apologize for your mistake. We must own up to them. I know I will receive my reimbursements because it‚Äôs all under my policy. But it makes not sense to
Submit information and still keep receiving messages that the document is missing and have to call so your team
Can see it‚Äôs all there!
title: I have this insurance for 6 years

text:
In my opinion, Healthy Paws is not the company they once were. They used to be good. With regards to the reply by Healthy Paws- They are stating they can't find my account. Again unorganized and delay tactics on their part. They said they could put a Liaison Manager in contact with me. No, a Liaison Manager already put this off on somebody else in the company after 3 emails and a month long wait before I got a reply from them and was for the Liaison manager to push it off on some other department that never gets back to you. This is why I filed a complaint with the California Insurance Commissioner in the first place. Run from this company. If you are able save the money monthly to have a rainy day fund for your pet.

text:

text: We have had Healthy Paws for years and submitting claims has always been incredibly straightforward, with hassle-free reimbursement. Not only that, but they followed up with us by email to check in on how he was healing. I have recommended Healthy Paws to 10+ family and friends now and cannot recommend them enough.
title: Hassle Free, Peace of Mind, High Quality!

text:
HealthyPaws has been nothing short of amazing for our dog Teddy. This was our first pet we had insured and it was mainly only done due to hip dysplasia worries. We enrolled him as soon as we got him in 2015. Teddy is an Akita/German Shepherd mix and past experiences with dogs that big have always had arthritis and hip issues down the road. So we enrolled him in 2015 on the 90% coverage, $100 annual deductible plan. It has been a literal lifesaver for him and our family and likely one of the best decisions I have ever made in my life.

I tried Figo Pet Insurance with 2 of my other dogs and they have been nothing but headaches and drama dealing with 1 of my dogs who sadly passed due to osteosarcoma spreading to his spine. They take weeks and weeks to look at your claims and in his case it was usually almost always denied or with a problem. Sometimes they would cover bloodwork, sometimes they didn't. It was crazy, a nightmare to deal with and I highly recommend everyone avoid Figo at all costs.

HealthyPaws has never had that sort of problem. They have covered little things like UTIs, monthly glucosamine shots and antibiotic meds. But they also have covered MAJOR life-threatening things without any issues for Teddy. Teddy had a mast cell tumor removed from his chest in fall of 2017 after adopting him. Every penny of that bill which was over $3,000 was covered with no issues at all. In fact, only ONE time in roughly 100 claims have I ever had a issue and all it took was a simple phone call for that to be resolved. The turnaround times are very reasonable and fast, never takes more than a week or two tops.

In June 2022, Teddy started having severe neurological signs and a brain tumor was suspected. To make a very long story short, he ended up having to have stereotactic radiation and chemo. This is certainly not cheap, his bill was roughly $15,000. HealthyPaws paid EVERY single penny of it except the usual things they do not cover (exam fees etc). I was reimbursed for 90% of that entire bill. They even emailed me to check and see how he was doing. They just spent over 13k on Teddy and still care enough about him to see how he was doing. HealthyPaws is amazing and I won't even consider another pet insurance company moving forward. 
He gets his bloodwork checked almost every week now, monthly chemo meds and other meds. All of this is covered without issue and pet owners know how expensive weekly blood tests can be. HealthyPaws is AMAZING, I cannot stress this enough. I have already recruited a friend to enroll their new puppy with them and I hope this review can help others make the proper choice here also.

Teddy is thus far doing as well and roughly 90% of his former self. Our family and Teddy owes this all to the wonderful care he got from the doctors but also HealthyPaws. I will never use another pet insurance provider, HealthyPaws care of Teddy has made me a fan for life.

He had another scare at age 3, and we just had a 3rd surgery at age 6- in addition to weekly physical therapy the last 4 years for maintenance of his condition. We are forever grateful to the service they provide, and of course to the wonderful veterinarians and surgeons out there who care about our pup. text:
Don‚Äôt do it! If you have a claim they will deny you over and over again. 

We took our Dog Starr to the Emergency Hospital after eating Grapes and getting sick. The invoice we sent was clearly from an Emergency Vet Hospital. 
Here is our experience:

1.	Sent Claim and waited. 

2.	Emailed to find out about the claim and got no reply.

3.	We Called to find out why it all of a sudden said ‚Äúdenied‚Äù online. The online system says ‚Äúprocessed‚Äù. Then it says ‚ÄúDenied due to a wellness visit‚Äù Clearly the receipt says VCA EMERGENCY HOSPITAL. They are emergency only they do not offer any ‚ÄúWellness‚Äù. 

4.	Now saying 15 to 30 days for a review of my claim.

5.	Now they are asking us to contact the Emergency Vet to get all the backup documentation of the visit. The information is clearly stated on the receipt already. 

6.	We asked to talk to a claims rep and they said they do not offer that.

Stay away and find a company that will pay your claim fairly or at minimum ask for more information before denying your claim.
title: Don‚Äôt do it

text: I couldn't be happier to have Healthy Paws Pet Insurance.  My sweet little rescue pup has multiple allergies resulting in hair loss.  Being able to get him the proper care to address his issues and give him the best possible quality of life without having to worry about the expense is incredibly helpful.  Healthy Paws has been so quick to process claims, literally payment shows up in my account within a day or two.  I'm very impressed with their service & follow-through.
title: A Lifesaver!

text:
Great rate starting. My dog is now 4 years old and very healthy. Somehow my premiums increased from the original rate of $33.61 on 3/11/19 to the absolutely absurd $70.62 they are now charging me as of 3/11/22. Don‚Äôt worry, they totally let me know about the price increases by creating a document and stuffing it deep in the archives of my online account‚Ä¶you know, a very accessible place that most normal people check on a regular basis‚Ä¶oh wait, no, I never received an email or letter in the mail, and I never checked the documents in my profile, so I was never notified. 

I‚Äôm no mathematician, but a 110% increase in only 3 years with NO claims that they had to pay me out for seems ridiculous. It‚Äôs a simple bait and switch‚Ä¶preying on peoples fears of the unknown. 

Now, they will claim that rates are adjusted to reflect market price for vet services, inflation, etc, but nothing has gone up 110% in the pet world. Pretty sure my vets prices are somewhat similar to when I started going there. 

This is a terrible business model. Provide affordable coverage for young dogs, jack the price up significantly, and make sure that by the time a dog is old and would need medical attention, the customer would have already canceled the policy because they could not afford it. 

If you are thinking of getting this insurance, consider that I am paying $847 a year for the coverage (22-23). That is in addition to the $678 (21-22), $522 (20-21) and $403 (19-20) I‚Äôve paid them for the past years. That‚Äôs $2,450 that I‚Äôve given them to ‚Äúprotect‚Äù my perfectly healthy young dog. By the time I would need coverage, I would‚Äôve already paid more in insurance than I would‚Äôve paid out of pocket. Then again, if something unexpected happened to the dog, I would‚Äôve needed the coverage. But like I said, that‚Äôs their business model‚Ä¶prey on your fear. I wish nothing good for these people who make the policies to screw over people who try to do the right thing for their pets. I hope they get theirs one day.

An update to answer the company response below:
No one likes premium increases, thank you for pointing that out. Please explain, on this public forum, why an insurance premium increase of 110% is appropriate within 3 years. text: I thought to myself, what health issues could an 11 week old mixed puppy from a Kentucky shelter possibly have? An older dog, yes, but would a young puppy really need health insurance? So I almost did not get Healthy Paws. Then I remembered that puppies do tend to chew & swallow things that they shouldn‚Äôt, and get into all kinds of mischief! So I did get Healthy Paws for my new puppy. This was in May of 2021. I looked at several companies & liked that Healthy Paws had no annual or lifetime limits, and covered problems at 90%. No, they do not cover routine health care or wellness, and I knew that going in. I wanted it for unexpected issues. Plus, it also came recommended to me by a model & actress who had adopted a Pit puppy who has had numerous surgeries & issues running into thousands of dollars. She told me it was all covered at 90%. Well, unfortunately, this last year we have been dealing with some unexplainable intestinal/diarrhea issues, plus itchy skin issues. What a life saver Healthy Paws has been! Our puppy has had numerous tests, including allergy testing by a specialist dermatology veterinarian, ultrasounds, bloodwork, different medications. Ugh. We never expected all of that with a new puppy, but she‚Äôs adorable and we love her to pieces! Healthy Paws processes my claims so quickly. It‚Äôs so easy to use their app on my iPhone, snapping a photo of the veterinarian‚Äôs invoice and sending it through the app. In as little as a couple of hours the claim is processed! The only time it takes longer is on weekends when my veterinarian is closed, which means Healthy Paws can‚Äôt contact her for more information‚Ä¶ Right now the monthly premium is affordable, and yes, I know that the premium WILL go up as my dog ages. It‚Äôs inevitable, just like with humans‚Ä¶ I would recommend Healthy Paws to anyone!
title: Healthy Paws is great!

text: Healthy Paws pet insurance has been amazing and the best investment I‚Äôve ever made.I purchased it a little over a year ago for my healthy one year old husky and used it once shortly after initial purchase when Tahoe ingested a toxic mushroom in our yard and ended up in the ER and spending over a day in ICU.I was reimbursed within 2 weeks after submitting invoice and medical records.Then sadly last month Tahoe started with bizarre neurological symptoms landing him in the ER twice in 2 days each time being admitted for blood work, x-rays, medications and even a head CT.The local ER vets concluded that he would need a specialist for a mri of his spine which was locally not available.After traveling several hours to a Neurologist for a MRI and spinal tap Tahoe was diagnosed with Wobbler‚Äôs disease and would need surgery to stop the spinal cord compression.I already applied well over $8000 to my credit card and we have not even seen the surgeon yet.Healthy paws has already delivered checks for over $4000 thousand this month and the rest is in the mail.Without this surgery Tahoe would be in constant severe pain and shortly become paralyzed and honestly I‚Äôm not sure I could afford the surgery especially after already spending $8000.I hate to even think of the decisions I‚Äôd have to make if I did not have Healthy Paws insurance.After this surgery Tahoe will live a long , normal and pain free life. text:
My Pomeranian Bruno Bear had a one night $2500 hospital stay for gastroenteritis.
Healthy Paws covered $2100.

title: Great Experience with Healthy Paws Pet Insurance

text:
I signed up for Healthy Paws insurance when we first got our puppy, 4 years ago. She hasn't had any serious medical issues so had not had to file a claim until recently. Edie unfortunately punctured her eye causing an ulcer. Being a Boston Terrier, her eye would not heal on its own and required surgery to try and place a graft to assist in it's healing. That surgery was pricey ($3k) and was unsuccessful which then required another surgery to remove her eye (another almost $4k). It was a stressful and traumatic experience for all of us and I was equally stressed about filing my first claim and how it would go
However, Healthy Paws made a stressful part of an already stressful experience, so easy and stress free! They even emailed to follow up on how Edie was feeling after her surgery. Highly recommend!
title: I signed up for Healthy Paws insurance‚Ä¶

text: Awesome insurance!  Fast reimbursement!  Easy to submit!
title: Awesome insurance

text:
Thank goodness for this pet insurance! Our puppy had 10 minutes with a new toy and unbeknownst to us, swallowed a good sized piece. Two days later he is almost at death‚Äôs door with a blockage, and we had to rush him to the emergency animal hospital.

Right then and there, they put a $10,000 hold on my credit card. It was terrifying to know how critical my pet‚Äôs health was and also scary the cost of care they told us he needed.

Thankfully, his stomach surgery was a success and he‚Äôs back to his old goofy self. But then I was bracing myself for a potential back and forth to get the insurance to reimburse because we‚Äôve all heard the horror stories of finding out what‚Äôs REALLY covered!

I was so happy to say that it was easy and they paid the vast majority of our $9000 final bill (we have 80% reimbursement coverage). It was fast and easy ‚Äî just upload the itemized invoice and the check arrived a week later‚Äî and they even checked via email to see how our pup was doing! Color me SUPER impressed.

I have told everyone I know to get their pet covered by Healthy Paws. I never take the time to write reviews like this but they truly deserve it!
title: Healthy Paws is stellar ‚Äî covered a $9k emergency puppy surgery!

text: Healthy Paws is the best! During a recent bout of IBD the medical bills for my Husky/Shepherd mix racked up quickly. Healthy Paws paid their fair share quickly with no hassles at all. In fact, after about the fourth check they wrote and asked how he was doing just to make sure he was ok. Now that's good service! At this point I'm sure they've paid me more in reimbursements than I paid them in premiums, but they've never complained. (Oh, and they did the same thing for my last dog...a 14 year old GSD with multiple health issues). I wish my own health insurance were this good.
title: Healthy Paws is the best

text: My experience with Healthy Paws has been very positive. Like any insurance product, you never know how well it will work until you need it. We have maintained coverage for our dog and cat for 6 years, and never really needed it until this year, when our dog Hammy tore a knee ligament and needed surgery to repair it. After we met the annual deductible, Healthy Paws paid their share of the remaining bills with no trouble at all. The vet also prescribed medication to relieve arthritis in Hammy's other knee, and this was covered by insurance too. Claims are paid very quickly via direct deposit, and customer service is helpful and friendly when needed. The "preexisting conditions" exclusion is disappointing, and annual rate increases are never fun, but I suppose that's standard practice for the industry. Overall the insurance does the job I want it to do, which is to make it easy to keep our pets healthy and happy.
title: Trouble free claims experience

text: Our dog who is under six had an ACL repaired in one leg.  A year later she needed work on the other leg which has never had issues.  Healthy Paws has this exception so they don't have to cover it buried in their FAQ where one leg that is fine is already considered pre-existing.  When we submitted paperwork all they did was close the case with no note on what has happened.  MSPCA Angel in Boston told us this is the most common injury with dogs yet there was no effort to cover this or try to make it work with our premiums.  We are outraged for this kind of poor coverage.
title: ACL issues on one leg make the other pre-existing

text: I have been a customer for over six years and did not have any problems with submitting claims. That is until this year when I had to submit a claim for surgery for my port to fix his ccl. All of a sudden the claim was denied and excuses were made saying documentation does not exist and were missing even though the vet had sent them multiple times. It has been over three months and I still have to resubmit the same documents. Unacceptable response from them.

text:
When we welcomed home our dog, Charlie, just under two years ago I already knew what pet insurance to sign up with, Healthy Paws! My sister had already had Healthy Paws for her dogs and told me about how easy and affordable it was. She had already filed a claim and was quickly reimbursed. I had the same experience. I was able to get 90 percent coverage and only a $100 deductible for a comprehensive plan that was very affordable. My dog Charlie had no health issues until a couple weeks ago when he suddenly started acting different and vomiting all day. I rushed him to the emergency Vet which is very costly. Healthy Paws paid me back within days of submitting my claim. The app is very easy to use! A week or so later, they reached out to me to check on my pup who luckily is all better! 

I can't tell you what peace of mind I had while I was with him at the vet knowing he'd be covered! It was heartbreaking over hearing others with no coverage trying to figure out what to do since they couldn't afford treatment.

title: Kindness Wins

text: My dog was diagnosed with a large mass attached to his kidney.  There was a high probability that it was cancer but, even if it wasn't, the danger to him was grave if the mass burst, as it would fill his abdomen with blood.  We opted to do surgery right away which would include removing the kidney.  The estimate for this surgery was very high.  As such, I decided to look back for all the vet bills that I hadn't filed an insurance claim for, during the current policy period, and frantically started sending them in just hoping they would cover enough to satisfy our deductible.  There were 20 submissions, and the speed at which they reviewed, approved, or denied them, was record time!  They approved many and denied very little.  Not only did we meet our deductible, we blew by it, and they direct deposited funds to my bank account within a few days.  I was so happy and very surprised!  Given my experience with a different pet insurance company years ago, I anticipated much less.  Needless to say, I was impressed, but not half as much as I would be.  After my dog's surgery, I submitted the very large claim immediately.  It was long and detailed, as he'd spent 3 nights and 4 days in the hospital.  I was hoping that, whatever Healthy Paws was going to cover, they would review the claim quickly enough to put money in my account before the credit card bill arrived.  I was shocked when I received notice in only 3 days that they had completed the claim and deposited the funds into my account.  Not only did they do it in lightning speed, but they covered every single item on the claim.  Now I was extremely impressed!  I didn't think Healthy Paws could do anything more to confirm what a great company they are, but then came a personal email asking how my dog's recovery was going.  They asked me to write them back and share with them his progress.  That was a really nice touch.  Healthy Paws Pet Insurance is hands down the best, and I highly recommend them.  They have treated me fairly, honestly, and compassionately.  And...btw...the mass turned out to be benign, and Heathy Paws Celebrated that great news with me, too.
title: The BEST in pet insurance!

text: Healthy Paws is GREAT.  I was skeptical about pet policies, expecting some of the same issues that exist with human insurance, but nothing could be further from the truth.  They have great customer service and lightning fast claim processing made simple with the ability to upload invoices.  I use direct deposit reimbursement and have had my claims processed in less than 48 hours.  I only wish I'd known about Healthy Paws for my older dog.
title: Healthy Paws is GREAT

text: Our happy, 14 mos old puppy suddenly became depressed, despondent, stopped eating, stopped drinking, would just lie on the floor with a fever staring at us. It took almost 4 weeks working with Brookfield Pet Hospital and ACA to finish mutiple xrays, ultrasounds, varied medical tests, fecal tests, and much more. Finally the diagnosis was revealed: my fully vaccinated pup got Bordetella at doggy day camp right after his 6 month return. And that disease caused double pneumonia, kennel cough, vomiting of blood and vile, and high fever, no to mention 10% loss of his body weight. Healthy Paws insurance was by our side through the whole ordeal and was sending reimbursements with in two weeks of invoice submission, with no barrage of questions. They followed my policy to the tee: exclude office visit, ordinary vaccinations, deduct my $250 deductible, and then paid the rest. Of my $6,000 in bills, I received back more than $5000. I felt so lucky! I was paid more than I had paid in insurance premiums. Get yourself some peace of mind and insure your puppy with Healthy Paws.
title: Our health insurance saved our dog and our finances

text:
So grateful we chose Healthy Paws to cover our Shih Tzu.

Two days later I had an explanation of benefits and funds in my account that night.  After surgery, same thing, 2 days and it was all taken care of.  

Great people to work with and so caring. I even got a follow up email from Stephanie and Tim asking how Watson was doing a week after major back surgery!  It wasn‚Äôt a form letter either as we communicated a couple of time back and forth.  They were happy to hear we were on the mend.

text: I highly recommend Healthy Paws Pet Insurance!!! I have been a customer of Healthy Paws for 10 years, insuring my dog and 3 house cats over this period. I have always gotten great service. My dog has idiopathic epilepsy diagnosed in his second year. Recently, one of my 6 year old cats required medical care and hospitalizations for 2 life threatening conditions, seemingly unrelated, that occurred about a month apart. The second illness required 6 days of 24/7 care in an emergency clinic in addition to multiple follow up visits and testing with my veterinarian. Without my young cat's Healthy Paws Insurance coverage, we would not have been able to do all we could to help him survive when there was any possibility of treating his condition. The alternative would have been the awful decision to put a young animal down when its condition was treatable, but the cost was too burdensome. Healthy Paws has no lifetime limits per pet, and several payment/deductible options. I am very grateful to Healthy Paws Pet Insurance for their service and sensitivity through this stressful time!
title: Healthy Paws Pet Insurance offers outstanding coverage and service!

text:

Knowing how pet parents are already overwhelmed with the surgery and all the information thrown at them, I was expecting for healthy paws to ask me for medical records and surgery records but once I provided the invoice and gave the hospital the insurance records, they worked it all out in the background. text: Trash. DO NOT recommend. First, the rate goes up every year and its expensive. Second, so far not worth it. Let me tell you a story. Three years after joining, my dog got really sick, had blood coming out both ends. Spends a week in and out of the hospital. I thought he was dying, but luckily he survived. So I submit my first claim. They deny it with no explanation or message. I have to call customer service. Apparently they want ALL his vet bills EVER to verify that it's not a a pre-existing condition. After three years of nothing. Ok, fine I tell them to go get them. I hear nothing from them. I call again. They did not get the vet bills and their customer service rep threatens to hang up for swearing. Of course I'm mad, I'm spending tons of MY time calling them, trying to get them to do the job I already pay them to do. So I spend more of my time getting all the vet records (he's a rescue, no easy task, would've been MUCH easier THREE years ago when I joined.) They finally process my claim. They're only paying half of a very expensive bill. Turns out "Hospitalization" is covered but not the exam fee? What??? How does that even make sense. Sounds like a way to get out of paying short term hospitalization to me. Not to mention how much time and stress (3 customer service calls SO FAR) I've wasted just trying to get them to do their job. I specifically signed up for them bc I was led to believe they covered the big stuff. I guess not. So if you like being stressed out right after your pet almost dies, having a company implying you're a liar, not getting your money's worth, this is the company for you. Oh! And they also request the vet records because if you don't get that first exam per their requirement, they don't have to pay your first claim, even if you've been paying in. And they will look for it to get out of paying that claim. Scoundrels.
title: Trash

title: Had emergency surgery on my dog‚Ä¶

text:
My wife laughed at me when I said I was taking out pet insurance for our dog George. Why would we need that, she asked. Well, a couple of years later we found out... then found out again.

One day, we returned home to George's rear legs being paralyzed, and it was clear something was seriously wrong. A visit to our local veterinary hospital led to an urgent referral to a specialist, to an MRI, and ultimately to back surgery. The overall cost was somewhere in the $7,000 range. Although the claim did take a little while to process, it was paid in full (at our 90% chosen coverage level, minus the deductible). Great, we got our money's worth.

Well, two years later... the same thing happens, this time a spinal issue further up his back. Same drill: local vet, immediate referral to specialist neurology department. MRI. Surgery. Cost: over $10k (first instance was in Michigan, second in Southern California). This time the claim was submitted and paid *the next day*. I couldn't believe the quick turnaround.

No quibbling, or trying to get out of paying. Knowing you can trust your pet insurer to pay up when you need it can be the difference between being able to say yes to a necessary procedure, or saying no.

HealthyPaws had been a chance word of mouth recommendation to us from a casual acquaintance who had had a similarly positive experience, and we count ourselves very lucky we got it!
title: A pet insurer who lives up to their name (and claims)

text: We have had Healthypaws pet insurance for 5 years with never a complaint. Recently our beautiful Eva (GSD) spent 4 days and 3 nights in the critical care unit at a Veterinarian Specialty Hospital. We submitted a claim for $3611.00. Healthypaws denied every fee listed as Case Management stating the reason as, it was considered a new consult fee. When your pet is at a 24/7 facility doctors change shifts and your pet moves from emergency care to ICU to internal medicine care. Case management  is not a separate consult. We submitted another final  claim after her release with the same case management fees included and Healthypaws paid them all.? Unfortunately our sweet girl crossed the rainbow bridge. What a stressful, horrible time to have to fight with an insurance company. We cancelled our policy for our other (GSD) and went to a great pet insurance company that covers all exam and consult fees. There will never be a gray area excuse to not pay any fees. Too bad for Healthypaws as friends and family members that have Healthypaws will choose to follow us in canceling their policies as well. We are sad and disappointed in Healthypaws pet insurance.

text: At 4am, when we awoke to feed our feline fur babies, I noticed our Baxter seemed agitated, would not eat his breakfast, and began to try to pee everywhere. Problem was, no pee was coming out. I immediately knew what was wrong...urinary obstruction. This condition is considered a medical emergency and having lost one of my babies to this 2 years ago time was not on my side. I rushed him to an ER vet but to my horror they turned me away (that's another review) so I had to head to my regular vet, even though they did not open until 7am. To make a long story short, I waited a short period of time until they opened. Met the one staff member at the front door, told her what was happening and she immediately got one of the Dr's. In less then 10 minutes, Baxter was successfully catheterized and draining urine. Baxter needed more care such as a bladder xray and a cardiac test as he had an arrythmia of unknown origin. Needless to say I was a wreck from all of this and when Baxter was stable and the testing was done I asked for the medical notes and prepared to send everything to healthy paws insurance. Was I concerned? No. I had a claim for Baxter many years before this incident and all went well. But, this situation was more involved with more paperwork and alot was done for him. Healthy Paws made it so easy!!!! On the app, take pictures of your paperwork. Have alot of pages?? No problem, just keep sending them. The staff can follow the pages and make sense of the information sent. They send you an email confirming they received the paperwork, and how the process is going. In less than 5 days, my claim was covered with the explanation of benefits etc. and my money was already en route! And if there is an issue, just call them. They understand pet parents in distress and are very reassuring and helpful. I can say having Healthy Paws insurance for Baxter was one of the best decisions I've made!!
title: Piece of mind for Baxter

text: I work for the largest corporate veterinary hospital in the US and as a perk, they subsidize the cost of Trupanion for four pets. Well, as most others in the animal industry know, sometimes you own more than four... I looked at purchasing Trupanion for my new Great Dane puppy as they had been great with the coverage and claims for my other pets and realized the monthly premium was over $160 for my chosen options (90% reimbursement with a $500 deductible.) I remembered a coworker recommending HealthyPaws to our clients and hearing great reviews. I was quoted a monthly premium of $82 for the same $500 deductible and 90% reimbursement plan. Fast forward a year and my puppy suffers a partial CCL tear in his left knee during a competitive field trial. HeathlyPaws has covered his initial diagnostics (radiographs, sports medicine evaluation, surgical evaluation) ($950), 16 weeks of twice weekly cold laser and underwater treadmill/hydrotherapy($3200), and his eventual TPLO surgery ($6900). He will likely require a few more months of rehab and physical therapy to fully recover and I am confident in the care he will receive knowing we are backed by HealthyPaws and not burdened by such a significant financial impact.

text:
We were enrolled with them for almost 2 years. Our cat one day started to cough pretty badly, so we brought him to the hospital. Luckily it was nothing, he was just dehydrated, and recovered very fast.

So we submit all the documents to claim the payment back from "Healthy Paws". After a back and forth of many phone calls where they asked for any possible document our cat ever produced in his entire life, they declined to pay any moment.
The reason: when you enroll a pat that is 6+ years old with them you need to have a veterinary test that is 30 days prior to the enrollment date. Our was 6 days too early, so basically we were paying for almost 2 years a lot of money to the company but we didn't have ANY coverage. 

Basically what these people do is that they check you only when you claim something, and they look for ANY small detail to avoid paying you. you could pay for YEARS a service that you don't even have. And of course, they have no intention to refund you the fact that you pay for a service you didn't have. Crazy.
Healthy Paws is literally just a scam, and I wish I had the money and the time to sue and bring them in court, cause I'm pretty sure this should be illegal.

If you google this company, you'll see they already lost a class action about something unrelated, I won't be surprised if another class action starts soon for people who are having the same problem.
Thank God we had the money to pay out of pocket for our cat.
title: Long crazy story, read review

text:
Even if I lose you somewhere while reading my review, please purchase a Healthy Paws pet insurance for your pet now. This is not like deciding whether to purchase your baby a duck toy or a squeaky ball.  For the past 8 years Healthy Paws has saved us money we sometimes didn't have. It has allowed us to focus our energy and time on providing Mossi the best vet-care, rather than worrying about money. You don't want to avoid a visit to the vet because you cannot afford it. There is a lot of information online and in social media, which can be very overwhelming. It can also be very misleading, but the go-to for many people because it accessible, and cheaper. I do not recommend this at all. Make sure your pet is covered with Healthy Paws, take them to the vet, and every other source of information should always be confirmed by your vet. Before I do lose you (as you may think I am long-winded) think of surgeries and cancer, which are very common. Waiting until a sickness or odd-bump passes or goes away because it is not ‚Äúbig deal,‚Äù or avoiding routine examinations because ‚Äúwhat if they are too expensive‚Äù - should never be the decision-process regarding your pet‚Äôs health. Pet insurance removes that financial obstacle. Your pet/baby's life may be short, but you can extend them and make the more comfortable with the proper veterinary care.

As soon as we welcomed Mossi Banana into our lives, we purchased a Healthy Paws policy. It came to use right away! Two of the best decisions in our lives! My precious Yorkie, as is the case with the breed, has struggled with allergies, food sensitivities, osteoarthritis, and an incessantly curious and excitable personality that cannot be cured. Our journey with her tummy issues, food and seasonal allergies that change from year to year and as she ages, two surgeries for ruptured ligaments on her hind legs, a fractured tooth (she is a hard chewer, avoid plastic or antlers), have all been very stressful for Us and Her. However, the stress fades away after the visit to the vet when she starts feeling better. We do not have to worry any more than needed because she is covered. I can‚Äôt imagine feeling conflicted about foregoing a veterinary visit or treatment because of the cost. You do not want to, either. 

Mossi takes various medications and supportive treatments for her gastrointestinal health and bone & joint health, which are covered by Healthy Paws. The surgeries for her hind knees, as well as her rehabilitation program did not have to be optional because we had Healthy Paws. You can decide not to do them, but without them you would be seriously and negatively affecting the length and quality of your pet‚Äôs life. When her recovery sessions needed to be extended, Healthy Paws covered them - no questions asked. I submit my invoices the day of the treatment, and I can have the money in our bank account within the same week, sometimes within couple of days ‚Äì this is a life saver!  Preventative care and food is already expensive, but often doable if you have Healthy Paws to cover the rest. We have a tight budget, and can cover the preventative and food, but beyond that we would struggle and have to make difficult choices about our pet's health. You do not have to! 

As she ages, some of her health conditions are becoming more easily aggravated, which require more specialized care. Because we have Healthy Paws, we can afford an Internal Medicine Veterinarian that specializes in small dogs. Yes, there are veterinarians that specialize in many fields, but are usually more expensive. Specialized medicine can extend and even save your pet's life. It is more expensive, but it will not be an issue because you have Healthy Paws to cover your pet. I am amazed that Mossi's veterinary care and HP coverage are much better than my own human health care care and insurance coverage!

If you have a breed that is known for great health, get an insurance with the lowest deductible and/or lowest reimbursement. Later, you can change them! Cancer and accidents can be very indiscriminate no matter the breed. You will regret not getting a policy, you will NOT regret getting one because you will need it. 

 If you have a breed that is prone to health issues, get a HP pet policy immediately ‚Äì and instead, spend the time and energy working with their vet, and doing your own research to learn about your pet‚Äôs predispositions and conditions so that you can provide them with best holistic care possible. Get a HP policy, it will make your and your pet's quality of life MUCH BETTER! You will have more money for toys, treats and trips with your beloved pet(s)!
title: You will regret not getting pet insurance, but you won't regret not having it but not needing it!

text:
I'd never had pet insurance but after a year or so of periodic "my puppy got into something and we've got to go to the vet" I looked into getting some coverage and decided on Healthy Paws in 2018. 
I didn't know how important that would end up being in 2019, when my dog started having severe GI issues--vomiting, diarrhea, etc.--that would not go away. We spent a week making daily visits to the 24-hour ER vet to be told on a Friday that her bloodwork showed she had life-threateningly low levels of some proteins in her blood and that the best option was being admitted to a specialist care facility that could monitor her over the weekend. 
It was hard enough to go through with that but thanks to Healthy Paws, the huge financial cost of the treatment was manageable. We paid upfront for the hospitalization and within a few days got reimbursed for 80% of the cost per the terms of our plan. They continued to cover the follow-up care that our dog needed afterward, and I'm happy to report that our dog has been healthy for over 2 years following that. 
The main takeaway is that pet insurance is a safety net. It won't cover everything, but it's there when you need it most, and you never know when that day might come.
title: Saved our wallet and dog's life

text: Seven years ago when I got my first dog, my cousin advised me to look into pet insurance. I was not sure at the time, but it was the best decision I made. Through research, I found Healthy Paws, and I decided to give them a try since they seem to have great coverage. For the first few years, we did not need to use the policy. However, in 2018, when my dog was about three, our dog had multiple indolent eye ulcers, and he couldn't open his eye. I can credit Healthy Paws for helping me save my dogs eyes. After several costly procedures and many specialist visits, my dogs eyes were healed. They paid all claims in accordance with the contract. Also, it is very easy to submitt a claim by app or online, and the claims are usually paid within a few days. I recently got another puppy, and I looked at insurance policies again. Although, Healthy Paws premiums were a little more expensive a month, I decided to go with them due to their great coverage. My puppy just tured one, and needed surgery on his nares and soft palate to breath better. Based on my current experience with Healthy Paws, I will be a customer for life.
title: Wondeful Company!

text:
I will attempt to make a very long winded review as short as possible. 

I have had dogs my entire life and for most of that time I was aware of pet insurance but I though it was a bit of a scam, meaning that it really only paid for emergency type problems and that it was not worth the cost.

Fast forward to May 2020 and I get a new puppy and the woman I am dating also has a dog and she tells me about Healthy Paws and how great it is. I get the insurance for my new puppy Ruby.

Healthy paws covers pretty much everything but exams, preventative medication (flea, tick, etc.) and vaccinations‚Ä¶. Everything else is covered.

So now the long part of how much Healthy Paws helped us. All of the ordeal I am about to go into was covered by Healthy Paws except for our deductible which was 20% and any exam fees. We calculated the payments from Healthy Paws to be around $35,000 over the course of this single problem.  In early 2021 Ruby started to have on and off vomiting, so we took her to the vet who did x rays and found no real problem, they though it was viral. The vomiting continued on and off a bit more so we took her to another vet for a second opinion. This vet ran bloodwork, did x rays and an ultrasound and still did not find anything.  Fast forward a few weeks and Ruby vomits blood so we take her to a third emergency vet who does an x-ray and an ultrasound and discovers that Ruby had part of a squeaker toy in her large intestine and it has perforated her intestine. It more than likely was in her stomach since she started vomiting but did not show up because it is clear plastic. When it finally made it past her stomach and into her intestines it because stuck because of the size and then perforated her intestine has her body tried to work the squeaker through her GI track. Ruby had emergency surgery that day and a blood transfusion to help with the blood she lost,  she spent 2-3 nights at the vet recovering and was doing okay. Because of all the blood Ruby lost she was anemic after the surgery so she required blood test every few days. As we had test, the vet noticed that Rubys red blood cell (RBC) count was not improving. After a week or so of additional testing, it was determined that the area on her intestine where it was cut and sutured by the vet had separated and the sutured needed to be restitched, so Ruby goes back in for a second surgery.  Ruby recovered okay for the second surgery but still was anemic with no improvement in her RBC count. We took her to three different vets (our regular vet, the emergency vet, and University of Pennsylvania Vet school). None could find a reason why Ruby was still anemic other than the assumption she had a slow bleed from her surgery site that they felt would eventually heal. At this point we are in July of 2021. Over the next 7-8 months ruby required 3 more blood transfusions, several ultrasounds and 30+ blood test to check her RBC count and other values. Here we are today in March of 2022 and Ruby is almost back to normal. She still is requiring monthly injections of iron and monthly blood test to monitor her improving anemia and RBC count.  

Everything I mentioned above was covered by Healthy Paws and reimbursements to us were often made the same day, I do not think we ever waited more than 3 days for a reimbursement of a vet bill. Healthy Paws also never questioned any of the bills and we never were required to get preauthorization for a specialty vet or surgery. The only time Healthy Paws ever had anything to say about the bills we submitted was them checking in to see how Ruby was doing and wishing us well.

Long story kind of short‚Ä¶ get pet insurance. Without Healthy Paws we would have had to make very hard decisions about continuing Ruby‚Äôs care due to the cost, as the bills were $40,000+. We would have either burned through a lot of savings/gone into debt or had to put Ruby down.
title: Healthy Paws - best decision we made for our pets care

text: In January 2021, I enrolled in a health insurance plan with Healthy Paws for my pug, Oscar, who was three year old at the time. I was recommended Healthy Paws by a friend who has a Boston Terrier. This past January 5, 2022, after an episode of acute vomiting followed by several days of barely eating, Oscar was hospitalized at VCA West Los Angeles Hospital. He stayed there for five nights and was diagnosed with multicentric lymphoma which came as a shock to me.  After the diagnosis was made, Oscar was treated with prednisone and an Elspar injection. Five weeks later, he is now in remission. Last January 26, I submitted his hospital bill to Healthy Paws. Less than ten days later, I received a check from them for a five figure amount. I have only one thing to say: thank you Healthy Paws!

text:
In my opinion, this company is incompetent and verging on fraudulent.  Their promotional material says that their plan "covers new accidents and illnesses."  That's not true.  They do not cover veterinarian charges, which are the bulk of what you pay if your pet is ill or injured.  This is incredibly misleading and makes their insurance policy almost worthless.

One day later:
It's nice to see that Healthy Paws is monitoring this, even on a US holiday.  Because you've engaged, here are a couple of hypothetical situations for you to answer:

1. Insured pet is injured and needs urgent care at a 24-hour vet.  Bill has charges for the vet and for x-rays.  What's covered?  (Ignore deductible and co-pay - we know those will be paid by pet owner.)
2. Same situation, but pet needs surgery.  Bill has charges for the vet, x-rays, and surgery-related items like drugs and disposables.  What's covered?

After you reply (of if you don't) I'll post the answers I got as a Healthy Paws customer.
title: The fine print makes it worthless

text: When I got my puppy, it was my first experience enrolling in pet insurance.  My intent was to have it "just in case" something unexpected happened. text:
I am a veterinarian at a large tertiary referral hospital. I have Healthy Paws insurance for my own pet and owed a pretty hefty bill after her amputation surgery following a cancer diagnosis. As an employee of the hospital, I receive a benefit from the university that I work for towards the bill. The benefit is 20% and Healthy Paws covers 80%. To be clear, I am not making money off of this, it basically just helps cover the cost of the bill. Healthy Paws has always acknowledged this in the past and has taken into account the benefit. 

After my dogs' most recent surgery, Healthy Paws was only covering 80% of the bill AFTER my benefit, leaving me with approximately $4,000 to cover on my own. After discussion with them, they agreed that they had taken this into account in the past and would go back and review charges. Following this, they sent me a BILL for $625.25 saying that the past claims were all reviewed in error and now I OWE them money. So in addition to them stealing my benefit, they also are now charging me for THEIR error. 

I am absolutely disgusted with Healthy Paws. When this company started, they were much more responsive, claims were faster, and they were compassionate. If you are considering this company LOOK ELSEWHERE. I am a veterinarian and can't even afford my dogs bill because of Healthy Paws. I'd recommend TruPanion or NationWide in the future, as many of my pet parents have had good success with them.
title: As a veterinarian, I would STAY AWAY from Healthy Paws.

text: I purchased Healthy Paws insurance a few years ago, when we got a second dog. I read reviews and chose Healthy Paws based on them. I have not been disappointed! I have had to use it several times for one of our dogs, most recently when he ran into the road and was hit by a car. I'm grateful for the insurance and for the promptness of their response when filing a claim.

text:
BUYER BEWARE:

I enrolled this morning, and the quote that was generated gave me a price for a plan that was supposed to give an 80% reimbursement, only have $250 deductible, with no max payout limits. However, once I finished setting up payment info and creating my account, I decided to take a look at the policy details. The plan that was given to BOTH my pets was only 70% reimbursement, had a $500 deductible, and no mention of no max payouts (which I assume means there's probably a fairly low cap on the maximum payout as well). 

In short, a totally different plan from the one I paid for. Called customer service, was hung up on. Called again for a supervisor, and he told me the one they were enrolled in, the lower tier, was the only plan available. Excuse me- probably a silly question on my part, but if the 80% plan wasn't even available for my pets WHY DID YOU ADVERTISE AND OFFER IT TO ME? I believe that they are intentionally defrauding their customers. Please consider other insurance. Customer service was booty, too.

EDIT: I want to respond to their response so everyone can see and isn‚Äôt fooled. All of the info they described- my zip code, pet age, etc. was entered prior, rendering their response totally useless. The issue, to be clear, is that after generating my quote, selecting the plan, and making payment, I was automatically shifted to a lower, less desirable plan but still paid the same premium that was quoted for the higher plan, Do not fall for their attempts at misguidance in the above reply, I have photo and video evidence of the FRAUD that is occurring from this business.
title: BUYER BEWARE:

text:
The most unhelpful pet insurance company when your pet gets sick! I joined Healthy Paws in 2018 when my premiums were around $30 something and their claims process was much faster. This year, Nov 2021, I submitted a claim to get reimbursed for my dog's MRI procedure. I've been going back and forth via email and phone calls about missing medical records since we adopted him Dec 2017. After I thought i submitted most of our historical medical records, suddenly they closed my claim saying "Missing Medical records from all of your pet's veterinary visits prior to 04/2018. Missing Medical records from the enrollment exam between 2/10/2017 to 2/24/2018" First NOT one customer rep told me about this detail. Second, I told them numerous times that we don't have medical records for most of 2018 since he had no health issues during that time. On top of that, our premiums have increased by 20% each year.

Healthy Paws makes it so difficult to get reimbursed and denies your claim for silly reasons like "we don't have enough medical records" dating back to caveman times! They love delaying payment and trying to find if your pet has a pre-existing condition! I'm beyond disappointed and frustrated with this company!!!
title: Tedious Claims Process - Wont Cover Everything

text: I wanted to write a review for Healthy Paws because I wanted to support them as they have supported me through a tough time with my 6-year-old husky. I want to help other people trying to make the decision of whether or not to incur the monthly cost of pet insurance and then ultimately which one to choose. My husky recently had a bad battle with pneumonia and needed to be hospitalized for two nights to receive IV antibiotics and fluids, needed multiple x-rays, a ‚Äúwash‚Äù, culture sample, and has been on antibiotics for a while now ‚Äì this can all get very expensive very quickly. If I didn‚Äôt have pet insurance, I don‚Äôt know how I would have gotten through it financially ‚Äì having pet insurance allowed me to make the right decisions and luckily, we caught things early. He‚Äôs doing much better now and hopefully on the tail end of this. Healthy Paws has an easy-to-use app to upload the receipts quickly, have very fast reimbursements, customer service has been great and I am so thankful for them. I even got a personalized note asking how he was doing after his battle with pneumonia ‚Äì it wasn‚Äôt a templated email ‚Äì it was a personal note specific to what he had gone through. That is the type of company I want to be a customer of and appreciate.
title: How Healthy Paws helped me

text: Have had dogs our entire lives, but after my wife spent months researching our next pet, an Australian Labradoodle (Finley) we felt getting insurance was a good idea.  I looked at numerous websites and called about 3 I thought sounded good. Upon contacting 2 of them I felt their agents were reading from a script.  When I contacted Healthy Paws I could tell the person really cared about our and Finley's needs. After reviewing many options and answering any of my questions I decided to go with Healthy Paws.  Year one for Finley showed no issues so we never met our deductible (which we chose). 2 months ago Finley became extremely sick, wouldn't eat, shivering...ER and Vet visits with many tests, sonograms and treatment showed Finley with Addison's disease (extremely rare in young dogs) He will live a long and happy life but will need daily medication and once a month injection.  I gathered up about a half dozen Vet statements, scanned them and submitted them on Healthy Paws easy to navigate website.  To my shock I received a confirmation email of our claim in one day.  In about 3 days I received the completed claim status and money that would be in our mail box in the next couple of days.- No questions, no hedging, just quick honest responses.  We couldn't be happier with Healthy Paws (our Vet as astonished about their quick response and will share our story with clients). If you're looking for Pet Insurance I would highly recommend Healthy Paws
title: Awesome Pet Insurance company - Health Paws

text: We have had their insurance since we got our dog.   They are great to work with.   They are responsive, easy to file claims, and we get our reimbursement quickly.   Would recommend to everyone who owns a pet.
title: We have had their insurance since we‚Ä¶

text:
I‚Äôm just waiting for the class action. I want to be the first to join. So by all means, buy their insurance if you want to get in on that class, too.

Every year they‚Äôre going to raise your rates, by 20 to 40%. I started off insuring both of my dogs for under $100. Now it‚Äôs $160 for one dog; I had to drop the other due to cost. 

They say they won‚Äôt raise your rates, and when you inquire about each annual rise, they will say that veterinary costs have risen in your area. They are saying veterinary costs have tripled in a few years. Do you believe that? I don‚Äôt.
title: They triple your rates after you join.

text: Best pet insurance ever.  The people are so understanding and helpful - and even sent a follow up email to see how my dog was doing.  The emergency vet cost a small fortune but Healthy paws was right there with a large reimbursement within 1-2 days, which really helped me get through the emergency knowing that I didn't have to worry about money.  It's sure easy to submit a claim and they are really responsive.  I'm so thankful to have them because you never know when something can happen with a pet.  Thank you, Healthy Paws!
title: Best pet insurance ever

text: I've been a customer of Healthy Paws since 2011. I was REALLY happy with them until the last couple years. The premium for my small mixed breed dog started at about $20/month, and increased by a few dollars each year. Ok, no problem. However, the year he turned 12, the premium nearly tripled, then doubled the year after that. For our pure-bred large breed, the policy was always on the expensive side, but we again saw it double the year she turned 8. The premium for both dogs is now nearly $600/month. I am 100% committed to the idea of pet insurance, but I can't help but feel like Healthy Paws is trying to off-load us as customers now that my dogs are older. I am so disappointed and angry. Now that my dogs have a bunch of pre-existing conditions, our only options are to drop coverage or pay premiums that are on track to double each year. This is completely unacceptable for a company that claims to want to support your family for the life of your pet. They don't mean it.
title: Angry and disappointed

text: I am so glad to have Healthy Paws pet insurance! It was the best decision I made when our pup Brody joined our family 9 years ago. Brody developed a chronic condition last year and having the insurance coverage  is a blessing!  It takes the financial stress of the situation away. They have a really simple to use app that we use for claims and each claim only takes a few seconds to submit.  I always recommend Healthy Paws to my friends when they bring home a new pup!
title: Healthy Paws is the BEST

text:
Purchasing Healthy Paws Pet Insurance for my little Iris was one of the best pet-parent decisions I have made. I have had dogs my entire adult life, and I knew when I got Iris that I wanted to make sure that she would get all the care she needed if injury or illness occurred. I did a little research and settled on Healthy Paws, which has turned out to be a great decision.

Recently Iris injured her knee and needed major reconstructive surgery. I had not yet filed a claim with Healthy Paws in the 3+ years that we've had the policy so I was nervous how it would go (having had to fight human health insurers in the past). 

To my surprise and delight, the claim filing process was easy and streamlined, all online. I received follow-up emails from Healthy Paws folks shortly after filing, and my claims have all been filled without hassle within a few days of being complete. They even wrote me a personal note to check in on Iris after her surgery.

To pet owners on the fence about insurance: do it. It is affordable, and even if it means you are just paying for your pet's healthcare in monthly installments (as premiums) overtime, it still makes it worth it to ease the burden of decision when the bad news comes that illness or injury requires expensive treatment.

Healthy Paws is my only experience with pet insurance, and I will unequivocally and enthusiastically recommend them to others, and will continue to use them for Iris and any other pet living in my household.
title: Purchasing Healthy Paws Pet Insurance‚Ä¶

text: Last month my dog Ellie got severely sick and needed to be hospitalized for a week. She needed round the clock care. We've had Healthy Paws for Ellie since we adopted her as a puppy, we called them and inquired about their direct pay option and explained the situation. They were super helpful and very sympathetic to our situation. They made it very easy. They were able to pay the vet directly saving us from having to make the impossible decision of which test or imaging we could afford, or if we should just treat the symptoms and hope for the best. Thanks to the insurance's help we were able to afford all of the recommended tests and imaging and they were able to properly diagnose and treat Ellie. She's now back to her old energetic and happy self and you would never know how sick she was or that she had to stay in the hospital for a week.

title: Very unhappy!! More than Doubled my rate!!

text:
Soon after I got my dog 5 years ago, I decided to go looking for a health insurance company for her. Not wanting to get hit with big vet bills if something happens was an important thought for me. 
Back then there were less reviews, but based on what I found, I decided to go with Healthy Paws for the following reasons:
- My dog was young and the wait period was only 7 days after initial vet exam
- No pre-existing conditions that I would have needed to get covered (as far as I know they are hard if not impossible to get covered)
- Comparing prices they were cheaper than others
- I didn't need routine vet care coverage

Over the last nearly 6 years my dog, unfortunately, needed medication and vet attention on numerous occasions and had multiple surgeries, not even talking about a full check up from an animal oncologist. The most recent surgery being a CBLO repair for her cruciate ligament in her back leg. 
After the initial claim, reimbursement claims are usually approved within 24 hours! I never had an issue with getting anything not covered that I expected to be covered. 
I get follow up emails from Healthy Paws as well asking how my dog is doing and if she is recovering well. This happened not only once but with every bigger claim I have filed. 

Now, why only 4 stars? Things to keep in mind:
- The exam fees are not covered, only medication, treatments/surgeries, rehabilitation. If you have ever taken your dog to a specialty vet, the exam fee doubles or triples to what a regular vet charges. It would be great if specialty  exams would be covered, at least for the amount above the regular vet exam fee.
- Premiums are getting higher and higher. This is also not a surprise, but unfortunately, because of the above mentioned 'no coverage of pre-existing' for most all pet insurances, just switching to a cheaper provider after price comparison is not really an option. So what we would do with car or home insurance, we can't do with pet insurance. The selection of a pet health insurance seems to be for the life time of the pet because of this. In more than 50% of cases, when one knee needed a surgery because of the cruciate ligament, the other knee will give out too because of over use. Cancelling or switching insurance would mean that that injury would not be covered at all. Again even with rising premiums they keep them just low enough so it makes sense to keep the peace of mind. 
- Premiums are depending on your location! Now, I get if you move out of state or from rural to metro, but I moved a town over and my premium per month was $10 higher. Moved 5 mils east (and actually closer to a more metro area, but same population density as before) and my premium went down $15 a month again. I get this for a car insurance, but for a pet health insurance? Seems weird to me.

Again, even though there are some pain points, I would chose Healthy Paws again as my dog's healthcare insurance for my next dog. The promptness in payment, in answering any and all questions and care of the employees are the factors that count for me.

text: Healthy Paws is an incredible insurance company, and I enthusiastically recommend them to any pet parent looking for high quality pet insurance.  Healthy Paws was originally recommended to me by a close friend who has several pets covered with the company.  My sweet dog Chloe was recently hospitalized for two weeks with immune mediated thrombocytopenia.  During the course of her hospitalization, she developed severe complications, necessitating three blood transfusions and a platelet transfusion.  Thanks to Chloe's pet insurance policy with Healthy Paws, Chloe is alive today.  Healthy Paws paid over $9,000.00 on Chloe's claim, allowing her to get the medical treatment necessary to save her life.  Healthy Paws evaluated the claim the next business day of me submitting it for reimbursement and direct deposited the reimbursement the following business day.  And, one of the claims adjusters emailed several days after Chloe returned home to see how she was doing.  Chloe and I cannot thank Healthy Paws enough - we are so grateful to have her pet insurance coverage with the company!  If you are looking for a fair, efficient, and compassionate pet insurance company, look no further for coverage.
title: Highly Recommend Healthy Paws!

text:

text:
Dear Healthy Paws,

I am 68 years old, disabled and on social security.  The love of my life is in your care.  My heart is in your hands.  

Without Healthy Paws, my little boy, Dude, would have had to be euthanized because I could not have afforded the doctors who are healing him.  I live a simple life.  It‚Äôs just Dude and me, 24/7 buddies.  We wake up together, walk together, play together and fall asleep peacefully together.  When Dude started having unexpected problems, Healthy Paws was right beside me, making it possible to pull him through.  I would have been shattered without Healthy Paws.

I was prepared to exhaust all my meager  savings to keep Dude alive.  I was prepared to lose my house to save him.  Healthy Paws prevented me from financial ruin and saved my best friend.

My best advice to people who love their pets:  Protect your ‚Äúheart‚Äù with Healthy Paws insurance:

If you don‚Äôt have insurance, and you are researching, STOP as soon as you find Healthy Paws and enroll.

If you already have Healthy Paws insurance, do a good deed, and refer others to sign up.

Healthy Paws reps pick up every phone call.  The reps are compassionate.  They have pets of their own and they listen and wrap their arms around you.  They understand what you are going through and the fear you feel. They are efficient and get your claims moving  through the system to the right people.  They turn around reimbursements quickly and they deliver exactly what they promised you when you signed up with them.  

What does the future hold for me and Dude?   

During Dude‚Äôs stomach surgery, they discovered the source of his previous health problems.  He has a liver shunt that is preventing his liver from working properly to filter toxins and bypassing blood flow to his liver, damaging it.  He is scheduled for one last surgery, which will restore his liver so that Dude will ‚Äúlive a long healthy life.‚Äù  Dude is in God‚Äôs hands now, with the help of the skilled hands of his surgeon.  Healthy Paws is still by my side.

My hope is this.  I will dutifully pay my premiums every month for the rest of my life and NEVER HAVE TO UPLOAD ANOTHER CLAIM.  Dude will be healthy and he will live a long life.  I will watch him ‚Äúsashay‚Äù down the sidewalk like he used to.  He and I will wrestle with his kitty sock puppet again.  And every night, like he always does, he will wrap his arms around my neck and he‚Äôll fall asleep on my head.

Thank you, Healthy Paws.  You did all this for me and much more.

Judy Thomas
title: Testimonial

text: This is the best company I have ever had for my pet insurance. Unlike other companies I have dealt with, this company pays out your claims promptly and without endless excuses to reduce the amount of the payments. When you sign up for a 10 percent deductible, you get back a full 90% of your vet fees. Other companies I have dealt with manage to come up with various exclusions bringing down their claim payments to only around 50% on a 90% plan. In fact, I recently had vet bills of over $30,000 dollars for my two sick dogs, one receiving cancer treatments and the other needing major knee surgery. Healthy Paws paid me the full 90% of some very expensive claims. They even sent an email asking how my dog was doing after the knee surgery. You can‚Äôt buy better pet insurance than this. I‚Äôll stick with Healthy Paws for all my future pet insurance needs. You should give them a try.
title: Hands Down‚Ä¶the best pet insurance company

text: Healthy Paws Ins. Is amazing! They are very cost effective and pay out at 90%. Their staff is very helpful, kind and curtious.  They always treat me like family and know just what to say in times of need.

text: We, like many others, adopted a puppy during the pandemic. A friend recommended Healthy Paws and it was the best decision we ever made! It really takes the anxiety out of pet ownership, and means that we never have to make hard decisions due to finances. Our plan has saved us, and saved our pup, countless times. The customer service is always supportive, and we cannot recommend Healthy Paws enough!
title: Thank you Healthy Paws!

text:
People rarely take the time to write good reviews. If the company does what it promises, we‚Äôll that‚Äôs expected. I had two dogs (one has passed, unfortunately) with another insurance company. It has not been pleasant. When I got my first pet insurance policy, I really didn‚Äôt do a lot of research. Having experienced terrible customer service, lifetime limits (my fault), and up to four months to settle a claim, I did a lot of research when I got a new puppy. I chose Healthy Paws. So let me tell you  about my first experience. He was hospitalized with pneumonia two weeks after I signed up with Healthy Paws. I sent them the invoice and doctors notes. The claim was settled two days (yes two days) after my submission. The money was in my account the third day. They reimbursed the exact amount that was stated in the policy. That was a year ago. I posted this experience on Facebook, and it turns out, many of my friends use Healthy Paws.  They all said they had similar experiences. Over the past year, I have submitted claims for minor illnesses, and the experience is the same.  The money is in my account within 7 days of submission. Given my experience with the other insurance company, it is extremely stress less and straight forward. Healthy Paws might be a little more expensive, but absolutely worth the cost. 
So just a little advice if you are doing research. Lifetime incident amount is critical. If your breed is susceptible to certain disorders, take that into consideration when you sign up for the lifetime limit. With my other insurance company. (I still have an old dog and I can‚Äôt take him off that policy) I had a $5000 lifetime incident cap. He is a clumber spaniel and they are prone to get hip dysplasia. He has had two operations for hirneated discs. I maxed out on the first operation. My new dog is also a clumber spaniel, so I signed on to a 25k max. Hopefully, it will be a complete waste of money.
Bottom line, Healthy Paws is excellent.
title: Would give 10 stars

text: Healthy Paws has exceeded our expectations in every way. We decided to get pet insurance for our bernedoodle puppy, who is now only 3 years old. Despite a perfect puppyhood, she ruptured the dog equivalent of our ACL in the spring and required surgery and physical therapy to repair it. Then just a few weeks ago, for no apparent reason, she became ill and required a trip to the nearby emergency vet. We were told she had experienced a toxin to her liver. That ultimately entailed a stay at the incredible CSU Veterinary Hospital in Northern Colorado. It was devastating to imagine losing such an important and much-loved part of our family, and fortunately thanks to Healthy Paws, the financial impact did not have to determine whether or not we could keep her and enjoy many years ahead together. We were able to provide her the care she needed to recover and is back to romping and cuddling. Both of these were completely unforeseen accidents in an otherwise super healthy dog. Again, thanks again, Healthy Paws!!
