text: I believe Healthy Paws is the best pet health insurance there is.  One thing I absolutely love is their app that makes it beyond easy to submit a claim.  Just take a photo of your bill, push send and you're done.  It really doesn't get any easier.  And, unlike the previous health insurance company we had, they base their reimbursement on what your vet actually charges.  Our previous company based reimbursement on what they felt was customary and fair by comparing rates in other states, as though I was supposed to find those vets and travel a bit.  When researching pet health companies, you may want to ask them what, exactly, constitutes a pre-existing condition.  We found out the hard way when our previous company stopped paying for cancer treatments for our dog because the policy renewed in the middle of treatment.  Anything connected to her cancer was now considered pre-existing.  Healthy Paws doesn't work that way.  We have had some unexpected expenses with our dogs, as do many people.  The peace of mind Healthy Paws offers is something I am not willing to give up.  They are so easy to work with, their reimbursements are fast and fair, and my dogs will always have them to watch their backs. I never want to be in the position of having to choose between excellent care for my best friends and my bank account.  I'm truly grateful to Healthy Paws.
title: Healthy Paws Pet Insurance is the best!

text: Healthy Paws has been very fast with its claims with no issues. They cover what they say they cover and I haven't had any problems with its service. We have used their service for about 5 years now and would recommend them highly.
title: Healthy Paws has been very fast with‚Ä¶

text:
We have the best lab/shep mix dog in the world. Our girl, Zoe, came to us New Year's Eve 2020 and was supposed to be a 2 week foster -- we failed miserably. No way could we give her up. A few months before her first birthday we noticed she would limp after extended running or playing with other dogs. We took her to our vet and he diagnosed her with ununited anconeal process and urged us to take her to an ortho specialist. We did so and after a CT scan, ortho diagnosed her with "bilateral fragmented medial coronoid process of the ulna with secondary elbow osteoarthritis, bilaterally (BOTH LIMBS).

We took her for surgery (ulnar ostectomy - bilaterally) on a Monday - which lasted over 3 hours. She was hospitalized overnight. On Tuesday, we picked her up and paid our bill (over $10k up front). I submitted a claim to Healthy Paws on Tuesday and sent Zoe's medical records on Wednesday. On Friday I received an email that Zoe's claims were approved and on Monday the money (80%) was transferred into my bank account. It didn't even take a full week from the time of her surgery for Healthy Paws to handle everything.

I am shocked to see a company this responsive and am so thankful we signed up for Healthy Paws. Day by day Zoe is betting better but will need care from time to time for the rest of her life. I'm glad we're in good hands. The coverage is outstanding and the claim processing time is unbelievable. If you're considering pet insurance (and you should!), please go with Health Paws. They are truly the best. I can't more strongly recommend a company.
title: Simply Outstanding

In my opinion, the reply was just as cold and rude, "I recommend reviewing the Explanation of Benefits that was provided in your claim email as that outlines what was covered versus not covered. The email gives an explanation as to what was not eligible for coverage based on the line items on the invoice you submitted. I recommend contacting our Customer Care Team with any additional questions after reviewing your Explanation of Benefits."

Thanks so much for your interest in Teddy!! Teddy is doing very well after needing a miracle surgery to save him! title: Responsive and caring Insurance Company

text:
Our puppy, Daenerys, is our Shepherd, Malinois furry baby. She was adopted from a shelter at three months. I immediately did a lot of research on insurance providers for pets. Healthy Paws Pet Insurance was rated very highly plus they had no maximum limits on claim payouts and provided reimbursed on 90% of an emergency medical cost. These are the reasons to purchase insurance; to cover the cost in case of emergencies.

One day while out, Daenerys drank from an anti-freeze puddle in a parking lot. After talking to the vet hospital, we immediately decided to take her in for treatment. Even small amounts of anti-freeze can kill most pets, but by the time you see symptoms it is usually to late. The hospital did find anti-freeze toxins in her blood, and she underwent dialysis for five hours to save her life.

After the procedure I filed a claim with Healthy Paws. I was worried that they might reject the claim for some reason and would have to fight to get the payment. We had only paid nine months of premiums at this point and the bill for the hospital was over $5,000, so they were losing money on this payout.  But Healthy Paws came through for us. Not only did they get the claim and money over to us within about 48 hours after they received the paperwork, but they also wrote to check on how Daenerys was doing after reading the medical report.  

Thanks, Healthy Paws!  We really appreciate all your support!

text: My 6-year-old dog has been insured with Healthy Paws for years and we've made very few claims. I was prepared for incremental increases in my monthly premium. However, I was shocked at how my Healthy Paws jacked up my rates over the past year. They skyrocketed from from $39.05 a month in May 2020 to $65.69 in June 2021. That's a 68% increase in the span of a year! According to their own website when I bought my insurance, the company stated: "Due to the increasing cost of new technology and advances in veterinary care, your rates will increase slightly each year. Our plan has factored the expected increase in the cost of veterinary care into your rates so that the annual premium increases are manageable." This is neither a "slight" or "manageable" premium hike. When I complained to the company, they pretty much said more people are filing claims in my state than expected and that's just the way it goes. I feel I was deceived by the company's website and that the company made false claims about its rates. I see it recently changed its website language under FAQs and no longer use the words "slight" or "reasonable" to describe their increasing rates. It's no wonder why. If you're looking for pet insurance, look elsewhere. They aren't a good company for your pet long term.
title: Don't trust their intro rates - they skyrocket later

title: THE PRO'S AND CON'S

text:
After a year of vet visit after vet visit, I really have to hand it to Healthy Paws. My cat, Nemo, has had a pretty traumatic year, health-wise. Between an FIC diagnosis and some strange GI symptoms that we're still getting to the bottom of, he's been in-and-out of a string of vets' offices, has seen a few specialists, and has made a number of trips to emergency vets. Throughout the year, he's probably endured a half dozen series of xrays, three ultrasounds (two with sedation, one with a specialist), and at least 5 blood panels. None of this would have been possible without Healthy Paws. 

Thanks to our coverage, I can always say "yes" to the vet when another test is proposed or avenue explored. I've never had to decide between his care and my wallet. Most fantastically, his FIC is the most stable it's been in ten months and we've ruled out all the "scary GI culprits", so we're likely looking at an obscure intolerance. I'm feeling hopeful for the first time in a long time. 

While Healthy Paws doesn't cover routine care or the exam itself, when a pet is truly experiencing a health crisis (and the bills are rapidly adding up), it becomes very apparent very quickly how valuable pet insurance is. Nemo would have to live 33 years at our current monthly rate for us to "lose money" on this plan (additionally, the peace of mind this insurance provides cannot be put into a monetary figure, but is even more valuable, in my opinion). While I hope I never face so many health challenges with another pet, it's great to know that Healthy Paws will always be there. 

I am so thankful to be writing this review with my beloved boy snoozing away on my lap. He's just celebrated his sixth birthday, a milestone I feared we wouldn't reach a few months ago. Thank you, Healthy Paws, for keeping Nemo protected. I recommend your services every chance I get.
title: Zero Regrets in Choosing Healthy Paws

text: Healthy Paws has far exceeded my expectations! Submitting a claim via email or their app is very easy and their customer service is stellar. Whenever I have a question, it is quickly answered by a friendly and helpful representative.

text: My first anniversary date is 11/2021.  Over the past couple of months, my 4 year old dog tested positive for an autoimmune skin condition which required a nose biopsy, frequent visits to the vet and medication.  I submitted a claim for the nose biopsy which was summarily declined before the results came back.  Appealing the decision, they eventually paid part of it.  Then, there were two sick visits to the vet neither which were covered because they are considered pet exams.  The meds were covered, but needed to be submitted separately, and one was overlooked and needed my follow up to get the reimbursement.  Today, I got a note saying my premium would be going up almost $10 a month on my first anniversary date based on a state by state reimbursement algorithm.   They reevaluate your premiums every year, I‚Äôm sure, with an eye towards raising them.  I‚Äôm also understanding that the deductibles can go up as your pets age.  I‚Äôm warning you to look closely at these pet insurance companies and do a proper comparison before you buy. And I don‚Äôt recommend Healthy Paws.
title: Buyer Beware

text: Great coverage at a good price and a hassle-free claims process. Our dog suffered a complete rupture of his right CCL in 2019 and then his left almost exactly two years later. Healthy Paws covered almost all of the associated cost of both surgeries. I can't imagine an easier claims process - just upload your bills and receive reimbursement a few days later. It's a relief to be able to focus on helping our dog with his recovery with a fantastic insurance company on our side.
title: Great coverage at a good price and a‚Ä¶

text:
I have had the insurance for both of my cats for the past 2 years and I will confidently say the decision was one of the best decisions I made. 
My cats were both 5 and 6 when I got the insurance coverage and they didn't have any previous history of diseases. They were all rescued and not any specific breed so no genetic issues I know of. 
The process was easy from the beginning with all the documents submission done via the app. 
I got this insurance to prepare for any disastrous incidents. I didn't want to make any decision based on my financial availability if anything happen to my cats. And the monthly fee for both cats weren't too bad (initially $27 per month for both and now $33)
This decision paid off. Last year, somi got an aspirational pneumonia and I had to take her to an emergency clinic. At that moment, having the insurance allowed me not worrying about the emergency bills that might cost an arm and a leg. And when I got the bill, the healthy paw was so quick to process the claim and most of treatment was covered and lifted a great deal of my financial burden. Since then, I am recommending the healthy paw insurance for everyone. I know that there are many pet insurance company with so many different coverage ( preventive care cover or dental cover) and when it comes to the claim, they never meet the expectation and give a hard time for the pet owners. I had a couple of friends also who experience the similar situations. And hearing that insurance horror stories and knowing how easy it was for me to claim for my case, I highly recommend the healthy paw insurance. The pet insurance would not save your dimes and pennies in your routine veterinary visits, but it will come and save you when your pet is in severe condition like it did with mine.
title: Great insurance for a rainy day! Your pet needs it

text: Incredibly reliable insurance. Very easy to file claims. C/S has been very friendly and informative when I‚Äôve called. My pet had 2 TPLO surgeries and then needed hardware removed a year later because of rejection. Thank God we had insurance! Definitely will use Healthy Paws for every pet into the future!
title: Incredibly reliable insurance

text: I never write a review but this company is far from professional. I insured my healthy dog to have piece of mind, first claim I have submitted after three years, they refused to process  due to lack of medical history of a healthy dog even though I have shown our regular vet visits. I am not out for reimbursement anymore but I want others to be aware. It is a scam. They also kept increasing the monthly charges of last years but I have never complained. At this point, I am taking my case to consumer protection agencies.
title: I never write a review but this company‚Ä¶

text: Having good coverage is a blessing!  We've carried Healthy Paws for about 4 years now on at least one dog.  Now all 4 are covered. Recently, our beloved coonhound Maybellene got very sick.  In the process of treating and trying to figure out what was going on, we spent almost $6000 on vet bills.  After the claims were paid, which was EXTREMELY fast, we were hugely relieved to have a large portion of that back to return to savings.  If you don't have pet insurance, you need it!  Healthy Paws also helps shelter pets when someone uses your referral code, so how can you beat that?  I will always have insurance on my babies, and they have been wonderful!  They even followed up on Maybellene a few weeks later.  I truly appreciate that care and concern. Thank you, Healthy Pets!!  I am posting here because I contacted them and asked where I could leave a review.  I want all my friends to have this piece of mind when it comes to their fur family.  Who has ever been able to say, "Nah, don't do that test.  Even though it might tell us what is wrong & how to treat it, we don't think the dog is worth that".  NOBODY I know!  Get the insurance, you will not regret it!
title: Having good coverage is a blessing!!!

text: We bought Healthy Paws insurance for our sweet dog when she was about 4 years old. Since she wasn't a puppy I was worried -- many pet insurance companies only take baby pets and I hoped I would be able to count on the coverage in the future.  I worried they might say something was "pre-existing" -- she didn't have anything going on except food allergies but I was afraid that might be used as an excuse to not pay later.  I could have saved myself the worry!  We have had quite a few claims over the years and I have never ever been given any grief on getting the policy benefits for any claim I have filed.  In fact, I am so convinced I will never go without a Healthy Paws insurance policy ever again.  In addition, filing claims is super easy -- using the online form it takes only about a minute to file a claim and you can even do it on your phone.  If you ever need to call for help, the customer service representatives are AMAZING!  They are incredibly friendly and helpful and it's clear they care first and foremost about your pet.  It's a pleasure to do business with Healthy Paws!
title: I'll never go without a Healthy Paws insurance policy again!

text:
**I am a hard critic.
There has never been an issue with Healthy Paws. All experiences are very pleasant!
title: Tough critic gives 5 stars!

text: I was not expecting that claim will be processed so quickly and easy without any hassle. I uploaded hospital discharge form of my cat's leg surgery and received a cheque in a couple of days. Highly recommended
title: Fair and quick

text: I signed both of my dogs up for healthy paws in 2015 and 2016. When first enrolled the insurance was around 100 per month for both of my pets. I understand prices need to be increased each year. However for my 2 dogs I am now paying 303 a month and they say claims do not increase based off of your pets claims. Unfortunately both of my dogs have had some health issues over the last few years which resulted in quite a few vet visits. Multiple times claims had been denied or not paid as they marked it as preventative care. I'm sorry but what dog normally gets bloodwork done multiple times a year that would be preventative. My vet has even sent forms in from visits to show that it was not a wellness checkup. Paying over 4000 a year with my deductible seems a little outrageous and who can really afford this? From what I have noticed is your insurance will stay lower as long as you don't put many claims in on your pets.
title: Outrageous price increases

text: My German Shepherd fell causing an injury to his discs in his back, this lead to surgery and the removal of three discs.  This type of injury requires a neurosurgeon we used Dr. C. Jurney she‚Äôs terrific.  This type of surgery is on the expense side and I‚Äôm so glad we have Healthy Paws Insurance.  We filed the claim and they took care of it within a week.  I call that excellent service they even emailed me to see how Grizz was doing.
title: My German Shepherd‚Äôs injury

text:
We have had Healthy Paws since 2018. We ABSOLUTELY LOVE HP's! We will never have any other insurance EVER!  We took our Weimaraner puppy in for an X-ray for his front leg limp (puppies being puppies), and it showed his super enlarged heart in the X-ray. 
What ended up being a leg sprain, turned into much much worse and life-threatening.  After a Cardiologist appt asap, Frank was dx with a rare congenital heart disease called, Tricuspid Valve Dysplasia, which dogs succumb usually by age 3 without intervention.
We found out that Frank was a candidate for Open Heart Surgery at the only place in the World that performs TVD surgery, @ Colorado State University Veterinary Teaching Hospital. He had Open Heart Surgery on 7/31/19 at 17 months old, which included Cardiopulmonary Bypass by a Perfusionist from the human hospital.  Frank will be 4 on 12/9/21.

We chose the 90% coverage, not knowing of his heart issue and Healthy Paws Paid 90% of his surgery except for the exam costs.

HIGHLY RECOMMEND! Super easy to submit claims and fast reimbursement.  LOVE HP's!
title: Covered Open Heart Surgery including Bypass

text:
My dog just got discharged from the animal hospital this Tuesday 08/31/21 and Healthy Paws denied all my insurance claims sighting a pre-existing condition.
¬†He had ITP (6 years ago) and got IMHA a week ago.¬† Different disease as ITP destroys blood platelets and IMHA destroys Red Blood Cell.
¬†It was not a pre-existing condition as my dog‚Äôs attending physicians said these are 2 completely different diseases.¬† Pre-existing if he had a relapse on ITP but the one he got is IMHA. This is not about money as i can spend twice the amount of money i am claiming. This is about integrity...
title: Denied Claims

text: This company is excellent.  Not just because they actually pay out on claims, but also they are efficient, thorough and very fast. We had the unfortunate experience of our dog coming down with some sort of virus and a also some kind of hard growth on her belly. She needed x-rays, ultrasound, bloodwork, stool tests, the whole gamut. Turned out it was just a Gastrointestinal infection and some fatty tissue build up which turned out to be harmless and she was OK after a few days with some medicine.  You just don‚Äôt know any of this until after the visits, but those few visits to the emergency vet cost me over $2000 in the course of three visits over 8 days. I submitted a claim after each visit and it was promptly processed and reimbursed within a couple of days each time. I hope we don‚Äôt have to use our insurance very often, but it‚Äôs nice to know that if we do we have a reliable company now.
title: This company is excellent

text: So my two-year-old cat had to be rushed to emergency vet/hospital four a urinary blockage that he had. Immediately after he received his care I received invoices and submitted them I was quickly received with a call asking how stash was and to ask me a couple other questions. This was a bill over $3800 so I was a little concerned with the phones and healthy paws helped escalate and deliver this claim process within 7 days. I definitely recommend using healthy paws as they were great efficient professional and empathetic.
title: Amazing service, empathetic staff

text: The worst customer service I have ever experienced. Takes forever for anyone to answer a call. Sent in a claim and got the run around about the claim being processed and paid. I was told over and over that my vet never sent the necessary records which I found out was not the truth so I ask the vet to send them to me so I too forwandered them on. Then they needed additional information from my vet which I found out they received but the records were never sent to the review person's until I called. Now I am told I have to wait another 30 days while I continue to pay my premium not knowing if our claim will be paid or not. I have spent hours on the phone talking to so many different individuals with different stories being told to me. The stress and time spent is not worth it.
title: The worst customer service I have ever‚Ä¶

text:
I cannot even express how THANKFUL I am for Healthy Paws. My 3yr kitty named Jacob all of a sudden became so so sick. His fever touched 105.6. They thought his liver, pancreas, and gallbladder was failing. He had to be in the hospital for 5 days/nights.

.... it was almost 10k.  right? 
But Healthy Paws came to the rescue and was able to reimburse a large portion of that bill.

If you are on the edge about getting the insurance... DO IT.
You will not regret it.
title: Healthy Paws Insurance is WORTH IT

text: We had questions regarding a new policy. No body answers the phone or you are told there is a 2 hour wait or to call back later. That's not very encouraging for a new client.
title: Response time‚Ä¶

text: Healthy Paws was recommended by many colleagues when I got my dog as a little puppy 6 years ago, I choose HP despite another pet insurance was offered with discount price from my work. As most pet owners, I don't even think about the pet insurance much when our furkids are healthy. There were a few incidents in the past, she needed some medications or treatments for parasite like Giardia or a cracked tooth, HP has been very responsive and always explained the policy in detail for their decision.  Most recently my dog was diagnosed with anal sec tumor, facing a large amount vet bill for the surgery and possible future chemotherapy, I did not hesitate or worry about the necessary treatments, since I know that HP will cover all reasonable cost.  In fact, the claim for the surgery bill was filed on last Friday afternoon and I already got the final decision this Monday with everything covered by the policy.  I am very impressed with their fast response and the warm and caring messages I received during these difficult times.  It is extremely  comforting to know that you could just focus on your furkid's best being without worry about too much on the vet bills.  I strongly recommend Healthy Paws Pet Insurance for anyone.
title: A great pet insurance to have

text: I have had Healthy Paws pet insurance for my 2 cats and 2 dogs for the last 4 years.  Sadly, one of my animals has had major health problems every year.  Healthy Paws has been wonderful.  It is easy to submit claims, a decision is made and payment sent within a week.  The customer service is outstanding.  On Friday the 13th my little dog Pretzel lost the use of her back legs due to a blown out disk in her back.  The cost so far is more than $10,000 -- for ER treatment, spinal surgery and dog rehab.  Healthy Paws has cheerfully paid 80% of the cost -- much more responsive and efficient than my Blue Cross people insurance!!
title: Excellent insurance -- glad I have it!

text: My husband and I insured our 2 cats at the advice of our vet, and we were very happy we followed that advice! One of our cats has had several large claims, and we have been very impressed with Healthy Paws. Filing a claim is simple, the coverage has been great, the reimbursement quick, and the customer service helpful. We are very pleased with Healthy Paws and would highly recommend it to other pet owners.
title: Healthy Paws pet insurance

text: It has been great working with Healthy Paws. They are super prompt, and have great customer service. After my puppy had surgery they went out of their way to check in on her, which I thought was extremely thoughtful . I would definitely recommend this pet insurance to all my friends.
title: It has been great working with Healthy‚Ä¶

text: I had a wonderful experience with Healthy Paws covering emergency veterinary expenses for my 14 year old Doberman recently.  I suspected she was experiencing a Urinary Tract Infection and knew she needed to be seen quickly to prevent it from spreading.  I was able to take her to my vet to receive the highest quality care, all the while knowing her policy with Healthy Paws would stand behind us and cover the cost of her treatment; allowing me to focus on tending to her medical needs and ensuring she felt better as soon as possible.  I have had all my rescue dogs covered with Healthy Paws since 2010 and their genuine concern for the cause of finding homes for homeless pets and providing a way for pet parents to pay for sometimes expensive medical care is above and beyond.  I would highly recommend them!
title: Healthy Paws Pet Insurance is Excellent

text: We have been with Healthy Paws ever since adopting our dog in 2015. They have been nothing short of outstanding by providing transparent, understandable, and user friendly service. Most recently our dog needed emergency care, which required us to submit a claim. Within 48 hours the claim was processed and we received reimbursement within the week. We have also referred Healthy Paws to other family members who also have had great experience with them!
title: Excellent service

text: After experiencing so many health issues with my childhood family dog, I was convinced that I would always have pet insurance for every animal I ever own; and advocated for others to do the same. Unfortunately, my experience with Healthy Paws has since caused me to do a complete 180 turn on my opinion. Since becoming a loyal customer in 2015, I can count on less than one hand how many claims were actually covered. With monthly premiums increasing to $150 in 2021, Healthy Paws covered all of $4 out of $200 on my dogs' most recent medical issue. After sinking over $1,000 in just 2021 on one dogs' premium, I was expecting more. But no, they are almost worse than human health insurance companies. Upon cancelling my policy, I was met with the worst customer service after having to call 4 different times to get my monthly premium back. You're better off just setting up a savings account and putting the premium aside in there.
title: Waste of money!

text: Maia, our 1 year old puppy, had to be taken to see an emergency vet due to some stomach issues. Fortunately, after blood tests and x-rays, it was determined that Maia's heath issues were not serious. I filed a claim to Healthy Paws and it was processed within 1 to 2 days. Since meeting the deductible, I received a check within 10 days for reimbursement for the claim. The claim process was very easy to complete and the response time was incredibly fast. Maia is back to her energetic self and I feel at ease knowing that I have pet insurance that I can rely on.
title: Recommendation

text: Our one-year-old kitty was taken suddenly ill recently with repeated bouts of vomiting, and loss of energy.  We took him to our local vet.  They x-rayed him, gave him IV fluids and medication and kept him overnight.  By the next day he was thankfully feeling much better. We took him home and he was quickly back to his former self.  We notified Healthy Paws, sent in the vet's notes, and quickly received a response that they would cover 80% of the bill, minus a small copay.  Sure enough, a few days later we received a check in the mail.  A few days after that, they even called to enquire as to how he was doing!  We couldn't be happier with this insurance company.  Worth every penny!  Thanks!
title: Very pleased with "Health Paws!"

text:
Insurance is one of those things that it's hard to feel good about - until you need it. That is where HealthyPaws absolutley delivers above and beyond. Our dog was diagnosed with a degenerative disc disease a couple years ago. We love the guy and he was getting the surgery regardless of coverage. I called Healthypaws to see if this procedure was covered and sure enough, it was. 
I called HP a couple weeks after to see what the hold up was in processing my claim only to find the vet didn't file it as they promised. This is where the real customer service magic happened. The girl I was talking to said not to worry, that she would call the vet and get all the forms, etc. By the end of the day I had confirmation that the claim was filed. a day later it was approved and 3 days later I had a check. Amazing!
Since that time our poor guys has managed to tear his CCL in both knees - at separate times. In both case the claim was filed and paid within a week. What else could you possibly ask for? This company is serious about it's mission. And our boy is healthy and thriving in part because of it!
title: Absolutely the best!

text:
Complete bait-and-switch.  I signed up for Healthy Paws after doing extensive research and being told that premium increases would be "manageable" and not due to my pet's age.  I was not told that my initial premium was a "promotional rate" and that the rate would increase 40% over 3 years. My dog is young and healthy without any claims over this period.  I wanted to be a long-term customer to help protect us as my dog gets older, but the total cost thus far (and projected into the future) is clear that I am better off putting the money in my own pocket. Healthy Paws sends vague "policy update" emails but never clearly indicated any rate increases and left me to find out by checking my credit card statements. I seriously regret getting caught up in their marketing about the scary costs of vet bills.
Icing on the cake: the minute you cancel, they delete your customer account so you no longer have access to policy documents!
title: Complete bait-and-switch

text: I am outraged! I have been a long term customer since 2013 and they raised my rate from $67.03 to $152.75. In times like these they choose to take advantage of people?! Their lack of empathy and honesty is disgusting! Flat out UNETHICAL!! I DO NOT RECOMMEND THEM!
title: I am outraged

text: I have had Healthy Paws Pet Insurance for many years and several pets. My dog Ziggy recently suffered a torn knee ligament which required surgical repair. Healthy Paws provided excellent coverage and were very efficient and caring in their processing of my claim.  I would highly recommend Healthy Paws Pet Insurance.  They are a great company who really provides a fantastic service to their customers and their pets.
title: Surgical coverage with Healthy Paws Pet Insurance

text: I have had my Black Labrador on Healthy Paws Pet Insurance since she was two years old. Though she was extremely healthy, I purchased the insurance because labs are active and have accidents. Five years went by until I needed to use the policy. My dog was diagnosed with Cushing‚Äôs Disease and the meds are rather expensive. Healthy Paws paid 80% of the cost of the blood tests and the medicine after I satisfied the $250 deductible. Then, this year, my dog tore ligaments in her calcaneal tendon. Since the repair and treatment would cost over $6,000, I called Healthy Paws and asked if I needed a pre-approval. The representative told me that a pre-approval was not necessary and all I had to do was submit the vet invoices. As with other claims, Healthy Paws paid 80% of the surgery and treatment costs. It is easy to submit the invoices‚ÄîI scan mine and use the website, but one can take a picture of the invoice using the Healthy Paws app to submit a claim as well. I am very thankful that I signed up my lab for Healthy Paws when she was younger. I shopped for policies when I was looking several years ago and Healthy Paws provided the best coverage for the price that fit my needs.
title: I Highly Recommend Healthy Paws Pet Insurance!

text: Yes I am giving Healthy Paws a bad review.  Several things: #1 probably my fault, I dropped my dogs to go to Nationwide for the dental.  Then I found out that they would not accept one of my 2 dogs due to pancreatitis.  So I added them back to Healthy Paws.  The rate increased because I was insuring dogs at their current age.  They did not honor the fact that they were gone for a matter of days.  #2 They neglected to focus on the Vet invoice and just reimbursed for one dog.  #3 For the past several years they keep holding me up by asking for vet records, one dog at a time.  #4 Every time I submit glucosamine charges, it's always for Jackson.  This time they got confused.  The claims section states that they are waiting for more documents on Ami.  They did not state what they needed.  I submitted on 8/3.  It's now 8/25 and I finally was able to reach them in their time zone.  They stated Ami's name was missing on the Glucosamine receipt.  IT IS NOT FOR AMI, JACKSON ONLY, AS ALWAYS.  I have had Healthy Paws for 10 years now.  They have gone down hill for the past several years.  Oh, #5 all of a sudden my rate increased.  I called and asked why.  They answered that other dogs are using the insurance more.  WHAT?? My pancreatitis dog has never used Healthy Paws for pancreatitis.  My dogs go for wellness and dental which is not covered.  They have used it for holistic and the emergency room for an extreme reaction to flea/tick shots.  Pancreatitis dog is a rescue dog.  We took her to the ER several times due to her, it looked like to us, freaking out.  Healthy Paws gets their $228.10/mo on time through auto pay.  I would expect the same on time reimbursement payment, which does not happen anymore.
title: Yes I am giving Healthy Paws a bad‚Ä¶

text: I bought insurance for my new pup cause he is very rambunctious and full of energy. Even though I keep a close eye on him, I can't always watch him. Boy am I glad I did. I have already saved thousands in Vet bills in under a year! He swallowed a foreign object and had to have emergency surgery which would have been $3,000+ out of pocket. Healthy Paws covered 90% minus my deductible saving me thousands. Check arrived in about 10 days. Will continue to carry insurance and very happy with their service. Brian, Mount Dora FL
title: I bought insurance for my new pup cause‚Ä¶

text: I agree with the TON of clients who are arguing the increase in rates. My monthly rate just increased by $30 per month for one dog and I have not submitted ANY substantial claims and she is 7.5 years old.  They responded that it was due to the increase in claims filed in my state and basically they spread the costs across their customers.  They do not take into account long term customers nor those who have not had any incidents yet dutifully pay the premium monthly. I will be shopping!
title: Not unless you have DEEP pockets for nothing

text: I wouldn‚Äôt recommend wasting your money on Healthy Paws. I have two corgis - one of who had two torn knee ligament (CCL). Healthy Paws didn‚Äôt end up helping us with either of them. Our dog was checked on a couple months before the incident because she was limping but turned out she was fine but because of that Healthy Paws said it was a pre-existing injury so they didn‚Äôt help us out. So we shelled out 4K next thing we know 8 months after full recovery she blew out the other knee (TPLO). This time healthy paws told us to ‚ÄúRead the fine print‚Äù‚Ä¶ that is your dog had a TPLO or CCL previously they wouldn‚Äôt cover the cost of a second surgery.. which was absolutely crazy. And I‚Äôm not even sure they ever helped us with anything.. total waste of time and money. Their customer service was terrible as well. Company based off lies and deceit‚Ä¶ do yourself a favor and don‚Äôt give them your money.
title: Don‚Äôt waste your money‚Ä¶

text: I have been so impressed with Healthy Paws Pet Insurance. My dog has has a series of health issues over the last year, but because of Healthy Paws I have been able to avoid worrying about the financials and focus on my dog's health. All of the recent claims I have made have been processed quickly and reimbursed even quicker (often within 24 hours). After his recent surgery, the Healthy Paws team even followed up to check on his recovery!
title: So impressed with Healthy Paws

text: I just cancelled my Healthy Paws Insurance. Rates have increased significantly as my dog has gotten older (as other customers have mentioned). Which would be understandable if Healthy Paws had covered ANYTHING or put ANY of my claims through. They consistently cite "missing medical records" as a reason for denial. Sorry if I decided to rescue a  dog rather than buy a puppy. Even so, we had all my dogs medical records accounted for and Healthy Paws still denied all our claims. This company discriminates against those who adopt/rescue dogs. My coworker who gets her puppies from a breeder has had NO problems getting claims approved. That is very disappointing. I would stay far far away from this company.
title: I just cancelled my Healthy Paws‚Ä¶

text:
My dog is now 11 and I had her insured with Healthy Paws for 7 years now. They have been steadily increasing my policy rates every year. This year they increased it by 50%!!!! How does it make any sense that a company is allowed to do that?! My dog's insurance costs more than a human insurance now.
If you have a puppy, think twice if to insure your dog with Healthy Paws because you know now what will happen to your insurance price as your dog gets older! 
This is not how a company that truly cares about pets treats customers. They are just another greedy Enterprise that cares about revenue more than anything else!
title: 50% price increase year over year!!!

text: This company raises premiums at an absurd rate (65% increase over the past 2 years for my dog). I would love to see the support/documentation the company has to show veterinary costs have gone up 65% in two years!! Some quick research shows the average increase in dog plans is only 25% over the last 5-years, never mind 2-years. I would stay away to find a more honest company that does not raise rates as your pet gets older and is more likely to need and use the insurance you're paying for.
title: Premiums Sky-rocketing as pet gets older

text:
I have had my dogs covered with Healthy Paws since 2016. One of my dogs passed away in November 2020 and the claims were paid promptly and easily...which is what I expected given this company's reputation.

My other dog who was also covered since 2016 had some growths which needed to be removed and were later diagnosed as cancerous. I submitted the medical records and received confirmation the claim was being looked at. I was giving it extra time given that things have been moving slowly due to the pandemic.

Imagine my surprise when I received a notice stating the claim was denied and closed because of missing medical records? I have no record in my email or spam of them notifying me that more records were needed. I eventually found something in the messages folder of my Healthy Paws account. 

I sent all the records I had from 2013 to present to appeals and didn't hear anything. I then spoke with someone in customer service who confirmed they received the records but was confused since some of the pages came through upside down...but, she confirmed that it was being worked on.

Weeks went by and still, I heard nothing so I called again.  This time, the customer service rep was confused since all the records were there. He was able to open the file without a problem and he assured me it would be processed.

Another 30 days went by. I heard nothing so I called again. This time I was told that the claim was denied because the appeals person couldn't open the attached files. The same files that the previous rep was able to open and look at. 

This rep set up a level 3 appeal and told me if I didn't hear back in 5 days to call back...which I did today.

I had to start all over again with today's rep and according to him, I have to wait until September 13 before following up again. 

To add insult to injury, I received a notice of a rate increase. Are you kidding me right now? 

Stay away from this company. The customer service reps are very nice people but they have no authority to actually get things done...and the people that do have the authority don't seem to care. 

Robin Rosenhaus
title: Stay Away

text: I have had Healthy Paws pet insurance from the day I brought my dog home.  I researched all of the pet insurance companies and found Healthy Paws reviews to be the best. I really liked that there was only one annual deductible and no other caps on diagnoses or total amount of claims.  Still, I was hoping that I would never need them.  Unfortunately, I did ... several times over the last 6 years, most recently when my dog was diagnosed with a horrible eye disease. Every time I submitted a claim, Healthy Paws processed it quickly and easily.  Given the enormous stress of my dog's illness, the last thing I needed was to have to fight with an insurance company.  That was not the case with Healthy Paws. And, they followed up asking how my dog was doing.  Excellent company with excellent customer service.
title: Excellent Company

text: If I could give this company 0 stars, I would! This is a horrible money sucking organization. I had this insurance for all 5 of my pets and have been paying a total of $1650 since October 2020. I submitted 2 claims in that time period. One of which was denied because they don't cover preventative health care or well check ups. The other, I just learned this morning, was approved but put towards an annual premium so I got nothing back. This new premium amount came out of nowhere and this company scammed me out of $1650. I canceled and will be taking my business elsewhere. I dont pay for premium health insurance for myself or my kids thinking, " ok, they are only half covered, so they'll get half care". I pay the money, I expect full care for my family. Why would it not be the same for family pets. I am very upset üò° with this organization. SAVE YOURSELF AND YOUR PETS FROM THIS COMPANY. THEY WILL DRAIN YOUR WALLET AND GIVE NOTHING BACK!!!!
title: HORRIBLE COMPANY!!!

text: I have had Healthy Paws pet insurance for approximately 4 years.  It is easy to submit a claim.  For each step of the process, I receive an e-mail: when the claim is received, when the claim is being reviewed (in process) and when the claim is completed.  All of this happens very quickly (typically 2-3 days, although I have had approval in 12 hours and an occasional longer time frame). I have submitted 36 claims in the past 6 months and have not had a claim denied - they cover so much, including medication, testing, and procedures. text: Healthy Paws insurance is a great company based on my experience. My dog, Olivia, unfortunately is a pretty naughty girl. We visited the pet ER multiple times: from ingesting foreign objects to falling out of the car. We feel lucky that we bought the insurance right after she came to our home. Being financially supported by Healthy Paws, we can get her the best care with a peaceful mind. text: I joined Health Paws in 2017 and have been quite happy with their service. Until now.  My 4-year-old Border Collie tore a pad on his paw that required veterinary attention.  I submitted the claim only to be told that they were declining to cover the costs as it was a pre-existing condition - a torn paw!  Quite ironic given the company name is "Healthy Paws." They told me that it was declined on the basis of an injury he suffered as a puppy in 2017.  The 2017 injury wasn't even a torn paw pad. I appealed the decision and they couldn't even be bothered to reply.  This is on top of the fact that they keep increasing my premium with no explanation.  I canceled my policy and will try my luck with Lemonade.
title: Healthy Paws wouldn't cover an Unhealthy Paw!

text:
Healthy Paws Pet Insurance provides transparent, fast, and easy service. I have submitted numerous claims for my pet and each one has been processed quickly, sometimes in the same day, and each one has resulted in a reimbursement that does not deviate from my policy. 

Their premiums are very reasonable and I can't recommend too highly the value of these premiums. Most recently (July 2021), my pet needed to have numerous expensive diagnostic procedures for a complex medical issue. I may not have elected for these procedures without the financial security and peace of mind that Healthy Paws provides.
title: Transparent, easy, fast

text:
Healthy Paws Pet Insurance has been the best thing I have ever purchased for my dogs.  I have 4 dogs (all covered through Healthy Paws) and have had nothing but wonderful experiences with this pet insurance.  The claims submittal is extremely easy (only have to submit a picture of the invoice).  The processing of claims and reimbursement is extremely quick (within a few days max).  I would not have been able to give my dogs the best veterinary care they need if I did not have a policy with Healthy Paws.  

I have so many examples. But just a few:

My one German Shepherd has recurring perianal fistulas.  We have been through the ringer with this.  Antibiotics, steroids, laser treatments, and finally immunosuppressants (Atopica).  This medication is EXTREMELY expensive.  Healthy Paws has covered all of these different treatments, including the expensive medication (approximately $345 per month).  There would be no way I could cover this cost myself.  

My other German Shepherd was severe hip dysplasia.  Since she was covered prior to turning 6 years old and did not show symptoms of hip problems within the first year of coverage, Healthy Paws has been a life saver for my poor pup.  For the past few years, she has shown extreme pain and we started anti-inflammatories (Galliprant) as well as gabapentin to relieve some of her pain.  This past year (at age 8), we performed x-rays and my vet said if we do not intervene with more invasive techniques, she would not see my dog making it through the next year.  We were referred to an orthopedic surgeon for possible total hip replacement surgery.  We decided to try the gold standard and replace her right hip on December 16th, 2020.  The cost was astronomical (almost 5 figures).  I submitted my claim to Healthy Paws on the day she was released from the hospital (December 18th). Due to the upcoming holidays and extensive medical records, there was a bit of lag between submitting and being reimbursed.  But the first week in January, I was reimbursed 90% (per my policy option) of the total cost of the surgery.  Healthy Paws literally saved my dogs life.

Every person who asks me about pet insurance hears raving reviews of Healthy Paws Pet Insurance.  Even anyone who talks to me about veterinary bills or upcoming adoptions will also receive a long list of why pet insurance is so important and why Healthy Paws should be their choice of insurance. I would not insure my pets through any other company other than them.
title: Best Pet Insurance Available

text: I have had Healthy Paws insurance for 3 of my last 4 dogs.  Each of them has had major (and majorly expensive) health issues (cancer, cancer, and irritable bowel syndrome that presented as an intestinal blockage). When my dog Bibi eventually passed, they quickly and without being asked cancelled her policy and sent a sympathy card signed by the staff.  I will always remember how touched I was by these incredibly thoughtful gestures.  I highly recommend Healthy Paws to all my friends and family with pets.
title: Easy, reliable, thoughtful insurance

text:
After years of recommending Healthy Paws Pet Insurance [only 1 claim in 2017], I now have to say STAY AWAY!
I am not sure what happened but the 1 claim [Lyme treatment less than $300] I made for my boy since 2017 was a nightmare. 10 days turned into a month. Sent them all the records from both vets. Asked for status at day 10, got canned response "working on it". 3 days later, I asked again then again at day 19, no response either time not even a canned response. Asked again at day 21, their response was to tell me they needed more records including ALL his records for the entire time I've had him [2013]. They've had all these records since the 2017 claim. I [again] sent them all his records from 2013 to date which was only going towards deductible. It wasn't like they were giving me any $. 
Took a MONTH before they approved my claim which was about 2 weeks before his policy renewal. 
The premium for for both dogs went up by $60/mo. My boy has had 2 claims, 1 in 2017 and the other this year. My girl has had none.
I went online and changed her policy to up the deductible to bring policy price down. They apparently didn't do it because they took out the higher figure . 
I went back online and did an "email us" asking why the premium wasn't adjusted. 4 days later, the response was "We can't find a policy under that name. Please provide more information."
What??? 
I was on their site under her name!
Horrible experience.
title: Healthy Paws??? Stay away!

text:
Enrolled my dog (Heidi) 9 years ago when she was 3 months old and had never submitted a claim until recently for a cytologist recommended growth removal. First two claims for the pre-op work (approx $50) were approved but when I submitted the procedure claim ($900) it was delayed so I called them twice. Rep said they had her records for the last 6 years but needed them for the first 3 years AFTER she was enrolled. I said we enrolled her in 2012 so why are records needed for the time AFTER her coverage began. Was told it was to make sure she didn‚Äôt have a precondition! We‚Äôre a military family so we had to move vets in 2015 and the rep said he would reach out to our old vet for the records and I had email notification that the claim would remain open for 30 days in the meantime. 

2 days later the claim was DENIED!! I filed an appeal, dug through all my files to find all of Heidi‚Äôs records and visit notes for her entire life and resubmitted the claim. After two months and contacting them multiple times on email, I still have not received a response. Oh, and in the meantime they increased Heidi‚Äôs monthly premium to $180 a month! Been paying premiums for 9 years without a single claim or medical issue for Heidi. I paid this money for the peace of mind that if she ever had a medical issue she would be, as her profile says on the website, ‚Äúprotected.‚Äù It‚Äôs quite the feeling of betrayal to realize when the time came to make a claim I‚Äôm treated like I just signed up yesterday and ignored. Customers loyal for almost a decade need to be treated with some respect and in accordance with the promises made. It is especially frustrating as, prior to this experience, I had recommended Healthy Paws to several friends and associates.
title: Learned the hard way Heidi has not been "Protected since 06/14/2012"

text:
I have had insurance for my dog for just 10 months with no claims filed or any reimbursement given.
An email just informed me that my monthly rate has just increased by 33% !!!
I purchased my plan never thinking a rate increase of this size in just one year was possible. It‚Äôs a ‚Äúbait and switch ‚Äú scam so be careful.
Time for me to start shopping around for a more honest company.
title: Rate increase beware

text:
Had for 5yrs, price increases are a lot. I was told that your pet isn't penalized for sick visits, but this is not the case. I realize rates will rise, I expected a few dollars but my rates have increased $13 each month twice now. I started off paying $42/month and they have increased for the second time and my payments are now $71/month! I picked this insurance because of the annual deductible, and price was good. I have the option to increase my deductible or have less reimbursement but I'll still be paying just as much out of pocket. 
I work in a vet clinic and recommended this insurance to a lot of people and now I'm really feeling bad. 
The reason I gave 2 stars, they are good about reimbursing in a timely fashion.


After that reply, i want to add I work at a veterinary hospital. Our prices haven't increased in the past 2yrs and when they do go up, they go up maybe $1-$2 per item. I think so many people using the insurance, makes your rates go up...so in other words it is kind of a penalty! $330 increase in 2years? That's not rising vet costs.
title: Expected price increase, but not a gouge

text:
We have 5 miniature dachshunds who are all insured through Healthy Paws. I have had to file a few claims in the past 2 years and it has always been a seamless process, quick and easy. 

I‚Äôm writing this review now because Healthy Paws has went above and beyond with helping us through the process as one of our dachshunds had IVDD, which required surgery and then unfortunately had a GI blockage requiring emergency surgery 2 weeks later. 

Customer service was fabulous with communicating, collecting the medical records from the different surgeons, specialists, etc. I was elated to find out our policy covered acupuncture as well because it is highly recommended during the recovery period. An account manager even reached out to us to check on Woodstock after his surgeries, which made me feel like they truly care about their clients.

title: Excellent Pet Insurance

text:
This will be a long one. 

I decided on healthy paws only one month after getting my puppy after a trial period with AKC insurance due to the glowing reviews of HP on Reddit dog communities. 

Sadly, upon filing my very first claim I am disappointed to say the least. I read my policy documents from start to finish - I knew exactly what was covered and what wasn‚Äôt. In March of 2021, we had to take our goldendoodle to an emergency animal hospital due to a foreign body. I submitted the initial claim on March 18, which was denied one month later due to missing documents from prior to 9/2020. I had misunderstood the request and submitted some documents without lab notes. My bad, I contacted my current veterinarian, emergency veterinarian, and previous veterinarian to request full records with lab notes. While I was able to get records from my existing vet and the emergency clinic, my previous vet had a data failure, and only had the record from his puppy exam in Nov of 2019, one month before he was enrolled in Healthy Paws. This DID include lab notes - I‚Äôll get back to this. I also had the test results from a urinalysis and blood panel from early 2020. I uploaded these documents and resubmitted the claim on 5/7 and stated very clearly that there was a data failure and these are all the records that exist.  On 6/15, I received a denial again (38 DAYS LATER) stating that records were needed from prior to 9/2020. WHAT. It took them 38 days to not even open the new documents I uploaded and deny my claim for the same reason. I called healthy paws on 6/16 asking what was wrong. The representative was kind but did not seem to understand what documents I had uploaded were - she did however advise me that she would submit the claim for appeal, and that she would make a note of the data failure of my previous veterinary office. I also re-uploaded the 11/2019 puppy exam record in case the original upload wasn‚Äôt successful. Later on, I got a response that my line-item invoice had been reviewed but they need the lab notes. Now, the format of this had the line-items on the first half of the page and then listed the vet‚Äôs lab notes under it. If they actually read it they would realize this, but I‚Äôm guessing someone just glanced at it. What, do you want me to highlight it for you? 

I hadn‚Äôt heard anything about my appeal, so I sent an email inquiry on 7/5 to confirm if my claim had actually been appealed. Understanding they were closed for a national holiday I expected to hear from them later in the week. Well, it‚Äôs almost a week later, and I have heard nothing. The app and website mention nothing of an appeal. It has been four months. FOUR. Their documentation says roughly 10 business days. 

A quick recap, my dog (who has been enrolled in healthy paws since 12/12/2019) ate a toy at a dog park in 3/2021, and they can‚Äôt approve my claim because the records from 1+ year ago no longer exist and their claims processors can‚Äôt read. I‚Äôm pretty sure he wasn‚Äôt born with a toy in his stomach, so I don‚Äôt even see why those records are relevant. Customer service seem like very kind people but the reps on the phone seem to have no authority to do anything and are completely separate from the claims process. As I understand it, it‚Äôs pointless to even have this insurance because I will never have a claim approved due to the data failure that I have no control over. Almost two years of premiums for nothing. Not to mention, because I have submitted a claim, even though it has been denied, I can never opt for a higher premium and coverage level - for the rest of the time I am a customer - which is a terrible policy and is clearly a punishment for submitting a claim. Unless something major is done to fix this, I will be leaving healthy paws, and I had never planned to do so before.  I would not recommend this company to anyone, this has been an absolutely horrible experience. They completely failed to deliver when I needed them.
title: Completely fails to deliver

text:
This is my final post here, and please spare me your generic, fake replies. Let people judge:
"Clinical signs" can be caused by different things. The fact that a dog had diarrhea before, means it should not be covered for diarrhea ever again, regardless of the underlying cause? Does that sound funny to anybody else?!!
It is exactly like saying because your dog broke her leg once before you made the horrible mistake and joined "Healthy Paws", we never cover broken legs again!
Good night and happy collecting premiums.

text:
While it would be nice for Healthy Paws (probably like all pet insurance options) to be a bit more transparent upfront about what isn't covered (vaccinations, regular wellness checkups, and most annoyingly the checkup/consultation portion of what are otherwise emergency care visits), we've overall been quite satisfied. The website is user friendly and the reimbursements are prompt and painless.

The only issue we had was in uploading supplemental medical record files when they were requested. HealthyPaws said we could email them but then didn't acknowledge receiving them until we uploaded them a very specific way on our third attempt. This held up our initial reimbursement and was frustrating but we ultimately got past it.

Most importantly though, our puppy Louie had a serious health scare at 7 months and Healthy Paws was there for us so we're very grateful and will continue using them.

text:
A little more than three years ago, when I got my Australian Cattle Dog, I was skeptical of the need for pet insurance. Cattle Dogs are generally healthy in the long term, my thought. I got Mojave to be a trail dog, as I hike approximately 120 miles a month.
After thinking it through, I realized that given the miles Mojave would be covering, the odds of an orthopedic or paw injury was above average.
So I decided to get Healthy Paws Insurance. For the first 3 years, we had no issues. I thought of my pet insurance as I do of my car insurance... A 'necessary evil'. No offense Healthy Paws!
But in April of this year, Mojave injured a rear paw. It has resulted in Veterinary care to this day. (he is well on the mend now)
Thank goodness for my Healthy Paws insurance! His treatments were very costly, and Healthy Paws was there for me. Not only that, filing a claim and getting reimbursed, couldn't be easier. 
If you have, or are about to get a pup, get insurance! You never know when something will happen, You'll be bummed out if you need it but don't have it.
Thank you Healthy Paws!!!

text:
Update: Changed my 5 star to a 2 star. 
I left a 5-star review recently for Healthy Paws because it was easy to submit the claim for my dog's TPLO surgery (after he tore his knees/ACL in an accident), and pretty easy to get payment. That still stands. 

But less than a month from that claim, I got an email saying that my monthly premium has gone up 50% - now at over $270 per month. (I checked competitors and they're still charging around the previous amount of ~$180 for my dog's city/age/breed/etc) They say premiums do not go up because of claims, but it feels suspect. I reached out to ask, and the generic reason they gave was that overall pet owners have been submitting more claims, they're paying more out, and now they have to increase prices. My dog's only 6...I can't even imagine how much premium they'll try to charge by the time he's an elderly dog. 



-----
I've recently had to take advantage of my Healthy Paws policy for my English Bulldog who tore his ACL and had to get TPLO surgery. Healthy Paws' claims services was so stress-free - all I had to do with submit the vet invoice on their site, then got the coverage amount in my bank within 10 days. They were clear on what's covered (surgery, medication, rehabilitation) and what wasn't (ie. normal vet check up's, herbal/supplements), but it's all fair. And a rep from Healthy Paws checked in a week after Uni's surgery to ask how he was doing. Healthy Paws' monthly payments could be a little high (esp for a Eng Bulldog in a pricey urban city), but end of the day, if you ever need to actually have insurance kick in, you'll want an insurance company that's known to be a good partner. Would recommend!
title: Update: Service has been good for me but PRICE HIKES are crazy

text: My dog required surgery to remove a growth towards the end of last year. Not only did Healthy Paws quickly review my claim and reimburse me, but a member of their team emailed me a few days later to check in to see how he was doing after surgery. I thought that was so incredibly nice and above and beyond anything I‚Äôve ever experienced from my own doctor or health insurance. If you are looking for health insurance for your pet, I would highly recommend Healthy Paws!

text: We purchased Healthy Paws Pet Insurance in 2013 when our two Shiloh Shepherds, Blue Heeler Hybrid, and Ocicat were pups and young cats as we had lost the year before our sweet Sarabelle to osteosarcoma and were well aware of the costs of treatment for severe illnesses and conditions. It was truly a fortuitous decision. Though Little Boy, our Ocicat passed away uneventfully, and our Heeler continuous to be her irascible self, our two littermate Shiloh brothers had/have structural (wobblers) and health conditions (IBD) that require extensive testing and treatment. Healthy Paws came through for us for both of our boys. Though we remained judicious in our consideration of testing and treatment,, knowing that Healthy Paws would be there to financially support our decisions made a big difference to us and our boys. Their compassionate processing of our claims for the loss of one of our boys while did not lessen the pain, it gave us financial peace of mind. And our remaining boy is looking healthy and we look forward to several more years with him. We are so fortunate that we have Healthy Paws behind us. Their staff is compassionate and professional, and claim processing quick. Really, thank you, Healthy Paws.

text:
I've been a loyal customer for 6 years and today I got screwed by Healthy Paws. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this insurance to any dog owner.

I have 2 dogs. 6 years ago, I paid $150 for both, over time they kept pushing up my premium to $230 and today I got an email that they will be increasing my premium to $445.

When I called, I was told there was nothing they can do and I need to change my deductible and overall plan. Then I was hung up on when I asked for more alternatives.

One of my senior dogs had cancer. He's had multiple surgeries and just finished radiation. I cannot simply move to another insurance company now because of all of his pre-existing conditions.

text:
6/29 - If you read the Healthy Paws response to my review, you will see that they just proved everything that I said was true.  I sent them a complete set of my pet's records at the end of May, yet they are still asking for the records.  If they thought that they didn't have a complete set of records, why would they wait an entire MONTH to tell me so?  This makes absolutely no sense!  I have also called them several times since I filed the claim and each time they only said that the claim was under review and mentioned NOTHING about needing more records.  This whole process has been a huge waste of time and money.

6/26 -Don't waste your money!  I purchased a plan for my kitten and I had to take her to the vet because she had stopped eating and drinking and had not gone to the litter box for a day and a half.  We weren't sure what was wrong with her so we took her to the vet and they performed test and took x-rays to see if she had ingested something that was blocking her.  It was determined that she probably had an injury that was causing her pain and that she stopped eating due to that.  I submitted the claim 27 days ago and have heard NOTHING from Healthy Paws.  I have called several times only to be told that my claim is still being 'processed'.  It is a very simple claim so I have no idea why they are delaying for so long.  Especially since their Facebook Page is full of people saying their claims were processed in an HOUR!  I have a lot of trouble believing that those claims are actually from real people!  I've asked them how they got their claims processed so quickly and so far, no response.  If they're fake, I wouldn't expect one.  Bottom line is you're better off just setting aside the money that you would spend on insurance with Healthy Paws, in a savings account and paying out of pocket for any vet bills.  It's what you have to do with Healthy Paws anyway so you'd actually be saving money!

text:
I always tell new pet people that if they can afford it, get pet insurance as soon as possible. When we adopted our dog Luna in 2014, I researched all the major insurance companies. The main differences among the companies had to do with cost, the deductible (per condition versus annual), and the approval process. I decided on Healthy Paws because while new to us, our dog was an adult and formerly stray, so I didn't know what we'd face in the first year (injuries, various illnesses??), so an annual deductible made more sense to me, in case there were multiple different vet visits. 
While Healthy Paws doesn't offer a pre-approval, it's been super easy to file claims. If for a vet visit, their office can email the Healthy Paws claims department directly; if I'm picking up medication, I can submit a claim online. Healthy Paws has always reimbursed us very quickly (like 1-2 days) and has covered dozens of claims at this point for surgeries, medical tests, and prescription medications. I've never had a claim denied that I expected would be covered. 
Any time I've needed to call Healthy Paws to check in about a quote from my vet's office, or straighten out my paperwork (lately sometimes I've needed to make multiple claims per week and have mixed receipts, oops) -- the customer service representatives are SO nice, SO lovely to talk to, and are clearly animal lovers who are happy to help pet people out. Over the past year Luna has been really sick and it's been *such* a relief to know that Healthy Paws will cover the various tests our vet has proposed -- it makes taking care of a pet so much easier. It's definitely been a good financial decision for us to pay for insurance since 2014; the reimbursements have outweighed the cost as Luna has gotten older and had health issues. I would definitely recommend Healthy Paws to other pet people! Thank you so much!

text:
I took out insurance with Healthypaws in 2015 for my then just adopted, 2 years old, 8.5lbs, mixed breed dog.  He had zero pre-existing conditions. The monthly premium was $39.00 at the time. We‚Äôve had absolutely no claims, yet Healthypaws sees fit to raise the monthly premium every year to the degree that they are now pricing me, (a senior citizen with slender financial means,) out.  This right at the point that my little dog, now approaching his 10th birthday, might actually need some health insurance coverage in the future. Healthpaws has just emailed me to inform me that as of August, 2021, his monthly premium will be over $118.00.  So be warned!  In six years of paying Healthypaws, without any claims, or reimbursements to me, they have raised my premium from $39.00 a month up to over $118.00 a month.

I note the reply from Healthypaws 3 hours ago today, June 8th. In their reply to my post attached here, Healthypaws merely repeated word for word the exact response they gave to other of their hapless subscribers who are upset by their steep, annual, price increases after their dog reaches age 4. In addition, as I mentioned in my initial review, I have filed no claims and received zero reimbursements from Healthypaws in the 6 years of my paying their premiums, not merely ‚Äújust not very many‚Äù as their response to me refers to!  Plus my name is misspelt for good measure, it‚Äôs Romanie, not Romaine like the lettuce variety!  Somehow this error seems emblematic of the true Healthypaws culture, however many times they write ‚ÄúGive your baby (dog,) a hug from us!‚Äù

Lol!  Healthypaws just replied to my reply to them above, they amended the spelling of my first name which I had pointed out to them that in addition to everything else they had gotten wrong!  That‚Äôs all!
title: Very steep monthly premium increases, every year after a dog is 4 years old.

text:
Same terrible experience. Been paying them for 5 years now, and every year they keep increasing their rates with the excuse "the increases are in line with the increased costs of veterinary technologies..". I just received a $30 monthly increase on a pet. $30! My advise to anyone new to the pet insurance business is do not get it. 
Once you start with one, anything that happens to your pet becomes "existing condition" for another insurance.
At the same time, your pet ages, and the premium keeps going up with Healthy Paws, while the age puts your pet in an "older price bracket" with another insurance. 
Most insurance services consider "pre-existing condition" what has happened to your pet in the year prior to the renewal billing cycle. They renew your policy every year, but even if you have been with the insurance for 5 years, if your pet has had a problem during the previous policy term, it is considered "existing" and not covered. Have not experience this with Healthy Paws because I have not had any claim what so ever in 5 years.
if you do the math of how much you pay every month, and how much the premium will keep growing every year, and how much your cat ages which puts you in a more expensive premium somewhere else, you are better off savings money on the side for your pet every month and spend when and if an issue arises. 
Also, as the policy keeps renewing every year, and they make changes to the policy, chances are that by the time your pet is very old (14years+), the insurance company will no longer pay, and will drop you from their coverage service.

text:
Buyer beware - Healthy Paws will jack your insurance premiums by 50%+!

My pet insurance premium went up 30% when my pup hit 7 and then another 50% when my pup hit 8. So if you buy their pet insurance, you can expect double digit increases when your pet hits senior age. Healthy Paws will tell you premium increases of any amount is within their legal right, that your state approved the increase, that they are just doing it cover their increasing costs. 

The sleazy part of pet insurance is that the consumer can't just switch companies because future insurance won't cover preexisting conditions, so I am stuck with the double digit increases despite how unfair it is.

I regret buying with Healthy Paws - you will get no sympathy when you try to explain the havoc this will wreak on your budget.

text: Recently Minnie was slowing down.  We went to our local vet and he did an xray and some blood work and everything looked normal.  He asked if he could run an ekg.  We said yes. The ekg showed a 3rd degree av blockage and the only fix is a pacemaker.  Our vet said Minnie needed the pacemaker that day to avoid going into cardiac arrest so we drove her to the nearest cardiologist and had the procedure done.  Not once did we have to worry about the cost as we knew we had Healthy Paws.  We just needed to worry about Minnie.  She is now home and recovering really well.  Thank you Healthy Paws.

text:
Healthy Paws was the most amazing pet insurance with incredible customer service. They have turned out to be the worst company ever with ZERO customer service.

I started with them in 2013 and I paid around $35.00 a month. It was raised to $76.20 on December of 2020, which I justified because they were amazing. When I received my bill on January 29,2021 I called and cancelled my policy because the insurance was raised again to $114.30 a month.

When I received my credit card bill in February they charged my credit card twice for $114.30 totaling $228.60 after the policy was cancelled.

I have spent endless hours trying to resolve this issue and they keep sending an email that they will contact me within three days and never do. It has been months and they DO NOT return phone calls and I have not been reimbursed.

I have referred this insurance to my friends, neighbors, co workers and his daycare and everyone is dealing with the same issue. All of our prices went sky high and they keep charging our credit cards.

We are contacting the BBB and disputing our charges with our credit cards.

DO NOT even consider insuring your pet with this unethical business. They were sold in December of 2020 and the new business owner/owners are con artists!
title: Perfect Service to PATHETIC and outrageous prices!

text: C.J. have ruptured his Cranial Cruciate Ligament while playing with a ball.  During diagnosis, surgery and recovery processed all the insurance claims with his veterinary records attached  were paid timely and based on our policy - 80% of all medical care and prescription medicine coasts.  The Healthy Paws insurance was a big part in assuring that C.J. receives the best available medical care.  Because of our very positive experience, we would recommend  the Healthy Paws Insurance to all pet parents.

text: I have used Healthy Paws for three different illnesses involving my dog. Their app is user friendly, simply taking a snapshot of the documentation and submitting. Payment turn-around is just a few days. There is even follow-up to make sure your pet is doing well.
title: Excellent attention, rapid turn around

text: This company is either completely incompetent or a scam.  I signed up four months ago.  Paid all of my premiums.  Submitted two claims for a total of about $150.  After I submitted, they wanted complete medical records, which I provided and uploaded.  Then I got another email asking for complete medical records, which I again provided.  Then I got another email for a third time asking for complete medical records.  This email threatened to decline my claims if I didn't (again) submit the medical records.  I called the customer service number.  Spoke to a woman who told me the claims examiners were looking for proof of a physical examination on 12/24/20.  She looked at the medical records I had uploaded and indicated that she found reference to the examination on the one record and that she would submit everything for processing.  A day later I got a fourth email asking me to submit complete medical records.  Before I could even respond, the company sent another email saying that the claims were denied because I didn't upload medical records and the claims expired.  Called them back, was put on hold for a manger for 25 minutes.  Hung up and filed a dispute with my credit card company for the premiums I had paid.  This company sucks.  Go elsewhere.  Not worth the aggravation.
title: This company is terrible

text:
A few close friends got together to celebrate one of our birthdays. What was a delightful and casual little get together became my worst nightmare when a balloon popped and startled my new affenpinscher pup. She jumped off my lap and broke her arm. I scooped her up as quickly as I could and rushed to the emergency vet. My poor girl was in so much pain and I was so disappointed in myself that I could let something like this happen to her. Luckily the emergency vet we took her to is AMAZING and super compassionate which eased my stress, but they can't waive a 6k bill when your puppy breaks two bones and needs surgery to insert a plate and screws into her tiny arm. I put it on my credit card and started to panic thinking I didn't "do my pet insurance right"... Are there prerequisites that I didn't meet? Will this not be covered? 
I submitted my claim through their website via the claims portal. I received some emails that I needed to provide medical records. I provided everything I had, but they asked for more. I started to panic more that this expensive event wouldn't be covered, but after submitting everything I had, I emailed and said that she was a puppy and had only been to the vet a few times. I received a nice email back saying she would let the claims department know. After that, I received an email that my claim was being processed and a few days later I had $4000 in my bank account. I couldn't believe it, but they covered every single thing they said they would. Honestly I wish my health insurance was this clear and easy. I have recommended healthy paws to everyone I know with a pet. I am incredibly happy that they were there for me in a really stressful time.
title: they did what they said they would!

text: Our dog recently had to have his toe amputated because of an injury.  The claim was easy to file and they paid 90% of the entire amount, after the deductible was met, with no tedious questions asked.  We have 2 dogs covered by Healthy Paws and they have been great each time we have needed them.  Also, we got the reimbursement check in record time!
