text: My three year old cat was diagnosed with chronic kidney disease in February and was hospitalized for nine days. The day he was admitted, I called Healthy Paws and explained his illness. The hospital had quoted us around 500 dollars per day. We were concerned about whether we would end up with a huge bill, but the agent at Healthy Paws with whom I spoke indicated that the insurance would cover 80% of hospitalization, medications, blood tests and a sonogram. We were relieved. His vet and hospital bills were in excess of 5 thousand dollars. He was in hospital for nine days. Healthy Paws paid for everything but the vet physicals as their coverage states. He will require ongoing meds and tests for the foreseeable future, but I am not worried about how to give him the best care possible with the Healthy Paws insurance.  They are truly working for you and your pet. The customer service was more than accommodating and really wanted to help us. I was missing some needed information from the vet and rescue agency. Diana took it upon herself to find it for us. She called the rescue and the vet associated with the rescue agency. She went above and beyond to help us get his claims started. I never felt as if I was talking to an insurance company. They were always there to help. Their customer service is the best. All of them were great, but a special thanks to Diana and Jennifer who helped me through this worrisome time.

title: Submitted a Healthy Paws claim for‚Ä¶

text:
If you are going back and forth on whether or not you should/should not sign up for Healthy Paws insurance, I will be the first to say I was just like you. I used to be one of those ‚ÄúWhy spend money on pet insurance, how much can they honestly get sick?‚Äù, and then I came to realize that it was one of the best decisions I have made (aside from adopting my pup of course!). Healthy Paws has LITERALLY saved my puppy‚Äôs life. 
My puppy at only 8 months old (healthy as can be, might I add) ‚Äì decided to pick something off the ground on a walk, and swallowed this foreign object. He was not able to pass it so he had to get emergency surgery. Few days later post-op, he became septic from the first surgery, and needed to get another surgery, including a feeding tube + tons of antibiotics. The options I was given were to A: Get the surgery, or B: euthanasia‚Ä¶ how could I possibly do this with a healthy 8 month old pup!? Fast forward to today, and my puppy has healed up and Healthy Paws has LITERALLY saved my puppy‚Äôs life ‚Äì without having the insurance, I would not be able to pay for such expensive surgeries.
What we paid overall out of pocket was the cost of JUST the first surgery, meaning that Healthy Paws has saved us over $15K ‚Äì and we spent under $5K. Also, compared to other pet insurances that have caps on how many claims they can submit, Health Paws is UNLIMITED ‚Äì which helped us since ours was so high in vet/hospital bills. 
Overall, the price per month for Health Paws is SO minimal, I am sure that most spend more on Starbucks/Takeout than they would on the monthly cost of the insurance. Another thought as well ‚Äì would you go without insurance for a human? I highly doubt that ‚Äì and to me, this is the same for my dog. 
My claims were processed almost every time within 24 ‚Äì 72 hours, with a check in hand almost immediately following. The customer support team as well throughout the past 3 weeks of everything they have even sent personal emails checking in on him! I only wish my doctor was as kind as them :) 
Again, if you are hesitating on signing up for Healthy Paws, please PLEASE take a deeper look at their minimal costs per month, extremely low deductible once you submit your first claim, and the comfort of knowing that if for some reason anything did go wrong with your pet, you are reimbursed anywhere from 70-90% of that cost, depending on the plan you choose! Healthy Paws is something I will invest in for not only this dog, but any other animal I ever adopt in the future. Thank you Healthy Paws! :)
title: Don't hesitate, i promise you it is worth it!

my friends referred me to healthy paws and after having 2 seniors dogs with many illnesses I decided to purchase Healthy paws pet insurance with our new rescue who was about 3 years old. title: Healthy paws raises your rates when you submit a claim‚Ä¶

text:
I have been with Healthy Paws since 2017, and while they aren't perfect (as I'm sure no company is), in the end, the positive definitely outweighs the negative.  I'm fortunate to say I'm not one of the customers who encountered crazy premium increases; if so, I'd likely feel different... however, the business of insurance in itself can easily turn messy - things don't go your way and your entire world is turned upside down.  For me, I happened to pick the right company at the right time for my cat who was afflicted with gastroentestinal issues chronically starting about 6 months after establishing our relationship with Healthy Paws.  Not once did I ever run into a single solitary issue when it came time to get reimbursed for her qualified medical expenses, and we went to the vet ALOT.  So often there were times I called apologizing for the volume of claims I was submitting at once, afraid I'd be denied just because I started getting self conscious.  
Their customer service is unparalleled, notably so when it comes to calling in with questions/concerns, clarification.  I was always treated with warmth, kindness, respect.  Where they fall short?  Communication.  At times it was maddening how often they needed the same thing over and over again because of incomplete records or something, something seemingly more prevalent of recent times.  Often it was like there was a lack of note taking between customer service reps so information I'd call in with sometimes wouldn't get processed and create confusion.  This occurred with my second pet whom I went through the appeals process with and eventually just walked away from in the end (fighting the claim, not my pet).  Perhaps Covid-19 times have brought about these instances/experiences of mine.  Importantly though, my cat passed last week and Healthy Paws has been more compassionate and comforting towards me than my own veterinarian.  That's not an exaggeration.  To me that's tremendous.  Today I had to call to discuss the final invoice/claim and the woman helping me took the time to share her regret for my loss, look at the photo of Sophie I had for the profile picture, and tell me how beautiful she was.  Perhaps I'm being naive, but she didn't have to "make the effort".  It's not always about money and it shouldn't be.  Thank you for being there for Sophie.
title: When it matters...

text: Healthy Paws has always been fair with price and service for 7 years, until I had 2 claims for my Standard Poodle 2 years ago. He is 12 years old and the surgery and care saved his life, but after filing a claim his premium went from $70 a month to $100 then a year after that to $180 a month. I now have a dog I cant afford the insurance payments for that will not get coverage anywhere else. Healthy Paws was happy to keep my premium low while I had no claims, but once I needed the insurance they made sure I wouldn't keep it.

text: If you're not sure whether it's worth getting pet insurance: it IS. While most insurance options I explored don't cover general preventative and routine vet visits, when my fur-baby Barkley suddenly wasn't eating for days and having severe GI issues, I did not worry about the cost of having to take him to the hospital. After extensive tests and a couple of nights in the hospital, he has bounced back. And so did my wallet - the claims process is really easy - all online, and I received my benefits direct-deposited in less than 2 weeks. Better still, their customer service reached out to me to see how Barkley is doing.

text: The coverage and reimbursement process are thorough and fast. I've never had an issue with a claim. I've had this insurance for about 7-8 years. My only complaint is the premiums. They have a lot of age limitations now and the premiums even for young dogs are quite high. I signed my new dog up with a different company, soley based on premiums. text: We have a Pug, and he was having an increasingly difficult time breathing, could not handle any heat or much exercise (even though he is young and at a very healthy weight), and oftentimes would gag or throw up from exertion. We discovered that Max's breed is prone to having these types of issues because of his breed, i.e. a hereditary condition. I Reviewed our insurance Healthy Paws policy and found that it did, in fact, cover hereditary conditions, but I was still unsure if the surgery  would be covered. Our Max had the surgery, and the next day I submitted a claim. it was approved by the end of the day and we were reimbursed within 48 hours! I was happily shocked by how easy it was to submit the claim and how quickly we were reimbursed. I will be completely honest, I do feel like the monthly payment for our policy was a bit high and has increased 2x I believe, but I am so grateful that I purchased it and kept it through those increases and I will continue to be a Healthy Paws customer indefinitely.

title: I am so grateful and impressed with‚Ä¶

text:
Our dog developed a large, serious abscess, and after ignored by the usual vet. I woked up at 2AM to our dog crying terribly because it had come to the surface and ruptured, exploding lymph and blood everyone. At age 5, we weren't going to let her go because someone else missed something. After 4 weeks of surgery (including draining the abscess, debriding an extensive area of necrotic tissues, and installing a drain, we're happy to say our dog is happy and healthy. And we are even more grateful that Healthy Paws was here for us; they reviewed our claim and dealt reimbursement fairly. There has been no talk of kicking us from the plan or anything for such a large claim. Because of their business operations, we got that money back to save away (perhaps in another dog fund.) 

I'd really recommend Healthy Paws, everything was extremely simple and user-friendly to get our claim filed and done.
title: Dog exploded, bank account did not

text:
Murphy is my fourth pure bred German Shepherd.  I've insured all but one of them, and I learned that was a mistake because it is always something with the pure bred Shepherds although it's mostly been a different issue with each one.  

Murphy is the first dog I've insured with Healthy Paws and they are by far the best.  The claims handling process is super simple, they pay very promptly and customer service is very helpful.  Murphy just had both of his elbows operated on and I wasn't sure if everything would be covered so I called for some guidance.  Although they can't guarantee coverage, they will explain what categories of treatment won't be covered.  For example, treatment considered experimental like stem cell shots is not covered.  Frankly, I was surprised at the breadth of the rehab they do cover.  I also think that the unlimited dollar amount of claims is hugely important.  

I could not have afforded all of the treatment Murphy requires without the policy (his elbow surgery and treatment will end up costing about $7K).  Luckily, I have 90% reimbursement.  Although it costs a little bit more in premiums, Healthy Paws reimburses me more each month than I pay in premiums because Murphy also developed allergies and is on monthly meds that are expensive.  Sometimes I even feel a little guilty submitting claims because they have paid so much more than my premiums.

I've recommended Healthy Paws to a lot of people, but generally they don't end up even getting insurance.  That seems insane to me.  It is one of the best investments you can make in your pet.

text: As a disabled veteran with a service dog and part of a WorkingDogsForVets service dog organization, I‚Äôve seen other service dog owners dealing with unexpected veterinary bills for their best friend. X-rays revealed she had torn her cruciate ligament and dislocated her knee. Her best option was to have a TPLO (Tibial Plateau Leveling Osteotomy) and a luxating platella repair. Make sure you have your dogs health records, including doctors notes submitted before you actually need them.

text: My Bengal cat was suddenly in pain and had a difficult time walking. After an examination with a local vet it was recommended he see an orthopedic surgeon. title: My Bengal cat was suddenly in pain and needed expensive surgeries. Healthy Paws was a great help!

text: I cannot say enough about this company and how it's more than just a pet insurance company. I can't think of another vendor I've ever worked with in any industry that has been easier and better to work with than Healthy Paws. I first started working with them about 7 years ago for my bulldog Clementine. She has had many health issues and surgeries throughout the years. Claims are easy to fill and they are extremely fast too reimburse. Most recently we had an emergency situation with my bulldog came out of her normal boarding with trouble breathing. It got worse and worse throughout the day and I had to bring her to the ER. They immediately sedated her and gave me feedback that she needed emergency surgery and might not make it. In addition to that, they told me she was the most critical animal at the hospital and if I hadn't brought her in within the hour she probably would not have made it. It was a lot of money to go through this emergency surgery and the hospital needed about $2,500 right away to keep her going through the night. I gladly paid it and had the confidence that Healthy Paws would cover and reimburse me the 90% I had signed up for. I called them the next day after receiving the full estimate which was about $13,000. Health Paws jumped on the phone with me and went through all of the details directly with the animal hospital. They took care of the entire situation so that I didn't have to worry about anything. The surgery was a success, and we got Clementine home after a few days. When I called Healthy Paws to make sure everything worked out, I realized that not only had the hospital been paid in full, but they had also reimbursed me the money I overpaid originally on that night. They saved my dogs life. I signed up my second dog (Dakota) the minute we got her. There aren't many companies out there that I "love". I can safely say that I absolutely love healthy paws, and my family and I thank them from the bottom of our hearts.
title: They saved Clementines life, thank you

text: I would give zero stars if I could. I have been a loyal customer with multiple pet policies for 8 years. When I signed up, my pets were very young. I did extensive research on pet insurance at the time. The primary reason I went with Healthy Paws Insurance was that I was assured premiums would not increase solely based on age and claims filed. This was a fraudulent and false claim. In the 8 years since I have had this insurance, my premiums have increased 177%. The premium increases were small when the pets were young, a bit more as they got older, and in the last 2 years alone, they have increased by 148%! Healthy Paws has nearly 200 complaints with the Better Business Bureau...many along this same line. As far as I can tell, Healthy Paws will gladly take your money (I have paid many thousands in premiums) up until the point that your pet starts to *really need* the insurance. They will then ruthlessly jack up your premiums to price you right out of your policies. Don't be fooled like I was! Purchasing pet insurance from Healthy Paws is one of the worst decisions I ever made! I truly hope there is a class-action lawsuit against this company. They should be run out of business for what they are doing to people!
title: BUYER BEWARE: DO NOT BUY PET INSURANCE FROM HEALTHY PAWS!!

text: I was skeptical about pet insurance, but I signed up when I adopted my dog, and now I'm so glad I did!  My dog was recently diagnosed with Addison's disease after going into an Addisonian crisis. It's easy to file a claim, and reimbursements are sent quickly.  I highly recommend Healthy Paws.  Sign up when you adopt your pet!
title: I was skeptical about pet insurance, but no longer!

text:
They raise rates at 30% a year!!!! Stay Away from Healthy Paws. Unfortunately they put profits in our view before pets, it is true!  Each year for the last three years our premiums have skyrocketed although we have little to no claims. In fact it went up 30% this year, this is for a six year old dog with no health conditions that has been insured by healthy paws since he was four months old!!!  In fact the letter of renewal came and indicated as if it was a badge of honor that they will never raise your rates more than 30% a year. Really? 30% a year, that means to you that every three years you can expect your premium to double. This should be extortion and we recommend going to another provider that won't rip you off this way. 

We have gotten six other pet owners from the dogpark to purchase healthy paws but no more, in fact one of them started out at $32.00 a month and in one year the new premium is $38.00.  This is with no claims on a dog that just turned two. Healthy paws used to be the best, little adjustments each year now they are telling policy holders they will never go up by more than 30% a year. Really? So in three years they can have the policy go up almost 100% so they can make more money. Other pet insurance is better, with regard to increasing the rate like this. When this was originally healthy paws foundation (before it sold about five years ago) this was never an issue. So if you are paying $35.00 (if that is what they quote you, be aware that in three years that $35.00 can be $100!!!).  In six years you now could be paying $200 a month, for pet insurance, what?   Who can increase premiums 30% a year with no claims what the heck?

We are looking for new insurance, last year we went from $35.00 to $47.00 and this year from $51.00 to now $69.00 a month!  Yet they tell us they can't go up more than 30% a year, they did when they raised my rates!!! It is insane, so be wary that they will likely stick it to you as well.

My suggestion avoid at all costs, if you have them get another plan as if your have a health crisis in your dog, know that other pet plans probably won't cover your dog. So get your dog in another plan so you can also save your hard earned money!!!! Raise rates almost 60% in two years and during covid where many people have less money is just terrible and to me it shows they don't care about our pets but their profits first!!!
title: They raise rates at 30% a year!!!\

text: Our 4 year old dog required surgery for bladder stones, after a trip to the doggy ER for a urinary tract infection.  Healthy Paws customer service representatives worked with us every step of the way and processed our claims quickly and efficiently.  The money was deposited into our account within 2-3 days.  We cannot say enough good things about Healthy Paws, and we highly recommend them for all your pet needs.
title: Unexpected Surgery

text: Healthy Paws is a great pet insurance provider! I highly recommend this company. They offer quick and kind costumer service. The processing and reimbursement turn around time is very quick. Love them!
title: Healthy Paws is a great pet insurance‚Ä¶

text:
BUYER BEWARE.

I have been a loyal customer since 2012, insuring my 3 dogs for nearly $300/per month. I have been escalating a claim on a very painful ACCIDENT my dog sustained that knocked two teeth nearly out of his jaw. However, Healthy Paws continues to DENY the claim saying the tooth extractions that were necessary so my dog did not have to walk around with his two front teeth literally dangling by the nerves from his gums WAS ELECTIVE DENTISTRY. Monstrous treatment of a customer. The claim is 70% of $2300. After paying them nearly $30,000 over the past 8 years, I would not expect them to deny a claim for an ACCIDENT. That's the ENTIRE POINT of having insurance. Healthy Paws does NOT care about the health of your pet. They care about their profits. I am actually SHOCKED I paid this much over the years for such terrible service! Do yourself a favor and open a saving account for your dog's health and let it accumulate interest to pay out-of-pocket in the event of accidents or disease - you will come out ahead. DO NOT BUY THIS INSURANCE! Waste of money. Total scam, like ALL INSURANCE. It's a racket. Get yourself out of it.

04/07/21 ADDENDUM:
Interesting follow-up: After going back and forth with Healthy Paws for 4 encounters (you HAVE to keep at it or they hope you will just lose hope and patience and then simply go away), they have now UPPED my monthly premium because one of the reports from this dental visit listed my dog as a Wheaten Terrier (which is ONE of his breeds, most likely, but he is CLEARLY a mixed breed - most likely part Wheaten, part Mini Poodle, part West Highland terrier), and so now they want to reclassify him as purebred to gather a higher monthly premium. I have been asked to bother my vet (who has better things to do, like treat and save animals' lives), to send them a letter stating that he is a MIXED BREED, not purebred. They are determined to get my money one way or another. This will be the last pets I ever insure. Seriously, anyone reading this - put that money into an interest-bearing SAVINGS ACCOUNT and if your pets don't get sick, then you keep the money. And, if they do get sick or injured - you will have the CASH on hand to give them the medical treatment they need without haggling with a gatekeeper.
title: BUYER BEWARE and FOLLOW-UP.

text: I can't recommend Healthy Paws enough! I have a new puppy (14 weeks old) and she's been sick for the last 2 weeks. As a new dog mom, it was scary for me to have to take her to the ER so frequently and get her treated. I'm thankful that through the stress, the one thing I didn't have to worry about was the cost and I was able to focus on making sure my little one was okay. I knew that my Healthy Paws coverage was going to help with the financial strain of so many emergency visits and I'm so thankful for their insurance options. The coverage was fantastic and the team at Healthy Paws checked in to see how my pup was doing/feeling. They are so kind and it's easy to see why they came so highly recommended from friends as a great pet insurance option!
title: I can't recommend Healthy Paws enough

text: I recommend Health Paws insurance (HP). My older dog (7 years) and my younger dog (2 years old) and my two granddogs are all covered by HP and we have had good experiences with HP. They are reasonable and promptly reimburse bills!
title: I recommend Health Paws insurance (HP)

text:
Human insurance companies could learn a thing or two from Healthy Paws Pet Insurance, truly.  When I had to put my first dog down and emailed Healthy Paws with a heavy heart to end my policy, I never thought that I would receive a condolence card in the mail with personalized messages signed by every staffer in the office a week later--the compassion and care that went into such a simple act brought me to tears.  Human insurance companies don't do that...

Fast forward two years and we got another rescue puppy: there was no question that I would immediately return to Healthy Paws.  However, I was thrown for a loop when around Tycho's first birthday, I took him to the vet because he was limping and was told that he needed two knee replacements.  At almost $4500 each, I would never have been able to give my big fur baby the care he deserves without Healthy Pets.  I submitted all of Tycho's medical history and all of his receipts and within a week of each claim, I received checks in the mail.  Again, if only human insurance policies were so simple and accommodating...

But that's not all!  (I feel like an infomercial, but that's seriously how confident I am in this company.)  Amidst the stress of helping my dog recover from his surgery, Healthy Paws customer service sent me follow-up emails to check on Tycho and see how he was doing--TWICE!  When was the last time your HUMAN insurance did something like that?

I will fur-ever use and promote Healthy Paws to my family and friends.  They have cracked the code on customer service on so many levels while simultaneously making claims simple and straight forward.
title: Human insurance companies could learn a thing or two from Healthy Paws...

text:
Healthy paws literally saved Betsy‚Äôs life
10
Out of 10
RECOMMENDED
I cannot say enough good things about healthy paws. Without this insurance I wouldn‚Äôt have been able to afford to treat my dog‚Äôs pneumonia and I would have had to put her down or let her die. In the past month Betsy‚Äôs treatment has included emergency room visits, hospital stays, oxygen chamber , meds, X-rays , and blood work . The cost to date is close to $10,000 and still counting. I charge the visit and file the claim immediately. I have been receiving claim payments deposited directly into my bank account within 2-3 days of filing the claim. The coverage amount is unlimited. The things that are not covered are the office visits/consult and the typical well care like vaccines and prevention. That is small concession to make to have all the other benefits. I had another Shihtzu prior to Betsy who had pet insurance from another company that started with a ‚ÄúV‚Äù . They always seemed to find a reason not to pay a claim. I urge anyone with a pet to consider this company. I have recommended them to many of my friends who have pets and they have been happy with them as well.
title: Healthy paws literally saved Betsy‚Äôs‚Ä¶

text: On 3/3/2021 our little 3 year old mini dachshund had 4 small idiopathic clustered seizures that left him very disoriented. Scared us to death. He spent the night in the vet hospital recovering; we paid the bill ($1200) before taking him home on 3/4/2021. By 3/5 or 3/6, Healthy Paws completed the claim with a 90% reimbursement and a $100 deductible, according to my plan. My little dog is sleeping comfortably next to my son on the couch and I am so so so glad that we have Healthy Paws insurance! Wonderful company including caring, efficient, claims staff.  Thanks HPs!
title: Worth the piece of mind!

text:
Make sure you search Healthy Paws on the Better Business Bureau prior to making any decision to sign on.
The responses to customer complaints feel dismissive and sarcastic. Here are a few responses included in their replies to customers who have complained to th BBB and rated them with a 1 (lowest rating):
 "Give your babies big hugs from us."
 "Give your girl a big hug from us."
 "Please give your pup a big hug from us."
 "Give your baby a big hug from us"
 "Give your buddy a big hug from us."
"We do our best to be transparent regarding annual premium increases by including this information on the "Frequently Asked Questions" page of our website.
 We are sorry to lose you as a policy holder and hope you and your pup stay well. The Healthy Paws Team"

Remember, the customers complaining are taking valuable time out of their busy lives and feel compelled to write the BBB to file a complaint. Will this be you after a few years?

When I started with them it was fine, the increases were fair but recent years it skyrocketed. It also became a struggle to get compensation, faced with impossible demands for documentation that thy claimed not to have from literally years ago. 
To me the skyrocketing yearly increases can easily cover the BBB fees in order to forgive and increase their ratings ... many Healthy Paws answers appear to be cookie cutter answers referring to their FAQ. If you are currently a customer and you felt that you were wronged by this company (or any company for that matter), or their reps made it extremely difficult to honor a legitimate insurance claim, I urge you to document and send your findings to your state's Attorney General office to investigate what they are doing. Its a hassle, but essential to provide documentation to keep this and others in this business honest.
title: Please read BBB reviews before signing on with Healthy Paws

text:

I did some research before choosing them. They got good customer reviews, and now I know why!
Recently, my puppy got very sick and ran up some big vet bills. Even though I'm pretty techno challenged their app made it extremely easy to submit the claim. And I had the reimbursement check in less than a week!
Highly recommend them!

text: Working with the Healthy Paws claims team was amazing! I wasn't sure what to expect...this was my first time filing a claim. ¬†The process was so simple and fast...great communication from Healthy Paws and then approval and a check was sent immediately. ¬†I am so glad that I selected Healthy Paws for my dogs insurance.¬† I'm definitely a fan!
title: Healthy Paws fan!

text: We‚Äôve had Healthy Paws for the last 7 years. We adopted our dog when he was 2 years old. We decided to get pet insurance in case of any surgeries, emergencies or cancer. We wanted to make sure costs wouldn‚Äôt keep us from getting our boy the best care possible. He was about 5 when we got him enrolled. Monthly costs ranged from approximately $30-60 the first 5 years and then went from $70-90 the last two years. I think the increase is fair since the policy is aging as well as the pet. For the first 6 years we never met our deductible ($250/80%). Our dog has chronic ulcers and we paid everything out of pocket. Exam fees are not covered. Fast forward and our dog is 12 years old and we are faced with stage 4 nasal cancer. Prior to the diagnosis we were seeing the vet left and right and then oncologists and quickly met our deductible. We got our first claim very quickly and then signed up for direct deposit right into our account. We decided since we had insurance and had done extensive research, to travel out of state for SRT/SRS radiation. I would say total for this cancer journey we have paid approximately $13,000 and have received roughly $10,000 back. We truly believe Healthy Paws is totally worth the investment and are happy to report the radiation treatment went extremely well and our dog is doing great! Healthy Paws even followed up with us via email to see how our baby was doing. Their customer service is top notch. I‚Äôve sent many emails throughout the years with questions and they are always so pleasant and helpful. We recommend them to everyone. There are a lot of choices out there. Make sure you research and understand what is covered and what‚Äôs not. The most heartbreaking decision is not whether to say goodbye to a beloved pet, but whether money is the deciding factor. Save yourself the heartache and get your pet insured!!!!
title: Healthy Paws and nasal cancer

text:

Thank you Healthy Paws for existing. I tell everyone who is looking for pet insurance,  to choose this company. 

PS - The doggo mentioned above is getting stronger everyday :-).

text:
Healthy Paws just paid $984 for Rosie's surgery, 24 hours after I submitted my claim.  I'm very pleased.

In the time I've been insured with them, their customer service over the phone and by email has always been friendly and efficient. This surgery was their first "test" as to whether they'd cover what I expected them to cover quickly and without hassle, and they've passed that test with flying colors.

Because I didn't ever want to face a huge bill for Rosie's care that I couldn't pay, I got insurance through Healthy Paws about three years ago. They don't raise premiums or reduce benefits because of claim history. Also, the annual deductible is just that, annual, not per incident. And there's no maximum payout limit per incident, year, or lifetime.  I recommend Healthy Paws.

text: After a year of battling an unknown (at the time) skin allergy on our number one dog, we realized pet insurance would have been a good deal had we thought better of it before hand. My sister in law had just gone through a very tough medical experience with her pug and Healthy Paws covered over $9,000 worth of costs. That convinced us to get pet insurance. Number one dog proved to meet deductible just about every year with *other* issues. When we adopted our second mutt, he was already two and a large breed. We immediately purchased insurance through Healthy Paws for him as well. As in years prior, this year, it REALLY helped! To date, within this year's covered period, Clifford has exceeded $17,500 in vet bills for cancer removal and for repairing his Achilles tendon on both back hocks. We received over $15,000 in reimbursements. He is just about healed from his surgeries and should have physical therapy afterwards. Without pet insurance, I don't know many who could afford to properly take care of a dog like ours. The covered year isn't done, and we know we'll need more. I've only had one issue, and the issue was my lack of understanding. The customer service rep responded quickly and helped explain the issue. It was resolved within a couple of days. Payment always comes within a week, although they say it can take up to ten days. They offer direct deposit, and you can even have the claims filed by your vet. I find it just as easy to submit the claims myself. Thank you, Healthy Paws!
title: Surprisingly easy, great customer service, and no hidden clauses!

title: Otis had a seizure

text:
Healthy Paws provides the best coverage for pets with a hassle-free claim process. A policy with Healthy Paws makes it easy for pet owners to focus on caring for their pets and getting them the treatment they need whenever they need it, without being overly concerned about cost. In many ways, I wish human health insurance were so simple and transparent. ;-)

Many years ago we purchased our first pet insurance coverage with another company (Pets Best): that coverage was inexpensive and seemed like it would be quite useful in limiting costs while providing incentives for regular checkups. While it was helpful in offsetting costs for smaller incidents, as our dogs aged we quickly found that the policy had payout maximums and "separate occurrence" definitions that limited their coverage quite sharply. We soon re-evaluated our options for insurance coverage and made the switch to Healthy Paws.

Whenever the unexpected has happened, we've been able to rely on Healthy Paws to provide consistent, understandable coverage for our pets. Most recently, one of our pets contracted a urinary infection while on vacation, which required a trip to an emergency clinic for treatment. We knew that whatever treatment she needed, it would be covered - and it was! :-) The broad coverage and clear policies have consistently covered various needs for our dogs, spanning knee surgery, upset stomachs, and broken nails; with no claim or lifetime maximums to worry about, there's no concern about "exhausting" the coverage or having to make financial decisions about the well-being of a pet.

The claim process is extremely easy with their website: upload an itemized receipt and they take care of the rest. There's occasionally a follow-up question or two - which is easy to answer - and they follow up with the veterinary clinic, typically completing the claim and sending the reimbursement within a few days. It couldn't be easier
title: The perfect pet insurance

text:
I had been a satisfied customer since 2013. The claims process was straightforward, the coverage was great, etc. My rates went up annually, which I expected, and the notices and FAQs said is based on the rising costs of veterinary care. Back in 2013 my monthly premium for two dogs was $63, with a $250 deductible for each dog.

In 2019 I doubled my deductible to lower my monthly premium and keep it under $100/month. 

In 2020 I got a notice that my monthly premium was increasing by 30%, and this year I received a notice that my premiums were increasing another 50%. My monthly premium will now be $194, over 3x more than when I signed up‚Äîand I have a higher deductible.

I‚Äôve since learned that though they don‚Äôt come out and say it, they factor your pet‚Äôs age into their anniversary increases even if you signed them up when they were young. Once your dogs are seniors and likely have various health conditions, it is not easy to switch insurers because of their age and all of the conditions that would become ‚Äúpreexisting‚Äù with a new provider. So you‚Äôre stuck.

If you‚Äôre shopping for pet insurance, there is at least one competitor to Healthy Paws that bases premiums on your pet‚Äôs age at the time you enroll and doesn‚Äôt do ‚Äúbirthday increases.‚Äù I only chose Healthy Paws because their misleading language suggested they were the same. After doing some research I‚Äôve learned that there was actually a class action lawsuit against Healthy Paws over this issue, and Healthy Paws does base the increases on your pet‚Äôs age.

Loyal customers who have paid premiums for many years on young, healthy dogs should not get stuck with thousands of dollars a year in premiums and high deductibles once their dogs age. They shouldn‚Äôt be forced to consider dropping coverage at exactly the time their dogs need it most. I really wish I had made a different choice back in 2013.
title: Huge rate hikes as your dog gets older

text:
I know many negative reviews you can tell are from irrational people, but trust me this is not.

I started with healthy paws 3 years ago. at 8 weeks old I signed my Labrador Retriever up for $48 a month. After the first year the rate went up to $74 a month. Fast forward to this year the new rate is $98 a month for a healthy 3 year old Lab. No changes to coverages were made. No major claims. My 8 year old Bulldog is insured with Trupanion and as expected the rates go up about $2 or $3 a month. Not $25+ a month increases every year like Healthy Paws. My 8 year old English Bulldog's insurance is now cheaper than my Lab's. Disgraceful. The company is a complete bait and switch offering low rates and quickly jacking them up so lazy customers don't leave. Be warned and shop else where so you're not as mad as me 2 years later trying to insure a 3 year old dog with another company.
title: Total scam. Cheap at first

text: Have been with healthy paws for all three of our current and past pets, and have been very satisfied with their easy claim submission process, quick and fair claim processing, and excellent customer service.
title: Have been with healthy paws for all‚Ä¶

text: We really love Healthy Paws - we've been a client since our pup was diagnosed with IVDD in 2016. While that specific ailment is not covered (NO PET INSURANCE ON THE MARKET COVERS PRE-EXISTING CONDITIONS), Healthy Paws has covered A TON of other illnesses and emergencies for us as our dog continues to age. It has been AMAZING to have the peace of mind on some of these high-cost items (ex: gallbladder ultrasound with partial anesthesia and oral mass removal/biopsy with full anesthesia). It's stressful enough without the financial factor!! I would hate to have to turn down treatment that I know would benefit our fur-son because of the cost, and seriously, I NEVER have to with Healthy Paws. With no lifetime spend cap, I can count on my selected reimbursement rate (90%) every time. They do not cover "good pet owner" costs, such as grooming, vaccinations, etc., but everything else, less a small $100 yearly deductible for us, is paid back - quickly! The app has had some hiccups, but overall, it's fantastic too! I OBSESSIVELY researched all of the options several years ago, and I have, thus far, been 100% satisfied with the investment. Any and all future pets will be Healthy Paws customers.
title: Healthy Paws - from Young Adult to Senior Pup

text: My 6 month old mini golden doodle swallowed a rock and needed emergency surgery. We are so grateful that we had Healthy Paws insurance, which covered a very sizable portion of a very sizable bill! Customer service reps were very helpful and followed up to see how Bodhi was doing. It was a scary and challenging time and it was nice to know that other people were thinking of our fur baby. We highly recommend!
title: My 6 month old mini golden doodle‚Ä¶

text: After owning many large breed dogs (mostly Rottweilers) and paying out thousands of dollars for knee and hip surgeries, my vet finally suggested it might be worth my while to get health insurance for my dogs.  I tried out a couple of different insurances  - which I wasn't impressed with AT ALL - before I finally discovered Healthy Paws.  I now have two of my dogs on Healthy Paws insurance; Milton my Bullmastiff and Cooper my rescue German Shepherd.  It is by far the best puppy insurance on the market. Like your own personal health insurance, you have choices to what you want your deductible to be.  It covers far more than the majority of the competitor dog insurances. It is simple to use. The complete Claim process from filing to payout of claim is impressively quick and smooth. They also follow up on your animal to check in on how they're doing - which I appreciate. When your pups are sick, you need support - you get that from Healthy Paws - they care. I recommend them to all my friends and family members.  I am a huge animal lover, and my dogs are my family.  I have nothing but great things to say about Healthy Paws.
title: By far the best dog insurance out there!

text: I adopted a 5 year old retired racing greyhound who had a repaired broken leg. Reading some other reviews, I was concerned about preexisting conditions but I found Healthy Paws very honest and straightforward about what would be considered a preexisting condition. I decided to go ahead with the policy and I never regretted that decision. For the first few years, my dog luckily remained healthy and I didn‚Äôt have to submit any claims. His rate increased every year but I understood that as he got older, there was an increased chance that I would need to submit claims. This past year I got the worst news ever- my baby was diagnosed with osteosarcoma. This is a quick death sentence for many pups. His vet gave him maybe 2 months left. Because we had Healthy Paws, I was able to aggressively fight this disease using the latest technology. There would be no way I would have been able to afford all of his tests and treatments without them (over $10,000). They covered amputation, chemotherapy, countless X-rays, nuclear scan, acupuncture, daily medications, and ultrasounds. They gave me an extra year with my baby and I am forever grateful to them.
title: Healthy Paws gave me an extra year with my pup.

text:
I signed up for Healthy Paws when my pup was just 10 weeks old. The 2 week accident free waiting period was worrisome, but not overly so. If I had been smart, I would have signed Pippa up 2 weeks prior to bringing her home to alleviate the waiting time on my watch. But all was well for just 6 weeks. One day, Pippa limped unexpectedly and went lame on her back leg and was in sharp pain and distress. it was a Sunday. Always happens. So off to the emergency vet. X-rays, pain meds and a diagnosis: broken ankle needing emergency orthopedic surgery. Cost $6000. I called Healthy Paws to verify my coverage, which they did. With little financial worry, I could focus on Pippa and her surgery and treatment plan. I received my invoices and sent them over to Healthy Paws along with my pups limited vet records. Less than a week later the claim was settled and less than two weeks later, the correct reimbursement is in my hand. And my Pippa is still in her cast because  the whole process start to finish at Healthy Paws took less than 2 weeks. The only major drawbacks that I find to the coverage is no coverage for office visits. No 90/10 plan coverage. No optional wellness plan. 
But to their credit they offer unlimited lifetime benefits. That‚Äôs what drew me to choose Healthy Paws. A catastrophic illness like cancer or kidney disease will eat up a $10k annual maximum in as little as 30 days. I know. I was there. So, when I looked around this was a priority. And with rates at 1/2 of the competition, $30 monthly, I can afford to pay for several office visits per year out of pocket if necessary. So, for me Healthy Paws was the way to go!
title: I signed up for Healthy Paws when my‚Ä¶Healthy Paws insured Pippa from 10 weeks old...

Healthy Paws has made these very stressful situations easier to handle because our claims are very easy to submit using their app and are processed very quickly.  For the routine medication claims I submit they are sometimes processed within hours.  We are very happy that we chose Healthy Paws.

text: Healthy Paws has been a lifesaver (literally) for our sweet little pug, Rosie. We got her as a puppy and thankfully we chose healthy paws as our pet insurance.  Within her first year she had a major seizure and was diagnosed with autoimmune encephalitis.  She has an excellent neurologist who has been able to keep her seizures under control with lots of medications but it is VERY expensive.  We call Rosie our million dollar pug ‚Äî she almost 3 years old and still living a happy, nearly seizure-free life thanks to Healthy Paws.  I recommend them to everyone I know!  Their customer service is excellent and it‚Äôs so easy to submit claims and get reimbursed.  I wish my own health insurance was this good!
title: Healthy Paws has been a lifesaver‚Ä¶

text:
We don‚Äôt typically write a lot of reviews, but in this case it is a must! When it comes to pet insurances, we are seriously in good hands with Healthy Paws. 

Our story began last year when we adopted a puppy; our little Humphrey came from a very good breeder with a good family health history; did it matter?...not in this case and like people, things can go wrong sometimes health wise even at a young age. He was diagnosed with something similar to Crohn‚Äôs Disease (in humans) but in order to find this out, we ended up having to go through a process of elimination of a series of very expensive tests; from x-rays, to an ultrasound, to an endoscopic procedure with biopsies.

Healthy Paws was with us every step of the way, starting with the hassle free and ease of submitting claims, no questions asked and no bad surprises; ‚Äúwhat we were insured for, is what we got‚Äù.  Each time, the claims were reviewed quickly; and the reimbursements received promptly. Their website is also very user friendly and the information provided very clear; their live Customer Service Agents, all excellent. 

Finally, I would like to add, that, as if this is not satisfactory enough, after each procedure that was done on Humphrey, Healthy Paws would follow up to see if he was feeling better...asking us to take care of him and not to worry about the rest! ...come on!... does your doctor‚Äôs office or health insurance company do that? 

It is as simple as that:  if Healthy Paws could insure us, humans, we would switch instantly!   

Marie-Christine & David
title: Can we humans be insured by Healthy Paws?

text:
What outstanding service.  My cat, Julius, has had skin problems since he chose me, several years ago.  After exhausting all options, at his primary vet, I finally got him in front of a cat dermatologist.  A week later his lab test results came in, and we have identified what ails him.  He will soon be starting, what will likely be, a life-long regimen of allergy medicine that should help alleviate his symptoms.

I can tell you that Healthy Paws has been fantastic throughout this journey. Having pet insurance has really helped. When the specialist vet tells you the cost, to figure it all out, is over one thousand dollars... knowing I had coverage was such a relief.  I find it much easier to move forward with what will best help Julius, rather than being hyper-focused on the bottom line of cost. 

The claims process is extremely smooth. I scan my receipts and vet notes, for each appointment - and within a day or two my claim is completed and paid.  Phenomenal.  And for that I say THANK YOU.  They allow me to focus on my cat's health.

title: Couldn't be happier!

text:
Healthy Paws has been by far the best insurance purchase I have ever made. As a multiple pet parent, having Healthy Paws on my side puts my mind at ease that any healthy issue my pups face will be handled and I can just focus on taking care of my pups. I have been a Healthy Paws customer since I first learned about them from a coworker. While primarily my claims have been for relatively minor items (torn dew claw, allergies, etc), the first time I truly saw the value and compassion was when my larger pup Montana injured his right stifle joint. Worried that he had torn his CCL, we apprehensively took him in to our regular vet to get a diagnosis. As expected we were referred to a Orthopedic Vet and our worst fears were confirmed when they said he needed surgery for a luxating patella and possible torn CCL. The consult resulted in a surgical estimate of $5515 at the high end, this is after imaging to confirm no major fractures. While not a small amount it was certainly within our means. 

What Healthy Paws did first was make sure I was concerned with my pups pre and post-operative care. They concisely informed me what requirements were for medical documentation and invoices and the process to provide that is super easy through their web app. They then made the process even easier when they approved the claim for all of Montana's veterinary, imaging, and surgical bills in less than 48 hours and had the re-imbursement direct deposited into my checking account in total less than 72 hours from me submitting the documents through the web app portal. 

What Healthy Paws is, an example of an organization that whose primary focus is their customers; the pets they insure, and their owners, the people who derive peace of mind from this coverage. They recognize their existence is to pay for pet's medical needs, not to deny claims to benefit shareholders like other corporate insurance entities. If the world had more organizations that acted like Healthy Paws, then we would live in a significantly different world. I will continue to espouse the values and virtue of Health Paws to all who are interested and have already done so with multiple individuals. 

If you are looking for a reputable and honorable pet insurance organization, I don't think you can do better than Healthy Paws.
title: Healthy Paws manages your pet's healthcare costs so you can manage your pet's health

text:

text:
I am a dog mom. I take this job as seriously as being a daughter, sister, aunt, etc. My 2 year and 9 month old Cockapoo is the most important thing in my life (along with the rest of my family). I landed on Healthy Paws and could not be happier with my decision. 

When I took Ziggy home, I would never be able to predict anything so scary would happen. She‚Äôs happy, healthy, goes to her regular vet appointments and has a very active lifestyle. She has never been left alone for more than one hour; she goes everywhere with me except places she‚Äôs not allowed or places she‚Äôs been and doesn‚Äôt like. She‚Äôs the boss! 

The night of December 5, 2020 into the early morning hours of December 6, 2020 was the scariest moments to date being a dog mom. Ziggy began vomiting and pooping dark, deep, heavy blood. I brought her into the animal hospital where she was admitted into ICU and stayed for 2 days. Her vet continued to treat her on an outpatient basis the rest of the week to get Ziggy to the point of stable. Not once did I think about money, if I need to move with my parents to pay for her care, that‚Äôs what would happen. I am willing to do anything for my baby, including donating my limb if it helped her. 

I was in total panic for a week, maxed out all my credit and debit cards. The hospital and vet saved Ziggy and Healthy Paws saved me! Not only did they take my claim and process it so quickly, I had about 50% of all my unforeseen expenses back into my debit account. Not to mention, I got a follow up email asking how Ziggy was feeling and that Healthy Paws was sending her a hug! Health Insurance Companies for people usually are the ones to deny claims and make life difficult and Healthy Paws was no nonsense! If you get a fur baby, Healthy Paws is the BEST investment. Ziggy is stable and doing better and I am so grateful to know in an emergency, Healthy Paws has both our backs!

text:
A liver biopsy revealed that my absolutely heart and soul has a copper storage issue, and the good news was that the procedure and recovery went really well. 

However the bad news is he's going to be on some pretty powerful meds for awhile to clear all the copper out of his liver, and so it means a lot to have the billing for all his past procedures and medications handled so professionally and promptly by Healthy Paws Pet Insurance. He's not out of the woods yet and he's my absolute heart and soul, but it means a ton to not have to worry about the financial element of his care too much because of the coverage they're providing. 

The app is easy to use and they even made changing to direct deposit really simple, without this coverage the hundreds and hundreds and dollars of medication after this multi-thousand dollar surgery would be beyond stressful and might break me.
title: A liver biopsy revealed that my‚Ä¶

text: My 9-month old kitten Milo had two seizures within a two week period. While it was very scary for us to go through, the peace of mind that we had pet insurance meant I didn't have to worry about affording any of the tests, overnight hospitalization, or medications. The explanation of benefits was very clear each time and the reimbursements were deposited as cash into my checking account within 1-2 days after filing the claims. Claims are incredibly easy to file as well -- all you have to do is upload the itemized invoice from the vet. The monthly premium of $14 is the best investment I've ever made and I couldn't be happier with the ease and delivery of benefits Healthy Paws promised. They can count us customers for life!
title: Easy claim filing, fast reimbursement, delivers benefits promised

text:
When we adopted our rescue Skeeter I knew I wanted pet insurance. Prior to adopting Skeeter, we had adopted an English Bulldog and we passed up health insurance on him because of the cost. That was a huge mistake. There is nothing worse than having to make hard choices about your pets health because of the cost. Of course we always did what was necessary to provide our Bull Dog with the care he needed but it hurt us financially. 
For Skeeter I researched almost all of the pet insurance plans out there and after reading Healthy Paws policy, we decided that was the right plan for us. For the first 1.5 years our minimal claims never met the deductible, so there was no payment to us. 
Then this past Sunday my dog became very ill and was vomiting blood and passing blood through his feces. He‚Äôs had some digestive issues in the past but nothing like this. Monday I called my vet and they recommended the ER and advised he may need an x-ray or ultrasound. 
That night I filed a claim and today (2 days later) I received an email that the claim was approved. What a relief to have Healthy Paws there for us in such a scary time. 
Many of the negative complaints on here are no fault of Healthy Paws but rather the policy owner not understanding the policy. As the consumer it is your responsibility to know and understand what you are buying. I thoroughly read the policy and all the information related to how to file a claim and have never had an issue. 
The major items to outline is that on your first claim you must send in a complete history of your pets medical records so they can determine pre-existing conditions. Exams are not covered and you have to meet the deductible before benefits are paid. One you meet the deductible it‚Äôs a coinsurance percentage that you chose upon purchase. Hope this helps! 
Thank you Healthy Paws!
title: Thankful for Healthy Paws

text: Many years ago I was seeking to change Pet Insurance Companies.  I checked out Healthy Paws and have been so pleased with the decision to sign our sweet boxer up for coverage.  She has not required frequent need for care coverage despite being diagnosed with Megaesophagus.  She has had a malignant tumor removed and just recently blew out her ACL requiring joint surgery.  Despite age 9 being on the older side for a boxer, she remains very active.  The claims process couldn't be more simple!  I used my phone app, took a picture of the invoice and sent it.  Not thinking I would be placing a claim this year I had not sent a few earlier invoices re a few meds.  All were accepted and coverage paid promptly!  I could not be happier with service and payment.

text:
My nearly 2 year old previously healthy dog suddenly developed seizures and required an ER visit, an ER to hospital transfer, 3 nights in the neuro ICU, a brain MRI, spinal tap, and was started on a steroid pulse and lifetime of anti-seizure medications. Needless to say, this was an extremely stressful time as I worried about his health, prognosis, and financial strain. Healthy Paws really came through for us. Submitting the claims via the app was simple, clear, and painless. They worked on the claims within a few days and provided reimbursement quickly. I can't tell you what a relief it was to have Healthy Paws pet insurance so that I wouldn't have to be in a position of compromising my dog's health because I wasn't sure if I could foot the bill. 

In addition, after his discharge, Healthy Paws reached out to check in on how my dog was doing. I replied back that I was having a hard time getting one bill reimbursed and the customer rep took the initiative to speak with claims to research why - then provided me a reason, and then followed up to make sure things were settled. I am so grateful. 

You can't ask for a better company to care for your dog and you.
title: Get Healthy Paws pet insurance!

text:
I adopted my pet and not long after, she needed surgery. This is the first pet I purchased insurance for and boy was I lucky to find Healthy Paws. Since her meds are a result of the surgery, they cover her meds and I submit my claim every six months (my choice, not theirs).

They are just wonderful and I tell everyone of my experience, not to let people know I've spent over 45K to date and HP reimbursed, quickly I might add but to let people know pet insurance is NOT a waste of money and you never know what is going on inside your pet.  As for a wellness plan, I feed my dog quality food,(Just Food For Dogs) get her vaccinations and nails trimmed (VIP), pretty much take care of her. Just do it!!

title: We have 2 rescue pit bull and enrolled‚Ä¶

text:
I was definitely one of those people who thought pet insurance might not be necessary at first. But with three very curious kittens, the odds were stacked pretty high against me ‚Äì so I decided to do some research and get my kittens insurance just in case. Healthy Paws seemed to offer the best bang for my buck, so I enrolled my kitties with them, sent in their initial medical records to activate their plans, and kinda forgot about it. 

Cut to a few days ago, when, lo and behold, one of my kittens somehow tore the felt ribbon off his Cat Dancer Rainbow Cat Charmer and ingested a good chunk of it. We rushed him to an emergency pet hospital where they did an ultrasound and confirmed that he would need to have surgery. Unfortunately they didn't have a surgeon and he needed to be transferred to a different hospital. In total, the cost of both emergency visits was right around the $6-7k mark. Immediately after our kitty's discharge from the hospital following surgery, I filed claims for both hospital bills. But within three days, both claims were processed and my direct deposits was paid out!! 

This has been a thoroughly stressful experience for all of us, but Healthy Paws has helped to alleviate some of that stress. What's more, they reached out after our claims were processed and asked about our cat's health. Really stellar customer service, and I'm so glad we signed up with them. I'll be recommending them to all my pet owner friends!

text: I am writing to rave about my recent experience with Healthy Paws. I ended up getting coverage a few months ago for my new dog, and unfortunately he came down with a serious case of a coughing fit that ended up needing further testing, diagnosis, and prescription medication. title: Wonderful experience with Health Paws!

text:
The claims process with healthypaws has become completely ridiculous!  I used healthypaws for years with my previous dog and they were wonderful but unfortunately a lot has changed in the last 8-9 months.  I always like to have insurance for my dogs and when I got two new puppies, early 2020 it was a no brainer for me to get healthypaws for them on day one.  Unfortunately, that was poor decision!  They now reject every and all claims you send them, telling you ‚Äúadditional action‚Äù is required to complete the claim.  They will send you an email with some BS like something is cut off or missing from the claim and you need to resubmit the information. They have done this with EVERY claim I‚Äôve sent in!!! EVERY ONE!  Here‚Äôs the funny thing, this never happened once the entire time I used them before, Ive very familiar with claim filing process. I‚Äôm guessing they are now underwritten by a new company or just decided to be difficult so people would give up on filing a claim after three submissions.  They love to use the ‚Äúpage was cut off‚Äù excuse! Really.... I find that interesting as I take a picture of the page and the entire thing is in the image and nothing is mission or ‚Äúcut off‚Äù as they like to say.  Ive send multiple responses and asked for someone to detail to me what the infraction is on a claim and you guessed it never once have I received a response. Back a year ago I would have said hands down go with healthypaws and dont even bother shopping around but seeing as they are no better now then any other insurance company, as far as customer service and claims processing, you might as well go with a cheaper company... I know I‚Äôll be switching myself.

In response to your reply, it‚Äôs pretty clear my issue was ignored. You‚Äôre making a point to detail past medical issues, why? My dogs are puppies as I mentioned and don‚Äôt have any past issues or medical records. Furthermore, my issue is not with one claim. Every single claim submitted gets an action required email and then you give some BS reason like the claim is missing information or the page is cut off. The page can‚Äôt be cut off when it‚Äôs a picture of the invoice and I used the app and then camera to take the photo... I didn‚Äôt send some cut off fax, they are full page edge to edge images with all information clearly shown in the picture, for all claims submitted not just one. Your response just proves my point and shows the lack of customer support, now you want me to post my account information online??? Really, that‚Äôs a brilliant suggestion. I‚Äôve sent multiple responses already via email and have yet to get a email response or phone call as I‚Äôve requested, how about you take the time and care to respond to those and not just the complaints posted online.
title: Awful claims process

text: We've had policies on our dogs for several years now, and have had an extremely positive experience w/HealthyPaws. Most recently, our 11-year-old pup was diagnosed with liver cancer, very unexpectedly. His claims for diagnostics, surgery, and hospitalization were all covered quickly and without a fight. It's a comfort knowing that we found a company that stands behind their policy and allows us to focus on getting and keeping our beloved fur-babies if something unexpected happens.
title: Will never use another company for Pet Insurance

text:
We have two rescue puppers that both came from a bad situation.  They are now 7¬Ω years old 5¬Ω, we foster-failed them when they were both very young, weeks old. We immediately got pet insurance when we adopted them.  We first used PetFirst, because I was attracted to the wellness package, but I was not very happy with the coverage.  Within a year we switched to Healthy Paws because I liked their coverage better, read excellent reviews, and realized that we needed insurance for life changing events (sickness and/or accidents).  We wanted peace of mind that if something should happen to our little furry family members, that it would be a choice of ‚Äúwill this give them the best quality of life?‚Äù as opposed to ‚Äúcan we afford this?‚Äù.  I tell you; the last two years have been a ringer for us, and we have never needed this insurance more. 

Our older pup was bitten by a rattlesnake, got a really bad MRSA infection that took a year to recover from and when we moved into our new home, he developed grass allergies (of all things?!).  He‚Äôs currently being treated by a dermatologist for that allergy and we are diligently working on redoing our landscaping and ripping out the grass‚Ä¶all for him.  Outside of the deductible and some small exclusions (i.e. exam fees) all of his vet bills were covered by Healthy Paws, we opted for the 90% reimbursement option years ago and have maintained that coverage.

Our younger pup ripped a nail completely off, but interesting enough the quick remained (very painful as it was completely exposed).  And then unfortunately, 3 weeks ago she was hit by a car and had to have a total hip replacement.  She also cracked a tooth in the accident that still needs to be addressed once she is stronger from her above operation.  We were there when it happened, saw it, and I can‚Äôt even begin to explain how we were feeling, seeing her almost killed, her suffering, and knowing that we failed to keep her safe.  That she is alive and will be ok, has kept us sane.  She was IMMEDIATLEY taken to a vet, stabilized, and treated for her injuries.  As terrifying as this all was, at no time did we think about the cost or that we will have to surrender her, let her suffer in pain, or euthanize her.  I lost 3 family members and my job this year.  The thought of not having her treated never even crossed our minds.  

All of this is thanks to Healthy Paws.  In the craziness of 2020, I am so thankfully that we had the insight to get insurance and grateful that Healthy Paws has been so awesome.  

Their claim filing is a complete breeze, it takes less than 2 minutes if you have your vet email you the receipt and any necessary medical records.  If you have any questions, their customer service has been very responsive.  And their turn-around time for reimbursement is very quick, within days!

From the beginning I have told all of our pet parent friends that they need to get pet insurance.  Do your own research and get what works for you, but I am a strong advocate for this company. 
  
Stay safe and healthy!

~Healthy Paws Biggest Fan

text: I love Healthy Paws insurance company. They have been a lifesaver for me and my dog, Tizo. title: I love Healthy Paws insurance company

text:
We adopted Georgie from Shaggy Dog Rescue who saved him from a shelter in TX and he made his journey to us via Rescue Road Trips. We didn't know much about his background so decided to start researching pet insurance. It took awhile to really research all of the providers on the market and after reading countless reviews we went with Healthy Paws. Second best decision we have made when it comes to Georgie (first, was deciding to apply to be in the running to adopt him). 

So fast forward to about 1.5 years after he joined the family. Our groomer noticed a bump by his boy part. We immediately got him into his primary care vet who diagnosed him with mast cell cancer. On to the surgical consultant and resulting procedure (with an overnight hospital stay). While it was nerve-racking to be away from our fur baby, one thing that I didn't worry about was his insurance coverage. Healthy Paws has been nothing but amazing when we have submitted previous claims for his meds, etc. After his surgery I submitted the invoices and the reimbursement was promptly processed. text: Have had a policy for one pet for years; payments made through monthly debit by the company; my payment account information has never changed; last month I received an email on the date payment was due "Your account has been suspended". said my bank payment had been declined; I checked, no, it had not, it hadn't been presented; went to my account on the website, entered my payment information it kept stating "unsuccessful". Then I checked my bank, payment had been made; emailed them & they called back & said it was a system error, not to worry.  This month I rec'd an email Cancellation of Policy Notification due to "non-payment". I called them, they asked that I go to the account page on their website & enter the payment information.  I did, it was immediately paid.  The rep said she would talk to the appropriate dept about the issue; I asked that she get back to me since it happened 2 months in a row after years of no problem.  Next contact I received was in USPS "Pet Health Notice of Cancellation". dated same date I spoke with the rep; giving me less than 30 days til policy expiration.  Does this company start canceling policies after they've been in force for a few years, consistently paid, zero claims, because they assume that the longer the hold the policy the more likely it is that a claim will eventually be submitted?  Are they operating in good faith?

text: Unbeknownst to us, our English bulldog puppy, Bow, came to us with a wide variety of maladies, probably due to poor breeding practices.  A friend suggested that I get pet insurance because veterinary care has become expensive.  She suggested the one she used, but I investigated a number of companies and chose Healthy Paws.  Bow has had multiple eye surgeries, multiple leg surgeries and she has now developed some sort of liver ailments.  Over a 5 year period, they have reimbursed me thousands of dollars.  You may choose different levels of reimbursement - I chose 70%.   They made it easy to file a claim by simply  posting a picture of the bill via a cell telephone app.  I have always fronted the bill and the reimbursement has never been more than 2 weeks and most often it's less than a week.  Many of the companies I investigated would have dropped Bow's coverage because they have upper limits of coverage.  I have always received my reimbursement promptly and with no questions from the company. I've been able to keep Bow because of this insurance.  I can't thank them enough.  They literally saved Bow's life.
title: Thank you, Healthy Paws!

text: Lily became a part of our family at around 18mo of life, she was kind of a mess in many ways as she wasn't treated kindly before entering her foster home. Right away we knew this high energy and agile dog would need insurance. I searched many plans before deciding Healthy Paws would fit our needs best. We worked hard to buy quality food and keep her healthy so we didn't feel the need for a plan that covered routine visits at the expense of having an annual cap or outrageous prices. We opted to have the lowest deductible with the highest reimbursement rate as we assumed we would need it for something like a torn ACL or broken leg years down the road. We went years with only needing to file a claim or two for minor cuts that would require a stitch here and there from rough play. Two months ago we took Lily in to check her for what we thought were digestion issues, to our dismay that visit we saw x-rays that showed an enlarged heart and the vet found other abnormalities. She was waitlisted to see a cardiologist and about two weeks later she needed to be rushed in to see an ER Cardiologist as her lungs were filling with fluid and her health was suddenly suffering. After a 24hour stay, medications, fluids, and multiple kinds of imaging she was released with a CHF diagnosis and a list of structural abnormalities within the heart. Our lively and spunky dog was returned to us with a large bill and a very expensive list of medications. Within the past month we had spent a lot of time in and out of vet offices, had to apply for care credit, lost hours of sleep counting respiratory rates, started 5 new medications, and had emotional break downs, but the easiest and most comforting part of this experience has been working with Healthy Paws. Filing claims is a breeze (literally takes one minute) in between all the stressful phone calls and commuting to different vets and picking up my child from school. The wait times to reach customer service is almost non existent, they follow up, answer questions, and are extremely transparent in what they cover. We never once needed to resubmit claims or renegotiate covering a bill or medications (seriously, one prescription was $664). THEY ACTUALLY REMIBURESED 90% of everything the website says they will. They provide explanation of coverage with each bill and we got our payments direct deposited in less than a week. Without this insurance we wouldn't have been able to provide her with quality end of life care, especially not during these Covid times being a small business owner and a young family. We are extremely grateful to Healthy Paws and would never have another dog without having a policy with them.
title: The most reliable insurance I've ever seen!

text: I subscribed to Healthy Paws pet insurance when my puppy was ~12 weeks old. I wanted to make sure that if she ever got a severe/random disease like cancer that I wouldn't have to think about whether or not I could afford treatment. When my dog was about 2 years old, she started getting really bad environmental allergies which has led to constant ear infections, UTIs, skin problems, scratching, etc. in addition to monthly Cytopoint injections ($100 each!!). Healthy Paws has been extremely easy to work with and usually completes claims and reimburses us within 1-2 days of submission. We are now trying out immunotherapy on our dog to actually treat her allergies, and I don't think we'd even be able to consider that if we didn't have coverage through Healthy Paws. I would recommend Healthy Paws to all dog owners and I would just recommend getting it as early as possible to avoid having pre-existing conditions that might deny coverage!

I rescued a cat, got an exam the next day, provided all to Healthy Paws which they happily accepted as proof there were no pre-existing conditions, along with my premiums.  As it turns out my cat developed asthma which they argued was a pre-existing condition that no one knew about (does that make sense to you?).  It took a month for them to develop their case why they won't pay and asked for the same information 3 times.  I sent them everything I had and at the end they just assumed it as a pre-existing condition.  I cancelled my coverage with them.  Don't fall for their nonsense.  Do the right thing and save your money!

text: I chose healthy paws because it was one of the highest rated pet insurance programs. About a year into insuring my pets, healthy paws has denied documentation for my cat who has had multiple full exams by the vet. They have stated that these exams are not complete enough to insure that he has no pre-existing conditions. There is no basis for this denial that I can find as he has had blood work, his teeth checked, his ears cleaned and is up to date on his boosters. He has gone to multiple vets over the few years I‚Äôve had him. Now, any claims I‚Äôve filed are being denied because the exams are considered incomplete. The vets didn‚Äôt think so. Customer service has been totally unhelpful with this issue. I would highly recommend choosing another pet insurance company like Trupanion that processes claims quickly and has far superior customer service. Not willing to gamble with the health of my pets. Healthy Paws will not be there when you need them.
