text: I highly recommend Healthy Paws Pet Insurance to anyone who is looking for the very best insurance for their furry friends. This company is top notch and not only provides the best insurance coverage but also the absolute best service hands down. I have been using Healthy Paws since 2016 when the insurance company I had for my dog, Waylan wouldn't pay his claims after he was diagnosed with a rare platelet issue. I did some research on various insurance companies and found Healthy Paws to be the best. They not only took on all his claims going forward but paid them at 70% and didn't asked twice in regard to any other medical issues he had going forward. In July of this year Waylan passed away and I was so touched by the way Healthy Paws reached out to me not only via email but also with a sympathy card that truly showed they cared about my special little friend. In September of this year I was fortunate enough to be blessed and grateful once again that I have Healthy Paws as insurance for my furry cat friend, Julian. He became very sick and within a week ended up three days in the Urgent Care undergoing various tests and treatments to find out why his liver values were so high and to get to the bottom of why he wasn't eating. He recovered nicely while in Urgent Care and came out with a feeding tube but to my surprise and the doctors as well, he was eating on his own again three days after being released from the Urgent Care. The bill for his treatment was over $4200.00! Even without pet insurance I would have found a way to pay for his treatment but without missing a step Healthy Paws reviewed his treatment chart and medical records paying 90% of his bill +/- his exam, food and natural medicine treatments. They also followed up with me via email twice to make sure he was recovering and still responding to treatment. I felt it was time to write a review about Healthy Paws and all the great things they have done not only for my pets but for me as well!
title: I highly recommend Healthy Paws

text: I started off with Healthy paws pet insurance because of a reasonable monthly rate of $55 dollars a month. My rates have jumped from $ 55 dollars a month to $111 Dollars going into 2021, I work in the insurance industry and this is unbelievable and concerning. Watch out for Healthy Paws is going to increase your rates every year. I am now shopping for new insurance for my pup. NOT HAPPY
title: Premiums go up every year

text: I got Healthy Paws Pet Insurance for my rescue dog Tiger Lily when she was 3 years old.  I had previous experience with other pet insurance, and knew I needed something better than what I had used with previous pets, so I did some research.  It has been the best decision I have ever made.  Tiger Lily was healthy and happy for years.  Each year I would barely use the deductible. Maybe a couple of years there was a foxtail in her foot, or a gastro intestinal episode, and I would be glad I was able to submit a claim.  Then, as she got older she developed allergies--and Healthy Paws has made it possible to get her monthly medications, and then there was an episode that landed her in the emergency room with a sludgy gallbladder diagnosis-- but it was an expensive ER visit. It gave me peace of mind to know that my insurance would cover it. Then she was diagnosed with a heart murmur, and I was relieved to be able to get an echocardiogram to see exactly what is going on. She developed arthritis, and I was able to get x-rays to verify this, and get her monthly medications to ease her pain, so she can still go on her "walkies".  And recently she had an acute middle ear infection that wasn't immediately visible--my vet sent me to the doggy neurologist because she was acting like she had a stroke., but I had peace of mind knowing I had Healthy Paws to help me through this issue.  Eventually it was determined she needed a procedure, a surgery, to clear out the fluid build up in her middle ear with a specialist... All through out this distressing health issue, the one thing I didn't have to stress about was whether or not my insurance would cover it.  Without Healthy Paws, my special Tiger Lily would not have been able to receive the necessary medical care she needed. Healthy Paws does what they advertise, and they are there when you need them.  If you have a pet, you need to get insurance for them.  And Healthy Paws is the Best.
title: Healthy Paws is the BEST

text:
Premium increases aren't fun, but I understand that's part of the pet insurance industry. However, an increase of 25% per month during a pandemic seems exorbitant. Really frustrated because we've never made a claim with them so far *and* they used to be more flexible regarding premium increases. In 2018, they tried to raise our rates by 25% but lowered it when I called and asked them if they could take it down. It's usually only a couple of dollars. Now it's 10+ dollars every year. 

The fact that they won't budge on the rate hike when so many people are struggling is really awful IMO. Used to recommend Healthy Paws to every pet owner I met but will no longer do so.

text: I bought a Healthy Paws insurance policy for my English golden retriever in 2015. I have used it twice now. text:
Here is a list of PET insurances that CARES & VALUES the customer MORE than Healthypaws.  Bellow, I explain why.

1- Pets Best
2- Spot
3- ASPCA Pet Insurance
4- Pumpkin
5- Embrace
6- Pawp
7- Toto

I do not recommend this insurance company at all.

I moved to a new home and a week after that I received an email from them stating that my monthly premium was going to increase due to the new location.

It was the third time I moved into a new place in 3 years and the two other times the exact same thing happened.

I proceeded to call Healthy Paws to find out what they were basing this raise in price on.

The very unhelpful and moody customer care agent just said that she did not know why the price change, that their system decides on prices and not them, therefore she could not do anything about it.  So I explained to her that if I simply went on their site and input my address as a new client, it was offered a monthly premium 20% cheaper than what I was paying. (Which does not seem fair that they value a 2-year client less than any new client).

I said that to the customer care agent, and she once again said ‚Äúthere is NOTHING I can do about that‚Äù.  So I asked her if maybe I should just cancel my account and open a new one. I asked her if it wouldn‚Äôt just be smarter if I did that. She replies that it is up to me and then asked if she could process the cancelation.

The cancelation was processed and the following day I opened a new account with them for both my pets for 20% less.

After the first time I took them to the vet I got a reply from Healthy paws that they will not cover my claim as it is now considered an existing condition.

I spoke to one of their managers about the situation, I explained that when I asked the customer care agent if I should do this, she never informed me that everything would be considered an existing condition.

Guess what the managers‚Äô answer was? ‚ÄúTHERE IS NOTHING I CAN DO ABOUT THAT‚Äù

They don‚Äôt care or value any of their customers!

text: My dog  is covered by a Healthy Paws policy and was diagnosed with a nasal tumor recently.  The company has covered everything per the policy, sending checks quickly.  It has given me the rare luxury of making the treatment decisions based solely on what will be best for her, with no major concern about my financial situation.  I have tight finances, can afford the deductible and copay, and am very happy I made the decision when she joined the family to insure her.  So many people say, "just put the money aside that you would pay for insurance."  I know that I would never do that, or if I did, would dip into it for say, an unexpected automobile or home repairs.  But also, my father told me that you should insure against disasters.  My previous experience with canine disasters is that it would take longer than a dog lives to cover the cost of one.  (In that experience, I took out two loans with Care Credit and went home with a can of ashes at the end.) I am very grateful to be able to make decisions for her benefit and to enjoy the time we have.

title: I never write reviews

text: I do not have enough positive things to say about my experience with Healthy Paws! Seriously, just get it.  Despite some teasing from friends about enrolling in pet insurance (I heard a lot of "its just a cat, it'll be fine"), I figured it was a good thing to do when I got my two kittens, Loki and Bo, about 4 years ago. I did my research, and the reviews I found online indicated that Healthy Paws seemed to be the one people liked the most. That, combined with the affordable monthly fee and low deductible meant that it wasn't going to break the bank, even if my cats never needed it. I've owned cats my whole life and have never had one with health problems, and the most time we'd ever spent at the vet was for occasional stomach issues etc. However, because I was a student at the time, I wanted to be sure that my little fur babies were covered if something were to happen.  While one of my cats (Loki) has been 100%  fine with no major incidents, Bo hasn't been as fortunate. He was diagnosed last year with feline asthma, and healthy paws has paid for  all of his medications (score one for Healthy Paws). Recently, in what was a freak accidently, Bo slipped off a shelf and broke his back leg upon landing. I have never had a cat with this sort of injury, and was so anxious about the whole thing. The surgery to repair it along with the diagnostics etc cost about $10,500 dollars. I can say for certain, without Healthy Paws covering almost all of it, I might have had to put Bo down. The situation was so stressful, but the one thing I did NOT stress about was whether I could afford Bo's medical treatment. It was a huge relief to listen to the emergency vets and authorize various pain medications, hospitalization, and surgery without worrying as much about the financial side of things.  It also was a relief to the vet/surgeons, as I could tell they really thought surgery was the only way forward. I called the customer support worried about everything, and the guy I spoke to was so kind, respectful, and reassuring about the coverage I had to treat the cat. The reimbursements are quick, can be done via direct deposit, and claims are processed so fast. After the surgery, healthy paws sent me a follow up email making sure Bo was ok. I have never once felt  unsure whether or not Bo would be covered. In summary, if you have a pet, please get pet insurance even if you don't think you'll need it, or have never had an issue with an animal before. I never ever expected to be in the sort of situation I was in, and I'm not sure what I would have done if I didn't have Healthy Paws. I know other people with Trupanion and some of the other competition, and they have all agreed that my coverage is way more expansive. I know I sound like  broken record, but I cannot recommend the coverage that this company provides, and the people working for them enough!
title: Cannot recommend highly enough!

text: I've never had a dog in my life before Luna, so I knew as soon as I got her back in 2017 that I needed pet insurance ASAP. I got her covered when she was 6 months old so she wouldn't have any pre-existing conditions. I read reviews for a bunch of insurance companies online, and I am SO glad I went with Healthy Paws! Every single time I've ever called them, I've been connected to a real person (in Washington!) who has compassionately and fully answered my questions or concerns. The claims process is quick and only ever takes a couple days, and then 90% of whatever is covered is deposited directly into my account. Recently, I got $600 of an over $700 emergency room bill reimbursed, which was HUGE for my peace of mind!! They're transparent about the annual deductible, which thankfully I'd already satisfied, and then they followed up with me personally afterward via email to ask how Luna was and make sure she was okay. The staff is friendly, the claims process is simple and intuitive, and there have never been any surprises in terms of what is or isn't covered. I am so glad I went with Healthy Paws, and I recommend them to all of my friends and family!

The premium has climbed significantly in the 8 years since I have been a member, but my Lab has gone through an array of health issues since she was a puppy - chronic stomach issues, two knee operations and kidney disease to name a few - and HealthyPaws has saved me thousands of dollars despite the monthly premium payment.

Their claims submission process is simple and straight forward, their claims department immediately confirms receipt and the review and processing time is very prompt. A detailed explanation of benefits and reimbursement follows within a matter of days. 

Their customer service phone support has also been outstanding, helpful and friendly. 

I recommend Healthy Paws to anyone looking for dog insurance, in particular if you have a young puppy with no pre-existing conditions to maximize the benefit.

title: When I bought HealthyPaws health‚Ä¶

text: I had Healthy Paws insurance for my two year old French Bulldog. French Bulldogs are considered a Brachycephalic dog breed, or short snouted dog. My dog had an emergency vet visit while out of town because she had breathing difficulty. I submitted a claim, which was denied, because her primary vet noted during a routine examine that she had features (palate / small nostrils) that are commonly associated with breathing difficulties with this breed. Although the emergency vet did X-rays and said she had a good lungs and breathing tube, the notes collected from her primary vet classified her as having a pre-existing condition because of her primary vet's observations (note we've never experienced breathing issues prior to this emergency visit). I appealed the first decision because I wanted to know why they covered this breed if they don't accept characteristics of this breed. My appeal was also denied. I asked both representatives I spoke with why French Bulldogs are accepted for coverage knowing the common challenges with short snouted dogs and neither could give me an answer. Added to my frustration was that when I signed up, my dog was enrolled as a Mixed Breed where my premium was $30 per month. When submitting the claims we discovered her breed was incorrect and my new premium was $105 per month. A $75 difference to cover a French Bulldog and my claim was still denied. Very disappointed with the end result and therefore I canceled my Healthy Paws insurance and will be sharing my experience with others as a watch out for this company.
title: French Bulldog owners beware!

text: So happy with Healthy Paws from the get go! Signed up our fur ball as soon as we got him at the 3 month mark. text:
Our 6 (almost seven) year-old Boston Terrier, Finn, was diagnosed with a corneal ulcer in late August. We think he may have gotten hit in the eye while chasing after a tennis ball (his favorite activity)! Following a week of antibiotic treatment, his ulcer did not heal, and his regular vet performed a grid keratotomy. Another week or so of antibiotic treatment following this procedure and unfortunately, while his ulcer was healing in diameter, it was getting much deeper and turned into what is called a Descemetocele (a surgical emergency that requires immediate attention to save the eye). Finn was seen by an Ophthalmologist at a renowned local Specialty Veterinary Center and luckily, following an emergency conjunctival pedicle graft, his eye was saved and is now healing wonderfully. ALL of these visits and procedures were covered by Finn‚Äôs plan with Healthy Paws (aside from office visits and the remaining 10% that is not reimbursed with our 90% reimbursement plan). This was in the thousands of dollars‚Ä¶ all because of a tennis ball!

I wish we could say that this was Finn‚Äôs one and only large insurance claim with Healthy Paws, but they also covered a major tooth fracture surgery that he had a few years back. Needless to say, our investment in Health Paws has lifted an enormous financial burden off of our family. While we would obviously have Finn treated for any illness or emergency at the blink of an eye, with Healthy Paws, we know that we do not have to stress over the financial impact that might come with an emergency illness or injury.

We HIGHLY recommend Healthy Paws to all of our friends and family with pets. We‚Äôve been a happy customer of Healthy Paws for nearly 7 years and have no complaints. We hope to never need to file a claim again (for Finn or his sister, Marino) but we can be rest assured that we have Healthy Paws to rely upon should a pet emergency arise. Thank you, Healthy Paws!

title: I cannot be more pleased with this company and their customer service

text: I've been a Healthy Paws customer for 4 years, we insure all of our family pets with them. This insurance not only raise their rates without notifying their clients, but they will also treat you like a crook. I've never had to use our pet insurance the past 4 years since our family pets are well taken care of and healthy, so as long as you don't use it everything is ok... just don't you ever dare to need it. One of our dogs just recently had to go to the vet and has had to go to a specialist as well, so they've decided to put a hold on our claims for over 3 weeks even thought I've called to confirm they have all his medical records and I've received confirmation they had; however, these claims are still on hold so I decided to call, the representative wasn't being too helpful so I requested to speak with a supervisor. She transferred me to someone who claimed to be "John senior manager for the Phoenix office". This person was so passive aggressive and so far from being compassionate that I cannot believe I've been paying all these years for this type of service. During our call he told me I was lying when I said we've only had one previous claim back in 2018 for this one pet. He insisted he needed to MAKE SURE this was not a condition that he's had before 2016. If a dog has had a health condition for the last 4 years, how come I would be submitting a claim just now? What this company is asking for is borderline impossible to achieve, making it easy for them to decline claims. How can any vet have records for over 4 years? This person is making everyone in our pet's history work overtime trying to find files that are in storage, in boxes and that they will have to make a staff member walk away from attending clients, so they can show my dog has been healthy all these years, hence NO claims. I noted to John from the Phoenix office that once we submitted our first claim back in 2018, as their policy states, they should have received all his medical history which I'm sure they received in order to process that first claim in 2018, if not then THEY are not doing their due diligence, as any new member needs to provide a complete medical history. This person was not only trying to make a situation worse claiming that I was lying because my first claims were submitted in 2020 (not true), he was trying to prove HIS case that I was lying when I said we have submitted other claims in the past. Healthy Paws claims to have compassion once your pet is going through a situation; however, they have done the complete opposite. I am beyond disappointed this is how Healthy Paws treats pet owners when they need to use the services they are paying for,  even when they raise their rates with no real fundamental reason, during COVID-19 when so many people have lost their jobs, and treat poorly the ones that can still afford to pay their high rates.
title: A Company that tries hard to prove you're a liar

I would have been in serious financial debt if I didn't have 90% coverage from Healthy Paws. Now all I have to worry about is getting Maisie back on all 4 paws and feeling good. Oh, and they will cover the PT visits when she is stronger, and her ongoing monthly chiropractic bills. It's a miracle!

text: I am so happy that we got Healthy Paws pet insurance when our dog, Lyle, came into our lives a couple of years ago. She is a healthy 3-year old dachshund mix (probably terrier) that a little over a month ago ruptured a disc and consequently suffered severe spinal trauma that resulted in paralysis from the waist down. She had surgery two days after the trauma; together with the hospital stay, medications and other various expenses, it cost ca. $15,000. Healthy Paws not only paid 80% of that, but since then has reimbursed us for 80% of her (fairly expensive) rehabilitation. She sees a specialist in canine rehab 3x a week, who does massage therapy, exercises, acupuncture, laser therapy, vibration therapy and other assorted things at the cost of $220/session. It is worth every penny, but we in no way could‚Äôve afforded Lyle‚Äôs surgery or rehab costs on our own and would‚Äôve had to let her go. Now, a little more than one month after the surgery, Lyle has gone from being completely paralyzed from the waist down with no control over her rear legs, her bowels, or her bladder to being able to stand on her own and even to standing up on her own. The prognosis for her walking again is good! We have found the customer service representatives at Healthy Paws incredibly friendly, empathetic and helpful, and those in the Claims Department patient, responsive, and prompt in their reimbursements. All this is so important when one‚Äôs pet is in pain and you are trying to move as quickly as possible to get it the care it needs to improve chances of recovery. We owe a tremendous debt of gratitude to Healthy Paws, as well as to the marvelous veterinarians Lyle has had and to Lyle herself, who is incredibly tenacious, stubborn and determined (sound familiar all you dachshund owners?). If any dog can walk after such a trauma, it will be Lyle, but only with the help of Healthy Paws and her caregivers.
title: Healthy Paws and its wonderful service

text: We brought our adorable 8 week old French bulldog puppy Milo home in November 2017.  As a new dog owner I immediately started to research pet insurance because I was unfamiliar with it and wasn‚Äôt sure if it was worthwhile.  After researching and comparing pet insurance I decided to invest in Healthy Paws.  I figured better safe than sorry.  Everything was fine until Milo was about 1 ¬Ω years old and he started to have medical issues.  He had his veterinarian which lead to his animal ophthalmologist and eventually his neurologist.  It was finally determined the next course of medical action was to have an MRI and Spinal tap performed.  Without thinking, because you will do anything for your little furry family member, we went ahead with the costly procedure just to finally rule out a neurological issue.  We made this decision thinking we would have to pay for the procedure out of pocket.  When I finally took a look at the coverage Healthy Paws provided for Milo‚Äôs policy, it covered 80% of the procedure minus the deductible.  A good portion of the cost was covered by Healthy Paws, which was a financial relief, along with the relief of finding out Milo did not have a neurological issue.  Healthy Paws customer service was very friendly and great to work with and the claim submission process was very easy and once all the required medical records were submitted it only took a couple of weeks to receive the check in the mail.  I HIGHLY recommend Healthy Paws if you are looking for medical coverage for your family pet.
title: BEST Choice in Pet Insurance

text: PET OWNER BEWARE!!!! If I could give Healthy Paws negative stars, I would. I used to LOVE Healthy Paws. I literally would recommend them to everyone I knew. I have a dog who was a very sick puppy. Without Healthy Paws, I would not have been able to keep her alive and I do thank them for all they have done to help me with her medical problems. As an insurance company- they are great. They reimburse medical bills easily and quickly. Their claims process is easy and straight forward. The reason I am writing this very negative review is because their rates are absolutely INSANE! They let you sign up for a very cheap rate- somewhere between $30 and $50 a month. After your first year and ANYTIME something changes (your address for example) they take that opportunity to INCREASE YOU RATE. Several times I have moved since getting Healthy Paws (some I changed states, some I just moved within the SAME state) and every single time the rates increased. I recently got an email in July 2020 stating that rates were going to increase and I would go from $49/month to $61/month. No one is ever happy with rate increases but an $12 increase wasn't that bad in my opinion. It was at that time that I also updated my address and SOMEHOW it made my rate go up to $68/month. Whatever, I was not happy with the increase but again, I sucked it up. This morning, I was checking my financial statements and noticed that my premium INCREASED TO $91/MONTH. Excuse me, what?! I was never notified of this increase and I certainly doubt that veterinary costs have increased this much since JULY 2020. I know what you are thinking- reviewer has a sick dog so her rates went up because of her number of claims. NOPE. I haven't filled a claim in over 2 years due to my dogs medical issues being taken care of. So why was my rate increased so much? The question remains unanswered. I will mention that a Class Action lawsuit was filed in Washington against Healthy Paws and they were fined and required to pay back people in Washington who had been using Healthy Paws for years. So please, keep all of this in mind before purchasing Healthy Paws insurance. I wish I had known this years ago.
title: PET OWNER BEWARE!!!

text:
We adopted our puppy at 10 weeks old and she just turned 2 yesterday. She's had an eventful first couple of years including:

text: I cannot say enough great things about my experience with Healthy Paws. Once I adopted my cat, I knew that getting pet insurance was going to be a no brainer for me. I never wanted to be in position where I‚Äôd have to make difficult decisions based on financial circumstances, and Healthy Paws has provided me with peace of mind. After adopting my cat Lilly in 2016, I immediately enrolled her after an exam, which showed she was in optimal health for an adult cat of her age. But a year or so later she developed early onset kidney disease and requires extensive diagnostics on a yearly basis. My policy has covered everything that she's needed with the exception of exams and her specialized food. And while the bills pile up initially, I'm just so thankful knowing that when I see that initial total, I'm going to get back 90% of the cost. The process is hassle-free for me and my veterinarian. After the initial exam, there is no excessive paperwork or pre-approvals. It's as simple as uploading a PDF or photo of the invoice and waiting for the reimbursement check to come in the mail, which I‚Äôve usually received within 7 to 10 days. I've only had two occasions where I've needed to contact customer service at Healthy Paws and both times I was met with courteous and knowledgeable representatives who answered my questions and concerns. I can't speak to everyone‚Äôs experience and circumstances, but if you read the fine print and know what your policy includes, then there should be no surprises.

text:
they have raised their rates TWICE now since I've been with them. in les than 4 years. 

One of my six cat-children gets chronic UTIs and is prescribed orbax and then acepromazine, amitriptyline, or valium 9usually valium because the results are immediately and he will go pee without straining or crying) to relax his urethra from spasm so he can pee. My doctor has written a note I have to send to HealthyPaws EVERY TIME he goes thru a UTI. Could the put it in my fiel? Heck yes. Do they? heck no! Being that it's chronic and ideopathic this is frequent, other than booster shots and checkups that is suually why he goes to the doctor. But because valium and amitriptyline are also used as "behavioural" drugs HP won't cover it without a struggle. What behaviour am I trying to alter other than a  blocked urethra that cost 550$ at the emergency vet (over an hour away) for overnight sedation and catherization then $300 at my regular vet for followup the next day? The kicker is the valium is a controlled substance so the doctor gives me only 8 pills (he takes half). It's FIVE FLIPPING DOLLARS. The ace is $7, and I get a month supply amitripyline for under $10. So they are just nickel and diming a covered expense. So a claim that is $0 for exam+60 for liquid orbax OR $30 for tablets+$5 for valium+$25 for onsior ($100~$130) VS blockage that would cost $850 <--cathertization only, not emegerncy surgery

they find every way they can to NOT cover expenses then haev the gall to raise rates twice,

The cats that aren't dinged with "preexisting condtions" I will move before the rates go up. To raise rates during a pandemic. HealthyPaws are lowlifes.

text:
HANDS DOWN, THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE I'VE EVER EXPERIENCED.

After the first year, my premium was increased 12%. After the second year, they attempted to raise it ANOTHER 20% above that. I declined and wanted to cancel before the increase started (I was given roughly six weeks‚Äô notice to the increase).

I spoke to a customer service agent, and was given the deadline I needed to cancel by. I called and canceled on that date because I wanted the full (paid) coverage in case something happened with my pet before the premium increased.

It turns out I should've been given the day before, as THAT date was day 1 of the new billing cycle, when they'd charge my credit card with the 20% increase.

I'm six weeks into trying to get my refund, and it still has not even been looked at by their Operations Dept. "They're very busy" is the excuse I'm giving each time I call for an update, which is weekly.

With each call, I get ten apologies (right off their script), but no closer to resolution. Absolutely pitiful service, based on information their employee gave me. It's clear no one with authority is in a rush to make this right and refund the charge. I'm held hostage by Healthy Paws. Thank God my rent, mortgage, groceries, utilities, etc aren't dependent on those funds (MY FUNDS) being available to me.
title: THE WORST!!

text: I cannot say enough good things about Healthy Paws! I have been with them since 2015 and they have helped with surgeries, x rays, therapies and more! Thank you Healthy Paws!!!
title: I Love Healthy Paws!!!

text: Based on advice from a friend, we have had insurance for our pup Anabel since we adopted her almost 6 years ago. We initially had coverage with Pets Best, and though we had no complaints about them, we never filed a claim, so didn't test their system. After a couple of years, we changed to Healthy Paws because they have no claim limits and we felt that if we needed to file a claim, there was a good chance it would be a big one. Anabel is very active and spends a lot of time hiking with us (typically at least 50 miles per week). We recently filed our first claim, and, as we expected, it was a doozy! Anabel was bitten by a neurotoxic rattlesnake and the antivenin she needed came to more than $10,000 - our total claim was over $13,000. She was extremely lucky on several accounts and has made a full recovery. Although we would have paid for the treatment regardless, we were extremely appreciative that Healthy Paws covered all of the antivenin and processed our claim so quickly. Even though this was our first claim, which requires submitting her full medical history since coverage started, the process was very simple and the review times were extremely fast. I think we had confirmation of claim approval within a day or two of submitting all the required info, and we received the check in the mail within a week (probably would have been even faster with direct deposit). Although the premiums may seem high, it is absolutely worth it.  Thank you Healthy Paws!
title: Excellent coverage and claim process

text: I am so happy with Healthy Paws! I looked around for the best pet insurance company when we got a new puppy 6 years ago. I had another insurance company for my older dog, but wanted to see what other companies were available for our new guy. Healthy Paws was ranked number one for ease, reimbursements, etc. I took the advice and opened a policy with them. I have been supremely impressed for those 6 years. The claims process is the extremely quick and easy (less than 1 minute to click a few boxes and snap a picture of the invoice). text: Our four year old golden retriever developed frightening body tremors last week. text: My cat has been insured by Healthy Paws since she was a kitten, for almost 10 years now. When our monthly premium increased a substantial amount this year (from $34 to $61), I strongly considered canceling her policy because I was so frustrated with the huge jump in cost. I took more time to think about it and realized that I had never had a bad experience with them otherwise, and that my cat was more likely to need costly medical care as she got older, so I stuck with the policy. THANK GOODNESS I STUCK WITH THE POLICY. A few months after the increase, my cat developed an obstruction that required emergency surgery to remove, then she developed severe sepsis following the surgery and almost died. She spent almost three weeks in the ICU and required a second surgery to remove dead tissue that the infection killed. We NEVER would have been able to afford this level of care for our cat without Healthy Paws. Even though I knew she was absolutely covered under her policy for these events, I still called several times to check in and was always reassured that was the case. When she was discharged from the hospital, I submitted a claim to Healthy Paws for $18,846; they reimbursed me $16,961 (90%, and I had already met my $100 deductible earlier in the year) via direct deposit EIGHT BUSINESS DAYS LATER. They even sent me a few follow up emails to see how my cat was doing with her recovery. While I can understand the gripes about the monthly premium increase, I don't understand the complaints about anything else. When I called, I was never on hold for longer than 10 minutes, and was often connected to someone after a few rings. I understood my policy back and front and knew that Healthy Paws would cover what had happened. Because of Healthy Paws, we were able to say YES to everything that would provide our cat with the best possible care at the only facility in our state that has a Vet who is board certified in Critical Care. Our cat is now home and improving rapidly every day. We're so incredibly grateful that we had Healthy Paws on our side, and we're telling everyone we know about it. Thank you, Healthy Paws!
title: We owe our cat's life to Healthy Paws!

text: We've had Healthy Paws for 6+ years now and they've exceeded our expectations for covering our two miniature dachshunds, Frieda & Dori. The surgery was successful and Frieda is happy at home now after a week in the emergency hospital.  Healthy Paws was great and covered the expenses (90% in our case after exam co-pays). text:

He wound up getting bounced from ER to vet to ultimately needing emergency eye surgery, and less than 24 hours later, we were faced with a $7,500 bill to save his poor little eye. text: We have an 11 year old pure bred black lab that i got as a puppy in 2009.  At that time, I immediately picked up pet insurance from a different company, but I believe Healthy Paws started back in 2009 as well, though i didn't know about them at the time (unfortunately).  I started with Healthy Paws in June of 2017 after cancelling my previous pet insurance due to tripling rates for no apparent reason.  Since we started at Healthy Paws late in the game with our fur baby, she fortunately did not have very many health issues, but in 2019 she was diagnosed with both a high grade lymphoma and an anal sac adenocarcinoma.  Ultimately, over the last year, we've spent roughly $28,000 on cancer treatments and Healthy Paws was able to cover over $19,000 of that, which is phenomenal.  We're not rich by any means and have no children, but our labby is our child and had they not helped us with the bills, we would have still payed it.  Over the years, customer service has also been great and very responsive.  Our rates have been increased once or twice or the life of our policy, but I can't say enough  good things about Healthy Paws and would recommend them to my closest friends and family.
title: Not my first, but by far the best pet insurance i've had

text:
I have had other pet insurance in the past with previous dogs and it wasn't worth the money. There was a per occurrence deductible and then they wouldn't allow anywhere near what the vet charged! 

With my dog Bindi, I did more research and found HealthyPaws Pet Insurance. This works just like people health insurance! Choose your annual deductible and coverage to get the coverage and monthly payments that work best for you. We opted for the $500 annual deductible at 90% coverage. It paid off in a big way! My girl decided to chase a cat and ran through a barbed wire fence to get at it. She tore open her chest, a 4" laceration with a flap of skin hanging down. It took a visit to the ER and surgery to sew her back up again plus all the meds that go along with it. Filing the claim was so easy. I simply uploaded the vet bill to their website. No forms to fill out, no questions. Within 10 days I had my check! I was floored. Then a week later my girl woke up vomiting blood. Back to the ER where they ran bloodwork and took an Xray. Nothing was found. All they could do was send her home with more meds and a special diet and hope the vomiting would stop. Thankfully, it did. Again, uploaded my vet bill and within one week I had my check. I cannot believe how easy it is. Not only that, but I received and email form Leslie in their customer care department wanting to know how Bindi was doing. Floored!

I can't say enough good things about this company!!!

text: I selected Healthy Paws for my dog Sage in 2017 after we got her. My biggest concern in adopting a pet was affording those random emergencies or injuries that can pop up out of nowhere. I chose Healthy Paws based on the fact I saw it had #1 ratings on consumer websites, the premiums were affordable, and there was no limit on reimbursement. Earlier this month Sage started exhibiting pain, and we couldn't figure out from where, or why. We brought her to the emergency vet, and 2 nights, x rays, an mri, a spinal tap and countless pain management medications later, we had no answers, but had a bill for $5,400. I was equally relieved and nervous about the fact we had pet insurance. I was relieved at the prospect of being reimbursed for part of the bill, but I was extremely nervous that I was about to find out that I had been paying for a scam all this time, and that they wold find a way to reject our claim. My husband and I are attorneys, so skepticism is our nature, and we know all too well that contracts typically are designed to protect the company rather than the consumer. We are especially skeptical of anything that is supposed to pay us money, especially considering that our claim was approx. 4x what we had paid in premiums so far. But I worried for nothing. Less than a month after submitting the claim I got a check in the mail for exactly what I expected they would cover (80% of the bill, minus our $250 deductible, excluding the initial emergency exam and her 2 week exam). I called customer service very anxiously several times during the pendeancy of the claim to make sure I was uploading the documentation they needed, etc, and every time I waited less than 5 minutes to speak with someone, and the representative was always kind, patient and professional. I am thankful that I chose Healthy Paws to insure my pets- after all, it saved me almost $4,000.
title: Select Healthy Paws

title: Excellent Coverage!

text:
I recently posted this review on Yelp and wanted to share it here:

It is highly recommended you get some type of pet insurance for your dog or cat. Yes, it is a monthly expense that is not cheap. Think of it as giving you peace of mind and hopefully you never have to use it.

My 4.5 year old dog was recently diagnosed with lymphoma and hearing this from our vet was gut-wrenching. We immediately took him to the oncologist who said it is treatable and then told us chemotherapy will cost over $10,000. We told the vet to do whatever it takes to get him healthy.

Having Healthy Paws Insurance gave us one less thing to worry about; i.e. the cost of the medical care for my dog. My dog is getting treated weekly and the bill is from $500 - $800 per week depending upon the treatment that week. Healthy Paws has never declined a claim. In fact, they even send me emails checking up and seeing how my dog is doing. 

Here is the process with Healthy Paws I go through to file my claims:

1) Each Thursday, my dog gets his chemotherapy treatment. Our vet then emails us the invoice and medical notes. I then file a claim on the Healthy Paws web site and upload the receipts which literally takes LESS THAN ONE MINUTE - it is a VERY easy and efficient process.

2) I immediately receive an acknowledgement email that it will be processed within (48) hours.

3) By Friday or Monday, I receive an email that the claim has been processed.

4) By Monday or Tuesday, the money is wired into my checking account.

I promise you I am not exaggerating. This is how quickly they process the claim and pay you back.

My advice to you - I hope you never need it but if you are going to get pet insurance, BUY HEALTHY PAWS. It is one of the few pet insurances that has no lifetime maximum and you can see from my description above it will allow you to get your dog or cat the best medical care possible.
title: Buy Healthy Paws Insurance

text:
Our golden retriever had a very scary experience that spanned a couple of weeks when she suffered a urinary tract infection and bladder stones, one of which became lodged in her urethra and could not be dislodged.  In the end, she went through bladder surgery, an ultrasound, a laser procedure, and multiple x-rays.  She required a specialist vet in another state and a six-day hospital stay.  When totaled up, the vet bills reached the low five figures.

We submitted the bills online to Healthy Paws, which subtracted the deductible and the copay and a few other minor items (prescription dog food, for example).  A couple of weeks later, we received our checks.  It may have been the easiest insurance claim I've ever filed in my life in spite of the fact that it was for a large amount.  

Our girl is doing well now, and I'm grateful both for the wonderful care she received from her vets and for the coverage she had with Healthy Paws.  As each successive vet told me it would cost yet another $$$$ for the next procedure, I would have despaired if I hadn't been able to think "We have pet insurance, it will be OK." text: I decided to get pet insurance when my dog Banksy was a puppy because I wasn't sure I'd be able to afford it if anything happened to him.  As I got older and more financially stable, I figured I wouldn't need pet insurance for any future pets.  But then my awesome Rhodesian Ridgeback, Banksy, got a freak bacterial infection of the liver at the age of 8, just a few weeks ago.  It was very sudden and he got sick fast and we took him to the emergency vet, where he ended up staying for 3 days.  His health was declining rapidly and the vet said that a biopsy of the liver would be the best course of action to try to identify what was wrong with him and give him the correct treatment.  As she was rattling off the options and costs, she said the surgery (best option) would be $12,000-$15,000.  In that moment my heart sank because it was so much money and we probably wouldn't make that choice.  But then I remembered I had pet insurance and it was a huge relief. We went forward with the surgery, but sadly the infection had gone too far and wasn't treatable.  We had to say goodbye to our Banksy dog very suddenly. One of the only things that gave me comfort during such a sad time was knowing that we did everything we could for him.  If we didn't have insurance, we wouldn't have been able to give him all of the options and I would have always been wondering if we could have done more.  His total bill was $16,000 and Healthy Paws covered 80%. It was super easy to file the claim, and the check was in the mail within a week.  I will always have Healthy Paws insurance from now on, in hopes that I will never need to use it.  And if I'm lucky enough to not use it, I will be happy knowing that my monthly payment might go towards covering another pet and giving their owner peace of mind that they too could do everything possible for their fur baby.
title: Fur-ever customer

text: After paying very high fees for three years without a single claim, they suddenly raised my rates to a much higher fee. They seem to wait till your pet starts to age, and raise the rates to ridiculous amounts because its hard to get new insurance as dogs age. Even if you cancel, they received fees for the healthiest years of a pets life, and waved bye as your pet becomes higher risk. I had to cancel.
title: Expensive to start.., and only gets worse.

text:
Healthy paws will continue to raise your rates over the life of your pet until it is almost unaffordable.  They don't raise it in the first couple years but by the time your pet gets older and it would be hard to switch companies especially if there are any underlying health issues the rates start to increase substantially. 

I have been a customer for almost 10 years.  My monthly premium started out at $39 a month, now I am paying $130 and my deductible doubled without them notifying me.  

They do make it easy to submit a claim, but more often then not when I have submitted a claim, I have had to call customer service to sort things out because they didn't pay me what I was entitled or they needed more medical records. 

This company seems good at first but don't be fooled, they will get you in the end.
title: Don't be fooled by the initial rate, they will get you in the end.

text: We have been with Healthy Paws for several years covering our two dogs, Earl and Eddie. Earl recently was in and out of the hospital for two months culminating in a diagnosis of acute leukemia and his eventual passing. They covered over $8,000 of vet bills for Earl in his final months and did not nickel-and-dime us at all. Healthy Paws likely has a lifetime customer. Thank you!
title: A relief during hard times

text: My puppy, Loki, is a rescue. He has been given the best vet care, food, and even had calcium supplements as a young pup to make up for anything he had been lacking in his diet before his rescue.  He started attending puppy Pre-K at 10 weeks and eventually worked his way up and earned his AKC partner canine good citizen certificate at 8 months of age. Around his nine months mark however, he started limping.  I put him on crate rest and the limping got a little better and then a whole lot worse. I brought my baby beefcake in to see our vet.  Loki had a partial tear of his left acl and needed to have surgery that included  a plate and screws.  He was on crate rest for 12 weeks and then slowly started going on leash walks. Finally he was able to be a normal dog again and BAM he tore the acl in his right leg and once again needed surgery.  Without Healthy Paws I just don't know how I could have taken care of him and had both surgeries done. The surgeries and testing have totalled close to $9,000 so far.  Healthy Paws was there, and contknues to be there, to answer any questions I have.  They have taken care of processing each if Loki's claims within 24-48 hours. Loki's joint supplements have been covered as well.  The representatives at Healthy Paws have even sent messages checking on Loki to see how he's healing up. What insurance company does that?  They have helped to relieve so much worry and stress which has allowed me to focus on doing what I need to in order for my Loki to get well and get back to being the gentle playful big boy he is. Would I recommend them?? ABSOLUTELY ... and I have to friends, coworkers, family and strangers.  Thank you Healthy Paws for treating my baby beefcake like he's yours!
title: Loki needed two ACL surgeries and Healthy Paws was there for us!

Customer service was great. We emailed them to check on the status of our claim and they replied within a day or two. They also asked how our cat was doing after the claim was finalized.

text: I highly recommend Healthy Paws pet insurance. I took out insurance on a healthy 3 year old adopted dog from the local Humane Society. A few months after I adopted him, it became apparent that he had significant seasonal allergies and was started on allergy immunotherapy (not Cytopoint or steroids) but actual immunotherapy). Healthy Paws covered the testing, immunotherapy and medications at my initial 90/10 plan rate later I changed to the 80/20 plan.He had a ‚Äúnormal‚Äù annual physical exam in March of 2020 but in April he was diagnosed with a bleeding ulcer and IBD which is apparently similar to Crohn‚Äôs in humans. I can say that the cost of emergency care at a University small animal hospital, diagnostic workup, surgery and prolonged care including around the clock tube feedings and medications at home as well as local follow up visits/labs, chronic medications etc is enormous. And no one wants to be faced with the heart breaking decision to euthanize a pet/family member due to inability to pay for medical care. So far, Healthy Paws has continued to cover the expenses at my plan rate. It is extremely easy to submit a claim, just take a picture of the paid invoice and upload it to HP through their APP. The claims are handled in a timely manner and I have had no significant problems. Occasionally they will need ‚Äúfurther documentation‚Äù and that can be obtained by having the institution send documentation to HP or I am able to send it by email. When you are caring for an animal on an around the clock basis, you really don‚Äôt have time to manage tedious claims, etc and HP makes it as easy as possible to do so.

text:
When you get quotes from pet insurance companies Healthy Paws will stand out and look affordable and like it's the best deal you can get.
Policies can start at $35+/month.
What they don't explain or state anywhere is how much that premium will increase year over year. How convenient.
In your second year your premium will increase 15%-20%. So factor that into your math when you look at getting the policy with them in the first place.

As others have stated they won't even notify you that this increase has taken place. You will just see that higher number charged to your card without warning.
My plan increased by 16% and this is only my second year with Healthy Paws.
Can't imagine how much it will increase next year.

Again, as I've read in other reviews here, when you ask them they will respond with a canned answer that the premium increase is because of the state you're in or that pet policies in general are "getting more expensive."
It's seriously a bunch of BS.
Just an excuse to steal your money.
Deceptive company who doesn't care about your pets. They just care about getting your money and tricking you.

They get you in on an "affordable" number/cost, then gauge you every year after that.

Here's an example of what this insurance would cost over a 10-year period, based on a premium of $51 (90% reimbursement), + an increase of 15%/year And that is likely on the very low end of what your actual increase will be. It could be an increase of 20% every year based on the other reviews I've seen here.

Monthly cost + 15% increase
----------------
Year 1	$51.00
Year 2	$58.65
Year 3	$67.45
Year 4	$77.56
Year 5	$89.20
Year 6	$102.58
Year 7	$117.97
Year 8	$135.66
Year 9	$156.01
Year 10 $179.41

Annual cost + 15% increase
----------------
Year 1	$612.00
Year 2	$703.80
Year 3	$809.37
Year 4	$930.78
Year 5	$1,070.39
Year 6	$1,230.95
Year 7	$1,415.59
Year 8	$1,627.93
Year 9	$1,872.12
Year 10$2,152.94

Lifetime cost: $12,425.88

TWELVE THOUSAND DOLLARS.
That's $12k that could go towards any accident that you are worried will happen during your pet's lifetime.

Be informed and don't trust Healthy Paws and their BS.

text: Five weeks ago, our 10 year-old Springer tore her rear knee ACL so badly it disconnected. She needed reconstruction surgery. We were incredibly stressed about her safety, our ability to care for her when she came home, and also the cost. It has been so much easier than we expected, largely because of Healthy Paws Health Insurance. When I called them to check coverage, they assured me that unless it was a pre-existing condition, there would be no problem. They told us not to worry, that Healthy Paws was there to relieve us of stress, not increase it. Since our girl has been insured since she was less than a year old we were relieved. The surgery was expensive, and we were reimbursed exactly as we hoped, within days of submitting the bills. We have enjoyed their efficiency and courtesy for ten years of mostly mundane and minor health issues (foxtails, UTI infections, allergies...) Their processing system is extremely streamlined and user friendly. We find their newsletters informational. And their customer service all these years has convinced us that they actually care about our girl. They have never let us down, but this time they really had our backs - and we deeply appreciate it. If you are thinking of getting pet insurance, look no further than Healthy Paws.
title: Efficient, Honest and Caring

text:
In 2014 I purchased Healthy Paws Pet Insurance shortly after I adopted my female border collie, C.C.  Very shortly afterward, C.C. became so sick with vomiting, bleeding and appetite loss, and I remember saying to her, ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt worry, C.C. I‚Äôm not going to give up on you and we are going to figure out what is wrong and make you better.‚Äù  After numerous and expensive tests, she was diagnosed with Inflammatory Bowel Disease and we were able to control the IBD and she was her beautiful happy self again.  

Then, in December 2018 she was diagnosed with cancer of the liver and spleen.  The vet gave me terrible news that typically even with treatment, most dogs with this type of cancer only live 4-6 months, and the treatments are $3k/month.  C.C. was only seven years old, and I was terrified of losing her.  Thanks to her Healthy Paws pet policy, I had the option to treat her with chemotherapy, otherwise, she would never have had this chance, and I would have had to put her down in January, 2019.  A year and a half later (which is a long time for a dog), C.C. is still with us and her cancer is in remission.  I would have never been able to afford the treatments on my own, but Healthy Paws made it possible to keep my promise to C.C. that I was not going to give up on her.  Additionally, taking the financial strain out of the stress of taking care of a sick pet was so incredibly helpful.  To date, Healthy Paws has paid all 108 of C.C.‚Äôs claims. (I also have another policy for C.C.‚Äôs brother, Pirate, but after 4 years, he still has no claims.  Good Dog!) 

Every once in a while, I get a little note from Healthy Paws asking how C.C. is doing, and I am so happy to report that she turned 9 in January and is still doing well.  I asked if I was in jeopardy of having our policy canceled, and the response was, ‚ÄúNope! As long as you pay your premiums, we will keep paying the claims!‚Äù  Every claim I submit has been processed, and I usually have the money back in my account within a week.  C.C's oncologist also has a Healthy Paws policy for her dog.  She told me she tells other pet parents about C.C.'s good news story whenever they ask her opinion on purchasing pet insurance.

I thank God every day that C.C. is still with us, and I thank Healthy Paws for allowing me to afford the care of my pets.  The world is definitely a better place with them in it.
title: Thank God for Healthy Paws!

text: Third time was a charm!  The first two pet insurance companies that I tried were such a hassle to deal with.  Healthy Paws makes it so easy! text:
We ‚ù§ Healthy Paws and our Paws & Claws Protectors!

I should let you know, I am a 3 1/2 year old She-Puppy who is called BeePop a LuLu, BeeBop, Baby and many other terms of endearment.¬†¬†

In my house, (and, YES!¬† It is MY house!) there is also a He-puppy.¬†

We are sighthounds.¬†¬†

By nature, if we catch sight of an insect, we chase it; and naturally. . . want to devour it.¬† Mmmm. . . Yummy (I think, maybe.¬† Hmm, don't know really, just like catching things.)

One beautiful sunshiny summer day, I did just that!¬† I ate a bee right AFTER it stung me. (Yeah, I know.¬† Bees are good for the ecological system.¬† I get that.¬† Really, I do!)¬†

Unbeknownst¬† to me and my people, I am allergic to bees.¬† Immediately after the bee stung me, I cried out, vomited and had diarrhea simultaneously, and collapsed to the kitchen floor.¬† We made it to the Pet Emergency in under 15 minutes, with one calm and one ballistic humans carrying me into the Pet ER, my head lolling to the side with my eyes rolled back, and shallowly breathing.¬† ¬†I was diagnosed with anaphylactic shock due to bee sting. Thankfully, I recovered.¬†¬†

Recently, my He-puppy (He is MY puppy!) broke his leg, which has been a devastating and traumatic experience for our entire household. He-puppy had to go to the Pet Emergency, too, and also had to have surgery on his leg.¬† Really scary stuff!

During both incidents, my humans paid the bills and later submitted the insurance claims on-line to Healthy Paws.¬†¬†

The on-line claims process is streamlined, quick, and efficient; and, the entire claims process from beginning to end was completed within a few weeks.¬†¬†

As a result of this efficiency, my people were able to focus on our recovery, rather than the additional anxiety of completing tons of forms and repeat follow-up conversations with customer service representatives.¬†¬†

Truly, a blessing.¬†

In addition, our Paws & Claws Protectors had genuine concern for both of our health & recovery and communicated with my people especially about us.¬† Yep!¬† They know me by name, too.¬† Pretty Pawsome!

This made our people very happy.¬†¬†

Some people on the planet do not understand fur babies are absorbed into their human family's pack as members.¬†

It is not a "them" and "us," rather it is a "WE" and "OUR FAMILY."¬† The Healthy Paws and the Paws & Claws Protectors get it!¬† They understand we are essential members in our family -- OUR PACK!¬† Both He-puppy and I recommend Healthy Paws to other fur babies and their people.¬†¬†

Our people said to tell you, "The¬†Healthy Paws'¬†high quality service & customer care are worth the investment!"¬†¬†

Truly fantastic!

text:
I have had Healthy Paws for four years now. I have never had to use it extensively until now. My dog had a cancerous tumor and recurring UTIs. Over the course of three months, she wracked up $2,000 in medical bills. This insurance has covered most of it. I think I ultimately paid $800 out of pocket in order to reach my deductible. Now that I have hit my deductible, I no longer worry about the cost of treatment. I can focus on getting her whatever care she needs. It is such a relief to have pet insurance at this time. 

I paid about $30/month for four years. Even if I had stashed all that money into savings, it would not have been able to cover my dog's medical expenses over the past three months. Plus, having insurance gives me peace of mind that I can give my dog whatever care she needs going forward.  It has even changed the conversations I have with my vet around her care. Knowing I can spend the money for chemotherapy, drugs and surgeries means we can try treatments that give her a better chance of going into cancer remission. 

My claims are usually reviewed within a day, and refunds are issued within five days, but often sooner than that. I have never had an issue getting them to cover medical expenses.  Filing a claim is easy. I just send them a picture of my bill through the mobile app. I honestly could not be happier with this insurance company. 

I did a lot of research before choosing a pet insurance. I know some companies are willing to take your money each month and then not cover procedures that they should. I am so happy I went with Healthy Paws. I tell all my friends with pets that pet insurance is a worthwhile investment.
title: Easy to file claims, easy to get reimbursed

text:

ALL THE TIME, all the bills were promptly refunded or refunded  to UC Davis.  I am grateful to healthy paws, they treat me with respect and care for my dogs.

Annya died and she was 13 years and a half, but she has the very best care, and eating fresh meals prepared by me.   Belen is alive and drs seems to think is miracle dog.

text:
EDIT 7/5/2020
I have to say I am very disappointed that HealthyPaws decided to bump up my premiums, possibly in response to my filling the numerous claims. I input my pets' exact ages and breed information to get a quote, and it was $40 lower than what they are trying to charge me now. I tried browsing their website to see anything about premiums rising in response to claims, but the FAQ just has a generic 'premiums will rise due to advances in technology'. So I am sad to say they apparently do not reward customer loyalty in the slightest. Unfortunately my cat now has a pre-existing condition precluding her from finding new insurance, but I will be shopping around for my other pets and I simply cannot afford the premiums even set at the lower reimbursement percentage. I have sent them an email and expect some unhelpful platitudes in response.

Original:
I have Healthy Paws insurance for all 3 of my animals. Only last year did I have to actually file a claim, and since then I am not sure what I would have done without them. My cat went into heart failure and was diagnosed with a progressive heart disease requiring daily medications, blood work every 3 months, and repeat echocardiograms. None of that is cheap but it is necessary to give my cat the best chance at a comfortable life for as long as possible. 

I submitted my first claim after owning her for 4 years so there was a lot of medical records to go through. It took roughly a week to review and have my first claim approved, but the company kept in touch and kept me updated on the progress. I had to call once to clarify a discrepancy with the medical record but it was quickly cleared up. After that, it was so easy to take a picture of my invoices and submit a claim on my phone via the app. Reimbursement would arrive within days directly in my bank account. 

I absolutely recommend Healthy Paws to anyone interested in pet insurance (and I highly recommend pet insurance in general!). They have been so incredibly helpful and quick to respond, and they have made the whole process super efficient. I am so grateful that I don't have to worry about whether I can afford lifesaving care for my pet thanks to them.
title: Excellent pet insurance! Everything has been quick and easy. I would not have been able to afford ongoing treatment for my cat without them.

text: As proud parents of 6 young Brussels Griffons, we have found Healthy Paws Insurance to be an exceptionally great fit for our family. Think again: his monthly premium was only slightly higher than the youngsters. His deductible and co-pay was a little more, but quickly doing the math, it was still a fantastic value. text: I cannot say enough about how great Healthy Paws is. Our 3-year-old malamute mix suffered a traumatic hyper-extension injury to his left wrist. The repair involved two surgeries, endless medications for pain and sedation, multiple casts and x-rays, and intensive physical therapy over more than 6 months and Healthy Paws has supported us unequivocally, paying every reimbursement promptly and checking in on our dog's progress to make sure we're all doing well. I am so grateful for their help. We could absolutely not have afforded to do this without them and our guy would have probably lost the leg. Healthy Paws is frankly better than any health insurance I or my pets have ever had, and I will never use another company again. Thanks to Healthy Paws for my healthy pup.
title: Best Pet Insurance - We are so grateful for them!

text:
I got Healthy Paws for my puppy the day after I brought him home. The day after the waiting period was over, he got bloat at 3 months old (highly unusual). I definitely did not expect him to get bloat at such a young age (or have any health issues) and had considered waiting to put him on the insurance. Once I got the 6000+ vet bill I was over the moon I had gotten it. My plan was for 80% coverage (different options for this), so I had to pay my $250 deductible, the vet consultation (not covered but this usually is never a lot, $144 out of my $6000 bill), and 20% of the total bill. Very fair in my opinion. 


It took a few weeks for me to be reimbursed (I‚Äôve heard it‚Äôs usually faster but I think with Covid-19 it might have taken some more time). Everyone was so nice, helpful and knew exactly what was going on each time I called. They received and reviewed my documents in a timely manner. 


I initially chose healthy paws because they cover all congenital and hereditary conditions (some insurances have limitations or charge more for that) and are affordable. I figured this was most important because you never know what might happen that would be deemed hereditary and could require a big surgery and then not be covered. 


I was hesitant to even get pet insurance because I know a lot of times you end up not needing it. I‚Äôve read a lot of opinions saying you could just as easily set aside the monthly payment in savings and you‚Äôll still have the money if you don‚Äôt need it. Accidents/surgeries can easily cost over $10k. In my case, I pay about $50 a month. It would take me ten YEARS to have saved up $6000 for my puppies surgery if I set aside $50 a month. 


My experience with healthy paws has been excellent and I highly recommend them. I did extensive research trying to find the best insurance company (I know it can be exhausting trying to compare so many) and am very happy with my decision!

text: Our 4 yr old Golden Retriever, Laika, had a walnut-sized lump removed from her chest on Jan. 30th, that I was worried about . . . it had been aspirated earlier, and tests showed that it was okay. But, I just didn't feel good about leaving it there. I pushed for surgery to remove it - it showed that the lump was malignant Subcutaneous Hemangiosarcoma. I thank God that it was removed  before it spread to her organs - once it reaches their organs, there is no hope!   Healthy Paws was right there with us -covered all of the surgery, meds, etc.  One month later, we went to the oncologist to have xrays and an abdominal ultrasound - once again, Healthy Paws covered these tests, which were clear!  We'll need to stay vigilant in checking on this horrible form of cancer via regular testing for Laika, and we are so very grateful that Healthy Paws is with us.  We would be lost without the insurance coverage we purchased from them, and their support! Thank you Healthy Paws!

text:
After researching Pet Insurance companies and asking around to my friends, I decided on Healthy Paws Pet Insurance for my adopted rescue dog-Harry. Six months after adoption, when Harry was just under 2 years old, I went on a cruise. While at sea (with no wifi or internet), and Harry with a pet sitter, he ingested things he should not have while she was at work. After excessive vomiting and diarrhea, she contacted my daughter who rushed him to the vet, and then on to the vet hospital. After emergency surgery, the vet bills came to over $3,900.00.

I got home from the cruise to these insurmountable bills. 

I contacted Healthy Paws immediately, first through my app, and then via email. They asked for copies of the bills and a history of his vet visits (have this at hand) which weren't many for Harry as I only had him a month. I spoke with their rep on the phone once and he was understanding and helpful in explaining my benefits.

Within 7 business days, I received a check paying 80% of the vet bills (minus my deductible and the $40 initial vet visit which is not covered in your insurance). Thanks to the vet for saving Harry's life! Thanks to Healthy Paws for making it possible for me to be able to afford to save my dog's life!

text: Our dog Seaver managed to ingest a toxin on a hike off-leash, she was vomiting and shaking, it was terrifying.  We needed to get her medical attention immediately.  We were quoted a price of $1800-$2600 from the hospital. Even with insurance, we weren't sure if most would be covered or if we'd have to wait a long time for reimbursement. I called our insurance company, Healthy Paws, on that Sunday and they assured me all would be fine. Seaver spent overnight at the hospital. It was a very nerve-wracking night but lucky for us she pulled through. Left with a $2600 bill on my credit card I submitted my claim online, to Healthy Paws. It was simple and within 2 days my claim was processed and I received a check in the mail 5 days later for the full amt. less $151.00 for the exam and my deductible. We could not be more grateful to the Healthy Paws team for their coverage and quick response to our dog's medical bills.  If you are on the fence about getting insurance I highly recommend it and getting it through Healthy Paws. Vets are seeing more pets coming in each day after consuming marijuana or worse.  This single event would have been detrimental to us financially. Having the peace of mind that we were able to get Seaver the best care during this very scary event was an absolute Godsend!

title: HEALTHY PAWS

text:
3/1/20
I'm updating this review in response to the Healthy Paw reply to my original review. Their reply evades the entire well documented issue noted in my review and by numerous other reviews here and elsewhere, that Healthy Paws repeatedly loses/misplaces/ignores records submitted by policy holders. Instead of addressing this issue, Healthy Paws attempts to pass the buck and lay it on vet offices and pet owners. Hey Healthy Paws- re-read my review: I am clear that there was NO issue with records being released by the vet- the ONLY problem was YOUR company claiming non-receipt. 
Instead of doing damage control, how about just processing the records??

They reel you in, get you stuck, and then ignore you. My dog has been enrolled since 2017. Every year the premium increases. Every time I move, the premium increases. Yet Healthy Paws has cut their phone hours for claims (though not their phone hours for new enrollment), does not answer inquiries sent via their online system, and provides no direct email address to reach them.
The first year my dog was enrolled, Healthy Paws repeatedly claimed they had not received my dog's initial medical records, though my vet and I had both faxed and emailed the records multiple times. At one point a rep told me that they get so many faxes that they can't go through them all, so we were expected to keep sending the records until Healthy Paws got around to reading them. Unknown what they do with all the faxes they can't seem to review. Vet staff always roll their eyes when I tell them the insurance we have. Every vet office we've visited has stated they've heard of the problems with Healthy Paws, most prevalent being the company denying claims because they say they haven't received the animal's medical records. It doesn't matter if you fax them, email them, or upload them on the app, you will likely not hear anything from Healthy Paws on your claim until you call them to ask what is going on, at which point they'll probably say they never got the records. Refer them to the email/fax/upload, and they'll simply say it never came through.
The worst part is that once you sign up with them and make a claim, it is nearly impossible to switch insurance providers, as your animal will then have a "pre-existing" condition. Doesn't really matter the reason for the claim, insurance will still find some tenuous and medically improbable connection between a pet's former injury or illness and a future condition. Your dog broke a nail off when he was 6 months old? Well that respiratory infection he now has at age 8 is undoubtedly the result of a bacteria that entered his bloodstream through the nail cut 7.5 years ago...at least that's the logic used by insurance companies, including Healthy Paws.
Has Healthy Paws reimbursed me for some of my dog's medical claims? Yes. Would I recommend this company? Only if you have an animal that you think is likely to end up with some kind of major injury, and you can afford $50+ per month for the life of your pet, and know that monthly premium will increase every year and every time you change your address.
Keep in mind that they only cover a percentage of PROCEDURES, MEDICATIONS, and DIAGNOSTICS. And only AFTER your deductible is fully met. And the way they calculate that is by applying the deductible to the percentage of the initial claim they would have covered once the deductible is met. In other words, if you have 80% coverage and $250 deductible, and you go in for a procedure that is $500, including a $80 office visit, they first take off the $80 (not covered), then they apply the 80% coverage to the remaining $420 bill ($336), and THEN they apply the $250 deductible.  $336-250 - $86. That's right, of the $500 visit, you will get reimbursed $86. Sounds alot more like 20% coverage than 80% coverage, right?
The only way this pays for itself is if your animal has a BIG bill, or more than one major expense after the deductible is met. 
You've been warned.
title: Think long and hard before signing up.

text: Do not recommend.  While employees are pleasant and claims process fairly smooth, Healthy Paws' definition of "deductible" is inconsistent with what one commonly associates with the term in the insurance industry.  They carefully define "deductible" in the policy to be the amount one must first pay AFTER your pet's coinsurance portion is applied";  thus your out-of-pocket spend is not 100% counted towards the deductible amount.  For example, if you have if have a deductible of $750 with a reimbursement amount of 60%, in fact you must spend $1,250 ($750/.60) before reimbursement potentially kicks in.  They multiply the percentage of reimbursement times your out of pocket and consider that amount towards the deductible;  e.g., 60% x $1,000 (out of pocket) = $600 towards annual deductible.  There are no disclosures making this clear.  I never would have purchased the policy had this been more clear to me.  After submitting only two claims, they raised my rates.  Very questionable business practices.  I have since switched insurers with even better rates!
title: Strongly do not recommend;  understand their calculation of "deductible" before purchasing.
