title: Thank you, Healthy Paws!

text:
Healthy Paws Pet Insurance has been a great blessing to us. We purchased our dream kitten from Russia, and we immediately had all the health checks done and obtained accident and illness insurance from Healthy Paws.  As they say, everything can change in an instant, our ‚ÄúPutin‚Äù was adorable and happy for the first several months, then started to slow down and finally was in the ER due to severe constipation. A week later he is hospitalized for a week and finally they sedated him and manually removed stool from his colon. It was a horrible process; and a hospital bill of over $5,000.00. Healthy Paws reviewed the claim in a matter of days and we had our reimbursement quickly! The claim process is quick an easy, just upload the information from your home computer to the website, attach a copy of the medical records history for the first claim, and if questions; they will contact you. 
     Unfortunately for us, the treatment was only a temporary fix, in a matter of weeks the problem was developing again, the Putin was referred to a surgeon to discuss options for surgery for Megacolon. The surgery would give our 10-month-old kitten a chance at a normal life, otherwise, it would just be repeated hospitalizations and removal of stool. Thanks to having Healthy Paws pet insurance, we were able to better afford the surgery that he needed. Putin was in hospital for a week, he had a subtotal colectomy, and a repair of a pericardial hernia, and his liver put back in place. It was touch and go for several days, but he survived, thanks to a great surgeon and facility, and our miracle baby is back and loving life! The bill was $8,200.00.  I submitted a claim on Sunday night, and by Monday afternoon I got the confirmation notice that the claim was processed, and by Friday I received the payment so our emergency fund could be replaced. I highly recommend anyone looking for Pet Insurance consider Healthy Paws. The service was impeccable. Get the insurance when your pet is young and be prepared for the unexpected. If not for this insurance we would have had to put our sweet baby down due to the large expense! I plan to be a customer for the remainder of my pet‚Äôs life. Job well done Healthy Paws!
title: Healthy Paws Pet Insurance is the best insurance ever!

text: Best pet insurance company by far!
title: Best pet insurance company by far!

text:
I signed up for Healthy Paws Pet Insurance 8 years ago for my young cat. We had to file a handful of claims over the years but nothing too serious.

Then just when he turned 10 years old Healthy Paws sent a policy renewal notice that had a rate over 50% more than the year before! I called and asked and was told that it was because we moved (<10 minute drive from our old home but apparently changing zip codes was all it took.) I don't know why an indoor cat is going to suddenly change their health status because of their zip code, but I can only assume this was really because he had become a senior so they didn't want to cover him any more.

My suspicions were confirmed when I put a claim in for lab work they had always covered in the past, only to have the claim denied with no reimbursement. That was the straw that broke the camel's back for me so I called and cancelled. Customer service made zero effort to try to keep me on-board. I'm giving them a star based on excellent service in years past, otherwise this would be a one star for a company that actively tries to drive customers away the moment their pets become more likely to have issues.

Edit to add after company response: They talk about trying to keep increases manageable, but all my previous annual rate increases were in the $1-3 range. This one was over $20/month to $64/month. At the new rate I would‚Äôve been paying over $700/year just for the privilege of having insurance. There‚Äôs no way that makes any sort of economic sense for a pet owner.

This response, like all I‚Äôve received from Healthy Paws, is woefully inadequate, not entirely truthful, and not terribly sympathetic.
title: 8 year customer but no more

text:
I started with these guys a couple of years back and never had a problem.

In the past few months, they didn't cover my cat on a visit that included one NON-ROUTINE test. I understand that mistakes happen and I emailed support three times w/ no response. I finally called in and after waiting about 30 minutes I spoke to someone. She had no record of my emails but assured me I could send the paperwork to claims@. I did that. No one responded. I have attempted to call in on three different occasions to get assistance with this and after waiting on hold for nearly 30 minutes, I have a life and had to go do something else.

Secondly, I had a test done for my cats' thyroid condition that started happening AFTER I started getting covered with these guys. They didn't re-reimburse anything. Again, mistakes happen, however, I can't get a hold of anyone on the phone. This has been going on for THREE MONTHS NOW.

I don't know what happened. Maybe they have new management or maybe they laid off staff to cut costs.  In any case, I am on hold again now going on 31 minutes.  I will attempt ONE more email and ONE more email.  If I can't get a hold of anyone, I will be filing a complaint with the Better Business Bureau to get this on their record and get the appropriate refund.

This is unacceptable. I don't have multiple hours a day trying to track down BS. Thanks for reading.

EDIT: I am unable to respond to your response so I am editing my initial post. My name is Ryan (LAST NAME REMOVED). Just post a phone number here for me to call or an email address that goes to a human.

EDIT2: I have heard from someone and this now appears to be being worked through. I will consider a re-rating once this process is complete. It is still UNACCEPTABLE that it got this far. It is unacceptable that I have to go through a backchannel for basic services.

text: Our beloved Sky was diagnosed with Lymphoma cancer at only 6 years old. I had never been a fan of treating dogs with chemo but our vet explained that Lymphoma treatment is well tolerated with minimal side effects. The only problem, he said, is that the regimen is very expensive. Luckily, we bought a Healthy Paws insurance policy for Sky when she was just a puppy. This made it possible to give her the treatment that she needed. Dealing with Healthy Paws is straightforward. They did just what the policy said that they would do. Filing claims is so easy that I can complete one in about 5 minutes from start to finish. Claim payments usually arrive within 2 weeks. I am happy to say that Sky is in remission and just as happy and goofy as always. I urge you to get your pets covered early while they are still young. Without Healthy Paws we would be without her now.

text: Recently my husband and I went through every pet parents worst nightmare, a cancer diagnosis that came out of nowhere. Not only that, they actually sent me a message asking how my dog was doing after they noticed her cancer diagnosis on the claims I had submitted, this company really goes above and beyond and I am so thankful I chose them over many of the other companies.

text:
Healthy Paws Pet Insurance review
I was lucky enough to have insured my beloved cat a few years ago. Mrs. Fat, as she is lovingly called due to her love of food and pleasantly plump appearance, came to me as a rescue in 2013 after being abandoned by former owners not just once, but twice and was found wandering the streets of a friend of mines neighborhood. From the moment I brought her into my home Fatness stole my heart. I went through a horrible divorce that involved abuse and Fatness has always been my touchstone, my true north. She is my family and I cannot imagine my life without her. Over the past few months Fatness blood work started showing some out of the ordinary readings and after being admitted to ICU right before Christmas, the team at Sugarland Veterinary Specialists expertly took care of her and fast-tracked her into surgery and biopsies to get the right diagnosis. Procedures I could never have afforded without Healthy Paws. I was frantic and besides myself with worry and grief and Healthy Paws not only made me feel safe and protected and that I could provide the love and care my pet so desperately needed. They even went above and beyond to help with direct pay on a moments notice as things were moving so fast and it was the week before Christmas. On Christmas Eve Fatness was diagnosed with Liver Disease. Although my heart is broken that my furry family member received this painful and eventually terminal diagnosis; through the continued help and support of Healthy Paws, she is being treated with a combination of home and hospital therapy and support and as I write this is lounging outside on her patio in the sun. If you have a pet, please enroll them in Healthy Paws and on behalf of Fatness and myself, here's to as many days in the sun as possible. Love, Beth Levine owner of Mrs. Fat aka Fatness.
title: Healthy Paws Pet Insurance review - The Best!

text: I just wanted to send you a note to say thank you. My golden retriever, Roxy, has had one problem after the next since we got her (from a "reputable" breeder). Ear infections, allergies, two torn ACL's and now a terrible sinus infection that we are trying to fix. Have tried antifungals, antibiotics, (no improvement) and are about to do a rhinoscopy. It could be as simple as she sniffed a foreign body up her nose, or as serious as an autoimmune disease or cancer. One thing I haven't had to worry about is choosing between putting food on our table and giving our dog the care she needs. You have always reimbursed fairly, and I've never had any issues (and thankfully you haven't dropped me!). You are a wonderful, wonderful company. Thank you so much. I'm saying prayers for my dog, and a huge thank you to you and your team. I've referred many people to Healthy Paws as well as completed online reviews. Let me know if there's anything else I can do to say thank you. I am so glad I got healthy paws.

text:
A couple years ago, I decided to get pet insurance for my year-old kittens. I could find no clear comparison between companies‚Äîit was worse than car insurance. I opted to go with Healthy Paws based on a friend‚Äôs personal experience. Later that year, one of my girls was diagnosed with renal disease‚Äîquite rare in a female year-old cat! She now sees a specialist every few months to monitor progression of her disease, and Healthy Paws has been there every step of the way. I can‚Äôt imagine how I would handle these life-long expenses without Healthy Paws. And when‚Äînot if‚Äîshe requires surgical intervention for blocked ureters or a blocked urethra, I know I‚Äôll be able to handle the cost because of Healthy Paws. 

I recently adopted my former foster kittens, and they each got a free month of insurance with another company. However, this other insurer has yearly and annual caps on payouts. I canceled their coverage and returned to Heathy Paws. It was wise, as one had a major emergency last month and ended up in the pet ER. His visit and follow up care would have exceeded the yearly cap of the other insurance. However, with Healthy Paws, I knew I didn‚Äôt have to worry. Should another emergency crop up, he‚Äôd still have their protection. 

This is why I continue to use Healthy Paws. They protect me so I can protect my pets.

text:
Highly Recommend
     Our toy poodle suffered a broken jaw which required a dental specialist and an anesthesiologist due a heart condition that put him at a high risk for surgery. With Healthy Paws, I was able to purchase pet insurance with 90% reimbursement excluding consultation fees which has been a blessing for us and our beloved poodle.

text:
I first purchased the policy for our Cocker Spaniel last Sept when he was 4 months old. With $250 deductible and 90% coverage, the premium was $41.74 per month. Now one year later they premium was raised to $51.76 per month. That is a 24% increase!!!

To make matter worse, the same coverage for the same age and breed of dog would currently cost a NEW subscriber only $39.66 per month.

When I questioned this, they just gave me double talk saying if I cancelled and re-enrolled I would have to worry about pre existing conditions...

It is clear this company takes advantage of current clients.

DO NOT DEAL WITH HEALTHY PAWS, by the time your pet may actually need it, the premiums will have become unaffordable.

text: I cannot say enough about Healthy Paws ... they have been nothing short of amazing and can honestly say that we likely would not have our little "Wagner" anymore if it wasn't for them.  Unfortunately, Wags has had three different stomach surgeries, two knee surgeries and most recently a surgery to repair a ruptured disk in his neck. Healthy Paws has covered all these surgeries and gives us the peace of mind knowing that if Wagner has another serious problem, we will be able to provide the right care for him knowing Healthy Paws has us covered.

title: Great coverage

text: My poor Husky has had 3 major surgeries in 14 months.  Two ACL repairs and one to repair a tiny hole in his lungs.  Healthy Paws has paid all three of those claims as expected and we have no complaints.  Just understand what is paid for an what is not paid for.  The cost of a office visit is not covered.  Food is not covered and routine vaccinations are not covered.   Pre-existing conditions are not covered.  There is also a yearly deductible and in our case it is $250.   My dog is my family and it's worth it to pay a few bucks a month to be sure he gets the care he need if he ever needs it.  To me I would rather pay for it for 15 years and never use it then not pay for it and have to make a decision one time based on money.  It is well worth it.
title: Healthy Paws Has Saved Us

text: I have been a member since March of this year (2019).  It was easy to sign up.  I signed with them because they are the number 1 rated pet insurance. I had to call the customer service a few times for help and they were very helpful.  Prior for signing up I got quotes from different companies and shopped around what others offered.  So far, this company is this cheapest premium rate.  I pay only $59.06/mo for two dogs.  I like it that whenever you submit a claim it goes directly to the deductible.  There are a few things...that I wish that Healthy Paws offer such as a multi-pet discount, pet wellness plan and a way to just pay off the deductible all at once.  But other than that...I have never had a problem with this company.  The website and app are pretty easy to use when you submit a claim.  I wish I had pet insurance in the past when I actually had a $600 vet bill with my dog who passed.  I learned my lesson and got pet insurance now and I'm glad I found an insurance company that is affordable and I love that it's also a foundation that helps homeless dogs.    I definitely recommend this insurance.

text: Ugh, I was happy with this company for the first year. They had a really good rate, and good customer service. I went everywhere extolling its virtues. They also paid out quickly on my cat's expensive operation. Then...... 3 years in and my premiums have gone up almost 100%! Customer service has deteriorated greatly, with reps who put you on hold and literally never come back on the line. Emails go ignored. Complain on Facebook, they delete your comment. I have to wonder if my complain about their service is what made my premiums go up 30% this year alone (happened right afterwards). I realize all pet insurance companies do this, but HP claims it doesn't cover exams, medicines, or wellness checks and standard shots, etc to keep premiums down. Yet mine keep going up up up. Shame, they were so good for awhile.
title: Ugh disappointing

text:
Healthy Paws saved us $7,853.99 this summer. My young border collie, Toro, had a terrible summer of gastrointestinal issues and a heat stroke. Healthy Paws empowered us to take control of Toro's health to get the right combo of expertise and emergency care with the providers of our choice. We never had to delay life-saving care because of financial concern. This literally saved Toro's life. If we had to spend a few more hours debating how or if we could afford emergency care, Toro's condition might have worsened beyond recovery - he spent overnight in the ER and 4 days in Critical Care. Now, he has more energy than ever, and he is finally enjoying his food - something we have struggled with his whole life. 

We got pet insurance through Healthy Paws when Toro was a puppy for the occasional illnesses, knowing that health insurance is an investment that might not payoff until he became more senior and possibly had cancer or hip issues (which Healthy Paws has supported with our other family dogs in the past). We had no idea that Healthy Paws would save Toro's life so young. We are forever grateful for their customer service team allowing us to just focus on Toro's recovery and not worry about the finances. It was very scary and stressful enough.  Sometimes, they took less than 24 hours to issue a reimbursement, but I was also happy to wait the full 10 business days for the larger bills because I knew they would investigate it properly, our vets would support us with justifying the services, and Healthy Paws would reach out to us to check in on Toro's progress.
title: Healthy Paws saved us $7,853.99‚Ä¶

text: There honestly aren't words to describe this insurance company. I never thought I'd say that in my life, but I really mean it. Rather than fighting tooth and nail over coverage, Healthy Paws called and emailed us along the way with genuine concern about how they are doing. They ask for pictures to post in their office. They sent us a tiny painting of our dog after we weren't sure if he was going to make it. No questions asked, their issues were covered time and time again. I would pay 5x what I am for the same service and coverage. Another company could hand me a gold bar, and I would stick with Healthy Paws. They genuinely care, and want your pets to continue being healthy members of your family, no matter what.

I am J Li and I am writing this review with so much angry to Health Paws.

My beloved dog named CICI, a 9 years old black Labrador retriever, she joined Health Paws pet insurance plan from Feb, 23,2018.(CICI Policy Number: 559705-3)

On July 11, 2019 CICI had acute onset tetraparesis, and I took CICI to VCA Desert Animal Hospital to see a doctor and hospital recorded CICI's every health information from 2017.

After examination, Dr. Caldwell suggested I took CICI to VCA Valley Animal Medical Center & Emergency Hospital.

After serval hours examination in VCA Valley Animal Medical Center & Emergency Hospital, Dr. Jennifer Kingsley told me that CICI need a surgery and referred CICI to Veterinary Neurology Center in Tustin, California.

My wife and I took CICI to Veterinary Neurology Center in Tustin, California on July 12, 2019. Dr. Philip Schissler performed a very successful surgery and we were able took CICI to back home on July 15,2019.

I submitted a claim for CICI's pet insurance on July 16, 2019, and I received email from Healthy Paws. It seemed everything was OK.

After serval days, I reviewed CICI's claim state on Healthy Paws website, and found there was an Action Needed for more documents. In the meantime, I didn't receive any email required such Action Needed from Health Paws.

I send the documents as required below of the three hospitals, quoted from the Healthy Paws' website: 
"Complete medical records for claim visit and previous visits, including veterinarian‚Äôs physical exam findings, laboratory results, and any other documentation associated with your visits. Your veterinary hospital will provide these documents to you and many are happy to send them on your behalf."

I sent all of CICI's records received from the three hospitals to Health Paws via Healthy Paws website after I logged in my account.

Meanwhile I received a email for VCA Valley Animal Medical Center & Emergency Hospital, and I was told they had sent CICI's records as required to Healthy Paws directly on July 27,2019.

Yesterday (Aug. 17, 2019) I received a email form Healthy Paws which stated "CICI's claim was closed due to missing documentation and length of time it had been open. At this time we still need Cici's full medical records prior to 7/11/19 submitted for us to review."

However, when I checked CICI's claim state on Health Paws website, a new row shows there is no Action Needed, instead shows "In Process" and when I clicked in there is not requirement of any documents.

I had send CICI's records of VCA Desert Animal Hospital from Dec 8, 2017 to July 11, 2019 to Healthy Paws already on Aug 01, 2019 via Healthy Paws website.

J Li 
Aug 18,2019

text:
I wanted to take the time to write up a thorough review for Healthy Paws after a recent experience with my cat, Ava. I adopted Ava in January of 2018 as an 8 week old, healthy little kitten. While I had been wanting to adopt an older kitty, I thought that by adopting a younger one that I could perhaps avoid the older cat health problems for the first few years. However, I vowed to be the best cat mom for Ava that I could be, and I looked into insurance for her. I did extensive research on this and ended up picking Healthy Paws for her. They had reasonable prices, great coverage, and awesome customer service. The first year or so went by and I did need to utilize her insurance once for a minor health issue, and I was very pleased with how smooth the entire claim and reimbursement process went. 

I should add now that I am both a veterinary technician and a third year veterinary student. I have access to far more services, people, and resources than most people being such an involved member of the veterinary community- and even I still desperately needed the help of pet insurance in the story I am about to share. 

A few weeks ago, my perfectly healthy, ONE year old cat very suddenly developed an extremely deep rectal fistula. No one can figure out how this happened, and it has mystified everyone who has seen her. It is basically a very deep draining tract into her body. A completely freak thing that is incredibly rare in cats. I brought her straight into work where the veterinarians at my practice then referred me to a speciality hospital in hopes that they would have more experience with this type of defect. Long story short, over the past 3 weeks, Ava has gone through 3 emergency visits, 2 hospitalizations, a CT scan, and an eventual 4 hour surgery. She continues to need extensive medical care over the next few months as she heals. And as a bonus to this all, she also was incidentally diagnosed with the start of feline asthma through this process, and will require a consult with an internist and life long treatment for that once we get her all healed up from this surgery. 

Even for someone with many connections within the veterinary community, this ordeal has been incredibly expensive. When Ava‚Äôs surgeon came in to go over my surgery estimate with me, he began by saying he had tried to come up with a plan that was as inexpensive as possible and only did the bare minimum necessities as he knew it would be very financially difficult for me as a student. The relief that I felt when I was able to tell the surgeon, no, I want the absolute best care for Ava, please do all that you recommend so that she has the best outcome possible is indescribable. Having Healthy Paws insurance allowed me to get, and continue to get, the best possible care for Ava without having to worry so much about the financial burden that goes along with it. 

Healthy Paws has been prompt and fair with reimbursing me for the many claims that I have needed to submit thus far through this whole process. They have personally checked in with me to see how Ava is feeling, and truly made me feel like they cared. 

I cannot strongly urge every pet owner out there to look into pet insurance for their pets, especially Healthy Paws. If it can happen to me with my one year old healthy cat and a member of the veterinary community, it can definitely happen to you too. Ava is my best friend and I cannot express how grateful I am to have her on the road to recovery with the help of Healthy Paws.
title: Healthy Paws helped me save my best friend

text:
Any dog of ours will have Healthy Paws.

We first signed up for it through an offer at the college where I work, and when I told people we had done so, I got a lot of comments about how we should just open a little savings account and put the amount we'd put toward the premium in there instead, leaving us with cash if Renard never needed it. 

Well, we don't have human kids; Renard is our baby and treated as such - and guess what? About four years after we rescued him, he developed very serious heart disease, and his twice-yearly cardiologist visits ALONE cost more than we put into the purchase of his policy... and that doesn't even begin to include the cost of a recent stay at an emergency hospital for his first episode of heart failure. After four days there, he's fully recovered - but with a $4200 bill attached, we would have had a real financial challenge if it weren't for Healthy Paws. Instead, I submitted the claim via the app (it took three minutes) and received a direct deposit less than a week later for about $3800. 

I was a believer before, just because it's important to me to be as prepared as possible to provide care to those I love, but now you can bet we will never go without Healthy Paws insurance for any of our pets. We can be confident and secure in our decision-making regarding their care, and know that we don't have to worry about jaw-grindingly painful choices between paying the vet and paying our regular bills.

Starting over with a new pet insurance company will make our pet ineligible for certain coverage based on new health conditions that have been found since then. Healthy Paws says that rates are not affected by the number or nature of the claims that we submit, but I do not believe them. I am not a happy customer of Healthy Paws and hate how they are taking advantage of the situation that many other pet owners will face.

We've had Healthy Paws coverage since Pixie was a puppy and they covered the surgery for both knees, quickly, efficiently and with no hassles or questions. It's nice to only pay a few hundred dollars for a $3400 surgery!  I tell everyone I know with a dog to get insurance.  I never want to worry about whether I can afford to give my dog the care she needs.
title: Dependable insurance ensures that your pet can get the care they need

text:
When I had to leave my pup Piglet at the vet hospital for over three days while they ran tests to try and figure out why she wasn't eating and regurgitating putrid brown liquid, it was one of the most stressful situations I have been in. The only thing worse than the bill I was racking up was the fact that they didnt know what was wrong with her. I work for a non-profit and live to paycheck to paycheck. I can't even imagine what I would have done had I not had Healthy Paws. I could relax knowing that I wouldn't have to go into debt when this was all over.
Not only did HP approve my claims within a few days but the money was in my account ready for me to pay off my credit card in a few weeks.
So grateful for this insurance. I also had a great experience with their customer service when I needed to adjust a claim that I had already submitted.

text: I enrolled my puppy around 6 months of age, and it was hands down the BEST decision I had ever made. At just shy of the age of two, what we thought was an ACL/CCL tear was soon discovered to be severe hip dysplasia, in both hips, but needing just about immediate attention on the right hip. My almost two year old pup required a total hip replacement . Luckily enough, Healthy Paws covered hip dysplasia, and covered 80% of what would have been an almost $8,000 bill for me. They made it so beyond easy on my end. The made a pre-authorized same-day payment to my vet. My vet called and handled everything from there. They covered all additional related expenses. Again, little did anyone expect, but within 8 months of having a total hip replacement, my dog had popped his hip out, never gave any signs of pain, discomfort, until he couldn‚Äôt handle the pain anymore. Scar tissue formed a false hip socket, but eventually led to the feeling of bone-on-bone pain. Once again, my angels At Healthy Paws were there again! My dog required a hip-re-replacement and another costly surgery, and as previously done, they made a same-day payment for another $5,300 bill. I cannot express enough how thankful I am for them! My mind is always at ease knowing I don‚Äôt have to worry about my dog and medical treatment. They truly are angels. They make it so hassle free to submit a claim and they‚Äôre all extremely frienly and empathetic. Within a few days after returning home from both surgeries, Healthy Paws staff reached out to inquire about how my dog was doing. Anytime my pet comes up in conversation or I learn of someone who doesn‚Äôt have pet insurance yet or is planning on getting a dog, I ALWAYS brag about Healthy Paws and urge them to inquire! Even my vet said they‚Äôve never had pet insurance companies make same day payments like Healthy Paws did. At this most recent visit, I could see other pet parents in the waiting room listening in on my conversation regarding my vet bill and what the pet insurance company covered on the same day! So all in all, I am an EXTREMELY happy Healthy Paws client and they have myself and my pup for LIFE! No lifetime or annual maximums, and no premium increases for submission of claims. What‚Äôs better than that piece of mind?!
title: LOVE LOVE LOVE

text: They were very quick in processing my claim and getting my reimbursement issued. It's always easy to get my questions answered by phone as well. text: Our poor dog has had his share of eye problems in his 2.5 years of life. He had cataract surgery on each eye by the time he was 14 months old. My wife and I are blessed that we could afford the surgery, though it certainly would have strained our budget significantly. But having Healthy Paws insurance made what could have been a difficult decision a rather easy one. Without the worry of financial ramifications, we only had to concern ourselves with what was best for our boy. Our boy, Wynslow, had the surgery and is healing very nicely. Not only did Healthy Paws reimburse us promptly, they have taken the time to check in on us to see how our boy is doing. It really was a great comfort to know that the only thing we had to worry about was that our boy get the best medical treatment and not anything else. text: Isabelle, my Golden Retriever is 6 years old.  She attends daycare 4 days a week, goes to work with me one day a week, swims at an indoor dog pool year-round, and is a certified therapy companion.  We visit hospitals, schools, and assisted living facilities.  She pretty much goes everywhere with me.  Christmas day we visited my daughter and Isabelle was running with her dog having a great time.  I then heard a yelp, and she was limping badly.  Spent Christmas day in the emergency with her.  Turns out she was modifying her run (I think) to adapt to my daughters‚Äô much smaller dog, and tore her ACL.  This required expensive surgery and subsequent rehab work.  I submitted the bill, it was quickly paid minus my deductible.  These guys are awesome!  One unexpected accident can cost thousands.  This insurance is so worth the cost.  Years ago, I had insurance with another company but got tired of all the paperwork to be filled out, only to be told denied.  I have recommended Healthy Paws to everyone I know.  My daughter‚Äôs dog is also insured by them.  The claim process is simple.  I actually take a pic and send the bill while I am at the vet‚Äôs office. I will never go uninsured with my dog, nor should you.  But the insurance is only as good as the people.  That‚Äôs why it is only Healthy Paws for me!  Thanks, guys! text: So this is one of the first reviews I've ever written but really felt it was important.  I'm a pet parent to two awesome and quirky cats that our family adores and was heart broken when one of them came back with a diagnosis of mast cell cancer right before this last Christmas.  He was always so happy and healthy, and from what seemed like one week to the next, we were given the option of starting him on palliative care or going to a specialist to see if there was anything at all that could be done.  I wanted to give my kitty every chance to hold onto his life, so decided to take him to an oncologist and do whatever possible - whether it meant using up my savings or putting his care on a credit card.  Lots of specialist visits, major surgery, and ER stays later, my little cat is doing well beyond belief.  Even his oncologist is amazed!  The bills though, as can be imagined, have been off the charts.  I was with a different pet insurance company years ago before I found Healthy Paws and the reimbursement rate was pretty minimal, so it took me a while to even submit any claims this time around.  I have to say I was actually shocked in the best way at the service I received through Healthy Paws once push actually came to shove.  They initially needed my kitty's full medical records/history and reviewed that, but afterwards, all the claims I filed were taken care of immediately and the reimbursement level was incredible.  Submitting claims was also super easy through their app.  I was ready to use all my savings for my little kitty if that's what it took, but thanks to Healthy Paws, I didn't have to.  Service was transparent, extremely fair, and efficient - they even reached out to me to check in on my Thomas.  Before deciding what pet insurance company to go through, I did tons and tons of research.  I'd read good reviews about Healthy Paws, liked their customer service, and decided to take a chance.  I'm writing this review in the hopes of helping others out there going through the same process I went through, deciding to take a chance on a company, and not really knowing if they will come through when you may actually need for them to.  It's not an easy decision, and so I'm sharing my own experience because it's been a truly positive one.  Healthy Paws came through for my family in a way I myself did not even expect.  I cannot imagine a better company out there, and I am so grateful to them for the part they played in helping me to give my little kitty the chance at life that he deserves.  I sincerely cannot recommend them highly enough!
title: By far best pet insurance company around

text:
******DO NOT go to them if you have rescue animals!!!!********

Originally I got an email from them upon claim submission that they need all medical record AFTER, let me repeat, AFTER my dog joined our family.  I even called and made sure I have nothing else missing.

My dog is a rescue we adopted him 6 months ago.  The first occasion to a vet was a month ago with the symptom on the claim. 

Now they sent me this on email:
"A pet....ON THE DATE OF ENROLLMENT must have undergone a COMPLETE clinical examination. "   

If I can't provide this, "any signs and symptoms noted (in claims submitted) would NOT be eligible for coverage." because they will consider those as pre-existing condition.

Luckily, I can provide since the dog was an owner surrender.  and I know which vet they used.
But most dogs at rescue or shelters don't have any medical records.  

**********DO NOT use this insurance for rescue animals!!!!!!!!*********
title: Stay away if you have rescue

title: Amazing coverage

text:
I have had my two pups for almost 9 years.  On January 1, 2014, one of my pups ruptured a disc in her back.  At that time, I did NOT have pet insurance.  After $7,000 in surgery/meds and 10 months of recovery...I decided maybe I should LOOK into pet insurance.  I did ALOT of research.  The one company that stood out was HEALTHY PAWS. I decided to get the coverage.  I selected the lowest deductible per month for each pup and selected the highest payout coverage for each.  I called my pups vet and the surgeon and asked them to email my pups records so I could send to Healthy Paws.  Once I received those files, I emailed them to Healthy Paws. 
It was VERY clear on what they cover.  NO PET INSURANCE will cover PRE-EXISTING conditions.  Makes purrfect sense to me.  Now some companies cover annual shots/exams/teeth cleaning/heartworm meds/etc.  HOWEVER those that do...have a CAP of what they will pay out.  Here is my opinion on PET INSURANCE.  If you are lucky enough to have a dog in your life.....one thing you should know.....SPAY/NEUTER/ANNUAL SHOTS/HEARTWORM...is all something that EVERY pet owner should do no matter what....it is part of being a responsible pet owner.  I knew when I rescued my pups...there is a cost to ensuring they are healthy and happy and loved.  BUT in the event something happens that is out of the normal range of taking care of your pet....snake bite, hurt paw/leg/back or any long term illness (paws crossed no one ever experiences this)...HEALTHY PAWS is INCREDIBLE.  So...after my dog hurt her back...I got coverage for both pups.  Oh doggie am I HAPPAWY I DID!  Since then, that same pup, had eye surgery (a big growth started growing in her eyelid), her right knee gave out...surgery for that....a year and a couple months later the left knee gave out..surgery for that.  So what did I pay for these 3 surgeries?  10% of the cost!!!  All meds that were prescribed after these surgeries were covered as well at 90%.  Oh..and the BEST thing is....if you download the app...you get home from vet....click on the APP...click on picture of PUP that you have....click on FILE a new claim...take a picture of the vet bill and hit submit.  Then a check magically appears in your mailbox!!!!  What if you don't know if something is covered?  Easy...either call them (they are SUPER friendly!!! OR just send it in via the APP.  If it is not covered they will deny it and provide the reason.   So...I did an analysis of what I have paid each month in premiums and  out of pocket with insurance AND compared it to what I would have paid had I not had insurance and premiums and just the knee surgeries alone made it worth it....if neither pup ever had anymore issues and if they live to 15...I am already ahead.  I HOPE neither of my pups NEVER meet their yearly deductibles ever again.....to me the peace of mind knowing Healthy Paws is there....with NO CAP on how much they will pay out....in the event there is something long term etc. is what makes them the BEST PET INSURANCE!!!  I will always have coverage on my pets and I know for a FACT......it will ALWAYS BE HEALTHY PAWS.  Not only did I give them 5 stars....but I would give them 4 paws up plus a wagging tail!!!!  BOL!!!!
title: Healthy Paws is PAWESOME

text:
MURPHY BEAR, 160 # chocolate lab, our baby, best friend and constant companion.
We picked up Murphy New Years Day, 2012, and since then he has been away from us 2 days, and goes everywhere we do.
Shortly after we picked up Murphy we decided to enroll him in the Healthy Paws insurance program, never dreaming that it would be the wisest move too old people going into retirement could do.
About two years later , at the lake Murphy decided to leap off the bank and dive bomb the Ducks. He came out of the water, and you could tell from the look in his eyes something was wrong.
Turns out he had torn up his left rear knee and needed surgery. I called Healthy Paws, and they said he's covered, and you have a 10% deductible, let us know how it turns out.
\We had the surgery done, and the day after we brought him home, I submitted the claim to Healthy Paws on a Sat. afternoon. We received an e mail Mon stating you checks in the mail, and how is Murphy doing?
As a result of his injury Murphy has had to have regular ,water aquatic's, which Healthy Paws covers.
Two weeks ago I was operating the snow blower, and Murph was in the front yard. I glanced over to where he was on the trail we clear to the mail box, and he was sitting there with the look in his eyes, of Dad we have a problem.
I went over and he had either slipped, or fallen and history repeated itself, Murphy had damage to his right rear knee.
He had the surgery, a TPLO, and again Healthy Paws ,stood behind us, and is covering the expense.
The other thing that they understand is the relationship that their customers have with their pets, and it was surprising starting years ago that you would receive emails wondering how is Murphy doing?
I cannot say enough good things about Healthy Paws. I wish they were running the Health Care program for us old guys. My Buddy Murphy has better Health Care than we do Cheaper too.
The wife and I consider them family, and with all the things to worry about these days, you can relax when your pet is covered, it is the best investment we have made in a long time.
Thank You Healthy Paws,for being there, and for the wonderful staff you have.
Love
Murphy Bear
title: OUTSTANDING PET INSURANCE

text: I give Healthy Paws Pet Insurance a Five Star rating because I have absolutely no reservations about this company and I would recommend them to anyone that has a pet. text:
Hi Healthy Paws Team-

I wanted to take the time to share a personal story with you and why I believe strongly in pet insurance offered by Healthy Paws - not just any company - Healthy Paws.

After significant research, I decided to choose Healthy Paws to insure Wiggins, the puppy I found abandoned chained to a New York City park bench nearly 5 years ago. When I told family and friends about your service, some of them questioned the need, but I never waned: there is nothing I wouldn't do for him, and I give him the best of everything, from food, to healthcare, to overall love and affection.

Unfortunately, Wiggins suffered his first grand mal seizure last month - a terrifying experience to be sure. Knowing I had the best coverage and support of your team behind me meant the world to me as I visited the ER (after hours), followed up with my local vet, and even saw a specialist/neurologist! Everything was covered at 90% without question or claim payment delay. Sadly, Wiggins just had his second seizure two days ago and after a follow up visit to my vet, he is now taking Keppra 3x daily, a rather expensive and burdensome lifelong treatment. I am also able to take him in for an MRI to rule out any structural issues, to be certain of his idiopathic epilepsy diagnosis, and I know that Healthy Paws will be with me 100% of the way.

I want you to know how comforting this makes me feel. Having to bear the financial burden over the rest of his life would amplify the tremendous stress I - a single "dad" with a demanding job - now find myself under given Wiggins diagnosis. With Healthy Paws on my side, however, that burden is completely gone. Thank you!

You all should feel very proud to work for such an amazing organization as Healthy Paws. Each of you, no matter your job, touches lives like mine (and Wiggins) and I wanted to take a moment to recognize that.

Thank you.

Matt (and Wiggins) in Hoboken, NJ

text:

Hospitalization for the amputation was supposed to be 3 days, turned out to be 5 days.  No complications, but dogs who have been using the amputated leg without a problem take longer to acclimate to having 3 legs, but the prognosis for them is better because the cancer is caught earlier.  Healthy Paws paid for the bill which was more than $5,000.  That's on top of medication, several sets of xrays and a bone scan.

text:
I bought pet insurance for both of my cats early when my wife and I adopted both of them. Many people were joking that why would I get insurance for my pets? Reading the reviews online about all the companies it was very overwhelming with all of the choices and pros/cons. After reading countles reviews I picked HealthyPaws. The sign up process was very easy and was able to customize our coverage. 

Jump forward to January 20th, 2017. Our 4 year old kitty, Pixie, had stopped eating and was losing weight and started vomiting. We rushed her to the emergency room that night and they immediately started looking at her and then drafted up a proposal of procedures which totaled about $1200 just out of the gate. With Healthy Paws I didn't even bat an eye as I knew 90% was going to be covered. I called the 800 number to verify the coverage and they said it will all be covered and to rest easy. Long story short, 3 days later and another $2000 we had a feeding tube put in and Pixie is much more at ease and resting at home and recovering.

Submitting my claim was super easy. I snapped pictures of the complete invoice and 2 days later I was notified that it was completed and a check will be send in a few days. 2 days ago I received the check and only had to pay $600 out of pocket for $4000 worth of services. 

Thank you Healthy Paws for saving our fur babies life!

Our vet recommended pet insurance at our first visit with Frank and to be honest, I never thought we would have to use it. I could not have been more wrong. Frank has had pretty much every diagnostic test you can imagine. He's been on several antibiotics and for a while it felt like we were spending more time at the vets office than not. Seeing him in pain and sick is stressful enough but having to shoulder the financial burden of a sick pet makes it even worse. 

Working with Healthy Paws through all of our claims has been so easy. Filing claims is all done online and they are generally processed within a few days. The only time it took longer than that was with our first claim because Frank's medical history needed to be retrieved from the vet. We have received all of our reimbursement checks incredibly fast, as well. I cannot say enough good things about our experience with Healthy Paws.

title: They saved 2 lives in 3 months!

text:
My wife and I recently lost our 9 month kitten to feline infectious peritonitis. We had recently purchased Healthy Paws insurance from a recommendation and took our kitten in to the vet during the Healthy Paws 15 day grace period because she had an eye infection. Silly us for trying to take care of our cat.

After the grace period had passed, our kitten began to show very worrying symptoms unrelated to her eye. Over the course of the next few days, we took her back to the vet, and then escalated to emergency hospitals, etc. But FIP is incurable, and we were unfortunately not able to save her. After many tears, we started filing claims with Healthy Paws. Despite the pain of losing the kitten, my wife and I were glad that we had recently bought insurance.

But it turned out that didn't matter. Even though the vet had not initially linked the eye infection to FIP, Healthy Paws decided that it was evidence of a pre-existing condition and denied every single one of our claims related to our kitten's illness and death. They said they were very sympathetic to our loss, but still denied the claims.

No doubt Healthy Paws will respond to this review with all kinds of excuses. But the fact is that as responsible pet-parents we took our kitten to the vet for a minor eye infection during the Healthy Paws grace period and Healthy Paws decided that was enough to deny all claims. We would have been in a much better situation if we were irresponsible and just let our kitten suffer the eye infection until the grace period was over. Then Healthy Paws couldn't have claims a pre-existing condition.

My take-home is that Healthy Paws is a great idea if your pet gets physically injured and they can't find a shred of evidence that the injury has any historical basis. God help you if your pet gets a disease of some kind, even one that's fatal.
title: Healthy Paws denied all claims related to a disease that caused the death of our kitten.

text: We decided to look into insurance when we adopted our sweet puppy Shay a year ago- she is a lab and we knew the risks for hip dysplasia that comes with this great breed. We didn‚Äôt want to have to make a hard decision years down the road if she needed a hip replacement- which can cost upwards of $10,000. We did our research and found that Healthy Paws was the best option- low monthly costs, good coverage, and no lifetime ceiling. Over the last year Shay has suffered from frequent UTIs and almost every month we were visiting the vet- since we had insurance I never once had to pause when the vet suggested we run a test or suggested a treatment plan. That peace of mind allowed us to hone in on the cause and finally get her the surgery she needed to be healthy and pain free made this difficult situation so much easier. Her surgery was covered and we were able to rest easy knowing we were able to make the best decision for her without breaking the bank. The Healthy Paws claim process is incredibly easy, and claim approval is quick. Getting Healthy Paws pet insurance was one of the best decisions we could have made when adopting Shay.

text:
It's hard to find anyone who actually likes paying for insurance.  Having that rainy-day backup, especially when it comes to beloved pets, is so nice, though.  I no longer lose sleep wondering what I would do if my dog(s) got really sick or badly injured.  I do my best to keep them safe but my dogs are professional trouble-finders and we've made more than a few trips to the emergency vet through the years.  So far I've spent more on the insurance than I have received back on claims but this isn't about breaking even.  It's about insurance for those scary things that happen while the last thing you want to be thinking about is how you'll pay for it all.  

I've submitted some small online claims to Healthy Paws in the past year.  I was very impressed by how quickly and how accurately they were processed/reimbursed.  Healthy Paws does not reimburse for some things like vaccinations, preventive meds, or vet exam fees.    They offer different levels of deductibles/reimbursement rates, which makes it easy to compare prices and select a plan.  I also got a bit of a discount on the rates when I adopted a second dog and added her to the policy.  Monthly premiums are automatically billed to my credit card, making the whole thing seamless and easy.  And yes, the premiums do increase by a small amount every year.  When I compared different pet insurance plans, this Healthy Paws seemed to cover more major treatment expenses than the rest, which is why I ultimately chose them.  All in all I'm really happy with this company and I truly appreciate knowing we'll be in great hands (or paws) when we need it the most.
