title: I only wish I'd known about them with previous pets

text:
I purchased Healthy Paws a few months before I took a road trip two years ago.  I made sure that I had a full comprehensive physical exam (bloodworm etc) done early on to show that my dog was healthy.  I felt that this would help with any future claims I may have to make. 
Long story short - a few months after getting insurance for my pup, she became devastatingly ill.  Despite being on a topical flea/tick preventative, she contracted ehrlichia (like Lyme Disease).  The symptoms were dramatic - extreme lethargy, limping, swollen joints, weight loss - It took lots of tests and even a joint tap to see that she indeed had the infection.  Over $1000 later and she was feeling much better! Healthy paws paid out 90% on every claim I made!
Then, my vet notices that the limping was not just due to the ehrlichia, my dog had a recent partially torn cruciate ligament - perhaps due to weakness/muscle wasting from the ehrlichia.  Over $4000 later for surgery and she's got full range of motion and is happily walking and running with ease (although we don't play ball any more after finding out how hard it is on their joints/ligaments). 
Well, I wish I could say that was the last of it, but there have been two trips to the emergency vet - once for a relapse of the ehrlichia and another time after my dog started vomiting during a camping trip.  Thank god she ended up being fine, but dogs can scare the heck out of you and it is such a relief to know that if something major comes up you won't have to sell your house to pay the vet bills.
My dog goes everywhere with me and I watch her like a hawk.  She's extremely well trained and is even my "demo dog" for training consultations (I'm a dog trainer).  No matter how much you train and care for your dog, if you take them out into the world, you never know what can happen.  Also, Healthy Paws covers congenital illness, so even if you're dog/cat lives in a bubble, they are still covered if genetic illness or cancer strikes. 
I recommend Healthy Paws to all of my training clients and many of them sign up, and several have had to make claims that more than covered their monthly rate and premium.  Healthy Paws is GREAT!!!
title: Healthy Paws is a Lifesaver!

text: Our 2-year-old boxer Billie developed severe idiopathic thrombocytopenia perpura, and autoimmune disease where the body destroys its own blood platelets. She has been hospitalized three times so far, requiring blood transfusions and expensive medications, with medical bills totaling over $13,000. Healthy Paws Insurance has covered everything they said they would: 80% of all medically necessary costs--excluding vet exam fees-- after the deductible. The online claim process is easy and convenient, and they process claims quickly and send a check within weeks. Customer service is great; they respond quickly to emails, and their phone reps are courteous and very helpful. Because they have no annual or per-incident cap, we have peace of mind, as Billie requires ongoing medication and care. They have been a lifesaver for our beloved pet. We recommend it highly. I only wish our human health insurance was this good....
title: Excellent Pet Insurance

text: One day our puppy stopped eating/drinking and started throwing up bile. Our vet took an x-ray which revealed he had three foreign objects in his stomach and intestines. Apparently he had ingested part of a sprinkler head from our backyard (crazy, I know). After emergency surgery and a hefty bill, our puppy was healthy and happy again. I quickly and easily submitted pictures of our vet bill to Healthy Paws via the mobile app, and my claim was processed immediately (I actually received an email confirmation over the weekend, believe it or not!) I had heard of pet insurance companies "splitting hairs" and not covering parts of procedures, but that was not the case with Heathy Paws. We had opted for 90% coverage, and that's exactly what we received. A few days later our reimbursement check arrived in the mail, even before our credit card bill for his surgery. Not only that, but a Healthy Paws representative emailed to see how our puppy was doing. I have been completely satisfied with the coverage, ease of use, expediency, and responsiveness of Healthy Paws and would absolutely recommend this pet insurance provider to anyone and everyone.
title: Complete Satisfaction

text:
Affordable premiums
Easy claims procedures
Fast reimbursement
Excellent customer care
Healthy Paws has literally been a lifesaver for my beloved  Magoo. I LOVE the folks at Healthy Paws!
title: Healthy Paws is PAWSOME!

text: I have been with Healthy Paws for several years and had a couple large claims.  They have always been prompt and very helpful.
title: Excellent Service

text:
15 months after starting my first policy with HP I had around a $3700 claim for an obstructed bowl.  My dog was seen at two different vets and therefore there were two different invoices.  Having an annual deductible meant once I had paid the deductible for the first invoice I no longer owed any deductible on the next one nor will I have to pay a deductible for the rest of the policy year.  In total with my 10% co-insurance I received about $3100 for my claim and I received both checks in less then two weeks of filing.  Even with the monthly premium I was spared nearly $2,000 in out of pocket expenses for these vet bills.

Healthy Paws has not only been extremely quick and painless through the process they have shown a genuine interest in the well being of my injured pet.  

I have all of my pets now protected through Healthy Paws and recommend any pet owner to do the same.
title: Glad I chose Healthy Paws

text:
We bought pet insurance even though we thought our dog would likely never need it. Fast forward to 3 socks and some complications later, and we're grateful we did. But more than that, we're grateful we chose Healthy Paws.

Healthy Paws is what we wish human insurance were: easy,compassionate and above what you'd expect when you need it. They have a very easy to use mobile app to set up and adjust preferences. When we've had a claim, we simply take a photo of the bill and submit. 2 days later we have a fully processed claim and a check for 90% reimbursement in our mail. It's so easy! I've been telling friends and no one can believe how great the system is. On top of that we have a dedicated specialist, Tim, who checks in on us. It's been incredible to be fully and efficiently supported through a hard time.

We'd highly recommend Healthy Paws to friends and family who want and easy and stress-free way to deal with pets in trying times. Moreover we greatly appreciate the support, care and love Healthy Paws has given with our unexpected troubles.
title: Easy, full-coverage experience when life throws a curve ball

text:
After doing a lot of research I decided to go with Healthy Paw Pet Insurance for my two dogs.  It seemed like they had very few exclusions, great reviews, and the premiums were reasonable. 

For the first couple of years I didn't have any major health issues for either of my dogs so while I didn't have any complaints, I also didn't have any reason to write a good review. 

Recently one of my dogs was diagnosed with Leukemia so now this insurance has become invaluable.  My dog has started Chemotherapy so we are having weekly visits to the oncologist.

It is amazing to me how simple the submission process is (especially considering I'm not very tech savvy), and how quickly they approve the claims. 

It means the world to me that I am able to focus all my attention on my dog and not having to stress about how much all of his treatments are going to cost.

I would highly recommend this company to anyone considering pet insurance for their pet.
title: Best Pet Insurance!

text: This company is awesome.  I did a lot of research before I bought pet insurance and chose Healthy Paws due to the reviews.  I finally had to submit a large claim for my cat who had to be hospitalized over Xmas Eve due to eating some bad wheat grass. They covered exactly what the policy said.  I submitted the cat's history on New Year's Eve (Thursday) and the claim was approved that day. I had a check in hand by Monday.  It was truly amazing.  They also made sure to follow up on my cat with a very warm, sweet email which sounds goofy but really made my day with such a personal touch.  Healthy Paws really gives me peace of mind for my cat's care.  Outstanding!
title: Excellent service gives me peace of mind

text:
I have three pets and I began to think about acquiring pet health insurance.  I was not looking forward to having yet another monthly bill, but I thought it was a good idea to have insurance if any of my family's beloved pets became ill or had a sudden accident.  I did plenty of research before deciding on Healthy Paws, and I located and carefully read all the 'fine print" on theirs and other insurance carriers' contracts.   Healthy Paws was straight forward and not too expensive, and I also noticed in my research what appeared to be many real and satisfied customers.  My older pet understandably required a higher deductible, and as with almost all pet insurance carriers, pre-existing conditions were not covered.  However, the deductible was not too high and was payable every year, NOT every incident like other insurance carriers.  
About 8-months after signing up for Healthy Paws, my 11 year old male cat had a urinary blockage, that led to a bladder rupture, that quickly spiraled beyond the expertise of my vet and required a specialist and also emergency care/hospitalization.  The bills quickly piled on to amounts that weakened my knees, but luckily, I had savings, and I wasn't sure if Healthy Paws would hold up its end of the bargain once I submitted my pets' history and invoices.  Surprisingly, there was about a one-week turn around for each claim (shorter amount of time than they indicated), and I was reimbursed as promised with no complications.  
Through a tough battle, my cat was saved, and is currently in recovery, and I was able to focus on getting him better with the comfort of knowing that I had an honest and ethical insurance company to cover the majority of the bills as they promised they would.  
Being ethical and an insurance company are two things that are usually not expected to go hand-in-hand, but my emergency experience with Healthy Paws has restored my faith that there are actually companies still out there trying to do right by their customer.  Our family has their best friend back, and our cat was able to get the best treatment possible.  When considering pet insurance, read the fine print before signing up, and keep in mind my experience, because if there's the slightest chance your pet can survive an emergency situation, Healthy Paws will afford you peace of mind so that you can focus on finding that chance and possibly enjoy many more years with your pet/companion/best-friend.
title: Ethical, Honest, was really there when we needed them

text:
Healthy Paws has been fantastic to deal with, reasonably priced for monthly premium, easy to submit claims, quick processing and receipt of claim funds and kind and caring staff who helped us greatly when our 2 year old black lab tore her cruciate ligament and needed a $4700 surgery. They covered 90% of the surgery which made it a very easy process for us so we could focus on our dog's needs without worrying about money. 

They've followed up with us to see how she is healing post operatively.,

I am thrilled I chose Healthy Paws after extensive research. I HIGHLY recommend them and tell everyone I know!
title: 100% satisfied

text: Our 4-year-old lab tore her ACL and needed surgery to repair it. This was the first major claim we made with Healthy Paws. The whole process was unbelievably easy and every customer service representative we talked to was very nice and seemed genuinely interested in the wellbeing and recovery of our dog. Within two weeks of her surgery our claim had been processed and we received a reimbursement check for 90% of the entire bill--completely hassle free. Not to mention they also covered her post-surgery rehab. We can't recommend them highly enough.
title: Customer service and coverage that went above & beyond our expectations!

text: Healthy Paws was true to their word and provided a fast response and processing of my claim. This was a smooth, hassle free process above and beyond my expectations. They honored the insurance policy exactly as it was set up. I even forwarded their information to 5 other people who are now interested in obtaining a policy after hearing about our pet's situation. Many thanks.
title: Beat expectations

text:
After 5 corgis I decided the new puppy should  have pet insurance- I didn't anticipate that I would need surgery so soon. 
Healthy Paws customer support staff responded quickly answering questions and promptly reviewed out claim. A follow-up contact to ask how our pet was doing certainly exceeded my expectations .
Having surgery on your pet is always stressful , knowing that you have insurance to offset the expense makes the experience a bit more manageable.
title: first time user and very pleased

text: Daisy is fully recovered from her bladder stone surgery and acting just like a two year old again. Thank you for your company's quick response to our claim and with a very caring attitude. We hope we never have to use this insurance again but it's nice to know Healthy Paws will be there for us and Daisy.
title: Best Insurance transaction ever!

text: We never had pet insurance before and with all the animals that we have had, we were beginning to search for the right company.  We then brought home our Stryder who was rescued by a very kind man from the Maricopa County Shelter's death row.  That is a story in itself.  Anyway, he came with insurance on him and we transferred to us as new owners.  Then we decided to put our other dog Kya on, and then we got a new puppy (I have forgotten the work involved) name Zeus.  He's a mini rottweiller and keeps us on our toes.  Well apparently, we were not that great as he got a hold of a piece of tennis ball and, yes, he swallowed.  This got logged in his small intestine which required emergency surgery.  The bill was extensive and Healthy Paws covered 90% of it.  The deductible is great and the monthly premium truly paid for itself with just this crisis.  The staff are extremely pleasant and I don't dread having to call.  When I do, I always tell them how much I appreciate their services and only wish I could get insured through them.
title: Exceptional

text: Our 1 year old Jake had a costly hospital stay and Healthy Paws came to the rescue.  The claim was simple to submit! Just snap a picture of the bill with my phone and that was it.  We heard back with feedback the same day and had a check within a week.  They even emailed us later to find out how Jake was feeling! A great company!!
title: Amazing insurance company!!!

text: Our 9 mnth old golden retriever suddenly stopped eating and playing. We knew something was really wrong. From our initial visit to the ER to several follow up appointments, Healthy Paws was with us every step of the way! The app that uploads the invoices was convenient and super easy! In a time of stress and concern, they were so caring and supportive. Most impressive was the turn around time of the claims. This all just happened last week and we have already starting receiving our reimbursement checks! That's incredible. I would recommend Healthy Paws to all our doggy friends!
title: Best Experience! Highly Recommend Healthy Paws!

text:
Remi, our Miniature Bull Terrier has had Healthy Paws since he was 4 years old.  Almost immediately after we purchased the insurance he developed an genetically caused eye condition that required expensive surgeries and lifelong medications.  Healthy Paws covered all of his medical costs.  

On Christmas this year, Remi became ill.  We rushed him to the emergency veterinarian where he was diagnosed with a life threatening pericardial effusion.  We were informed that pericardial effusions generally occur due to a cancer in the heart called a hemanagiosarcoma and this diagnosis would be terminal.  The emergency veterinarian told that if they performed the procedure they could give Remi (and us) quality time together and time to perform additional testing to confirm the diagnosis.

Unfortunately, over the next few days his diagnosis was confirmed.  Despite this, these days were cherished and he was without suffering.  We are thankful that we had Healthy Paws Insurance during this difficult time as it provided us the ability to make decisions that were based entirely on the best interest of Remi.

Healthy Paws has been a wonderful partner with us in the care of Remi.

Martina
title: Cherished Time

text: My energetic Bichon Frise tore his ACL and I was told he needed surgery at a cost of over $3,000! I had never filed a claim before so I was worried. I found the process to upload documents easy, and they were easy to contact. They were helpful and friendly on the phone and I was helped throughout the process. The reinbursement check came quickly. I have since recommended them to friends and will continue to do so.
title: Thankful for Healty Paws Insurance!

text: When my fianc√© and I first adopted our dog my brother insisted that we get pet insurance.  I researched all the pet insurances  online and even made a spread sheet of what was covered and included in each one.  From all the 5 star reviews and the information I found, I decided on Healthy Paws.  I hoped I never had to actually submit a claim but unfortunately our young dog had different plans.  A couple days before Christmas he got into our trash and decided to put Healthy Paws to the test.  We realized he had ingested something when he became lethargic and began to refuse food on Christmas Day.  We brought him to the emergency vet and sure enough he needed a $4,000 surgery/hospital stay to remove a foreign body from his stomach.  After we picked up our dog from his surgery, I immediately started the claim process.  I took a picture of his itemized receipt on the Healthy Paws App and hit submit (yes it was that simple). A couple days later I received an email stating that my claim was accepted and was informed that our reimbursement check was on its way.  I couldn't believe how fast and easy the claim process was but the absolute best part is we got reimbursed the exact amount that I was expecting.  From my experience with other insurance companies I thought for sure I would be on the phone for days trying to figure out why they didn't cover certain parts of the surgery and trying to fight to get more money back.  This absolutely was not the case with Healthy Paws!  There were no hidden fees or rules that we missed and our check arrived quickly in the mail. In the midst of planning a Wedding and after all the Christmas bills getting reimbursed the money for the surgery was amazing.  Thanks Healthy Paws for helping to save our Christmas! Our dog is happy, healthy and back to his old antics!
title: Healthy paws helped save our Christmas

text:
Healthy Paws has now assisted in two major claims for TPLO surgery for my dog, Basti. She is a 5 year old pup who has had to have her knees essentially re-constructed; yes, if you have gasped for air in thinking about the small car I could have bought for the price of her surgeries, you are correct. 

Thanks to Healthy Paws, this burden was not mine alone. I got my pup when I was still finishing school and am still at the beginning of my career; a monthly payment with a low deductible and high payout has been essential to her guaranteed care. We were able to go to one of the best surgeons in the country, twice now. I was able to file my claim with no hassle online/through my mobile app, and track the progress of the claim. Even with the holidays, their turn around was in their 7-10 day promise. 

I am perpetually impressed with the Customer Service I receive and follow ups regarding my pup's health and my customer experience.

I will continue to highly recommend this company to my fellow pet owners!
title: Excellent Customer Service, Speedy Turnaround

text: My cat Dante work me up at 3 in the morning 2 days before Christmas. After taking him to the two different vets, including a 24 hour emergency vet, I got an oh-so-fun $1400 holiday gift (but thankfully a healthy cat.) Submitting the claim was a lot easier than I expected. With the phone app, just take a picture of the invoice from the vet, click submit and that's it. We submitted our claim on December 24th, and had our check IN HAND on January 3rd. And that's during the holidays! Way to back up what you promise, you have earned a customer for life. 100% Recommended!
title: FANTASTIC COMPANY!!!

text:
Healthy Paws was the best decision I ever made. My 5 month old puppy was hit by a car while on leash and needed emergency surgery on his leg that was ranging at $5,000. My HP insurance went into effect two weeks prior and they were unbelievably quick and attentive to help make this awful process go as smoothly as possible. They even went above and beyond to work out with the animal hospital a way to direct pay them so I would not have to front all the money. I cannot express enough gratitude for Healthy Paws. It was rated the #1 pet insurance when I was scouring the internet and now I see why - they truly care about you and your pet. 

Thank you Healthy Paws!!!!
title: Absolute Lifesaver!!!

text: My pomeranian was recently diagnosed with chronic/acute kidney failure. Medical costs were sky high in the thousands, and I'm really glad to have my dog insured by Healthy Paws! The claims process was also easy and straightforward. Having a sick dog is hard, and Healthy Paws make it possible to worry less about the medical bills and give my dog the best treatment possible.
title: Great insurance company to be with!

text: My most valuable asset are my pets, and when a friend told me about Healthy Paws when we rescued our first dog 4 years ago it was clear that I wanted health insurance for my pit bull girl Josie. Healthy Paws has turned out to be a life saver and a total blessing for me. Two ACL tears and two elbow dysplasia surgeries my poor Josie had to endure in the last 4 years which I could have never afforded on my own. Healthy Paws has clear, straightforward policies without hidden exceptions. They care, they are efficient, fast and a great company! I highly recommend insuring your pet with them!!!!
title: Best investment into the well being of your furry friends!

text:
I am the unfortunate owner of a beautiful golden retriever who in five weeks was diagonosed with two different cancers the second requiring emergency treatment and surgery. Never once did Health Paws hesitate to cover my claims and in five weeks there were many. They made it possible to gve my dog the best medical care available. 

I have had AKC insurance that would not cover medical care even though I had never filed a claim in 7 years (a different dog) I quickly canceled and was fortunate to find Healthy Paws. They answer claims in two to three weeks.
title: THE BEST THERE IS

text:
Nayah is a beautiful, super sweet pitbull mix my husband and I rescued... she's our only child. We discovered Nayah had a cyst-like growth that was pressing on her spinal-cord that could have very likely caused her to eventually not be able to walk.  After seeing vets, specialists, and an MRI she had to have a surgery which kept her in the hospital for days.  It was very expensive, but we were so fortunate we decided to get pet insurance just in case for her.  We've heard too many sad stories about people either not being able to help their pets medical issue because they couldn't afford the medical care their pets required, or of people going into debt from heavy vet bills.  
Healthy Paws monthly payment is very reasonable, their reimbursements are quick and easy to submit through a simple smartphone app, and it gives your furry friends a much better chance at the happiest, healthiest life possible.  I hope those who have pets will consider getting good pet insurance and give your pets the care and attention they deserve.
title: So thankful we got Healthy Paws!

text:
Healthy Paws allowed me to make a life or death situation about my dog an easy one. Without their services I truly hate to think what the outcome could have been. 

My dog got into an entire bottle of ibuprofen while I wasn't home and had to be rushed to the Emergency Vet for immediate care. When the vet told me our dog could be saved but the cost would be in the thousands, I didn't hesitate to agree as I knew that Healthy Paws would cover 80% of the cost per our plan. Luckily our dog pulled through and is totally fine and the cost of his care was far more manageable than what it could have been.

 I highly recommend Healthy Paws to anyone who has pets as they are  easy to use, prompt, and reliable. Thank you Healthy Paws!
title: Healthy Paws Pet Insurance is the BEST!

text:
I was very hesitant to purchase pet insurance although I had had a number of dogs with costly illnesses.  After my last Jack Russell died and I had incurred over $20,000 in bills, I changed my mind.  After doing careful research, I secured Healthy Paws 90% plan.  The price was very reasonable, they did not cancel you for chronic diseases and they didn't raise your premium after you had incurred costly claims.  I cost them nothing for one year.  However, the last three years, having a fairly "healthy" Jack Russell, Annie still experienced a lot of very expensive conditions to pay for - over $10,000.  Allergic conditions requiring the only dog allergist in Northern Virginia and cutting edge treatments.  A benign tumor that cost $3,000 to diagnose at a dog cancer center and $2,500 to excise and other assorted and miscellaneous conditions.  Healthy Paws certainly lost money on us. Nevertheless, they always paid our claims within 4 days, sent us condolence notes in email, when Annie was going through a particularly difficult illness and never failed to send her birthday and holiday cards. They also give a portion of her monthly insurance fee to dog charities.
I can't tell you how much I love them and how lucky I was to find them.
I had compared many plans and others would not pay for chronic conditions and no one was willing to cover 90%.  I tell everyone, you should joint too.
title: Very best pet insurance in the entire United States

text:
I've been a member of Healthy Paws since my puppy was 10 weeks old.  She's 6 years old now.  I debated when we got her whether or not we would want to get insurance for her, but at less than $40/month it was an easy decision.  Plus we could cancel anytime. 

Now, 6 years later, it is literally one of the best decisions I've ever made. My puppy (who will always be a puppy even when she's 6 years old) has managed to...

*  Eat chocolate bars 3 times   (Three ER Visits)
*  Eaten something else that made her horribly sick   (1 ER Visit)
*  Had 6 lump biopsies 
*  Had 2 teeth removed because they broke 
*  Had multiple stool sample tests for giardia & other digestive issues
*  Had blood tests prior to both oral surgeries
and many many more

Beyond her general check-ups, every single doctor‚Äôs visit has resulted in a payment back to us by Healthy Paws.  At this point in her 6 year live we have easily spent $10,000 on various medical visits, and she's actually a very healthy & low maintenance dog.  

Almost more than anything, having Healthy Paws means I don't even need to think about the cost of keeping my dog healthy.  It doesn't even cross my mind when issues come up.  "Oh, she cracked a tooth...let's take it out before it gets abscessed."  There's simply no question.  Without Healthy Paws, that one tooth would have cost me over $1000.  Also, the reality is that I would go into serious debt to make sure my dog was healthy.  I‚Äôd do almost anything in the world for her, even if it meant I would be put into a challenging financial position.  Thankfully, that‚Äôs not an issue.  Thankfully, I got healthy paws!

Btw, another perk is that they are SO easy to work with.   You submit your medical bill, you get a check in the mail.  Easy as it could be.  Too bad human insurance companies aren‚Äôt that easy.
title: Best decision I could have made

text:
After doing our research and speaking to everyone in our circle of friends we decided to use Healthy Paws hoping to never need their help.  The process was easy and all was well but the true test is when you need them.  

Our dog was hit by a car while my wife and I were out of the country and she was staying with my folks.  It was a dumb and senseless accident that left our dog with a dislocated and fractured spine.  While talking to the doctor at the animal hospital they suggested that if we have insurance...now would be the time to discuss our options since the dog would need an MRI, surgery and likely long term rehabilitation.  I called Healthy Paws in a panic to see what our options were just to get the ball rolling and they were...are...amazing.  They calmed me down, walked me through my policy and get the hospital to contact them directly to cut the red tape so my wife and I could catch a plane home.  The level of care and support that they showed and continue to show...just floors me.  They treated me like family and have been holding my hand every step of the way.  Through everything that has happened they reach out to check on the dog and on my family.

I can't recommend them more. They are something far and above what I expected and are true heroes to my family.
title: Life Savers

text: We have a 4.5 year-old Labrador retriever.  She chases the ball like  a maniac.  When another friend's dog had to have surgery and I heard how expensive it was, I thought about pet insurance.  They had Healthy Paws and she raved about how well she had been treated (i.e., claims paid without any argument).  So we looked into different options and decided to enroll with Healthy Paws.  Nine months after enrolling our dog tore her cruciate ligament (ACL for humans) and had to have surgery.  A week and a half after I submitted the claim I got an email that a check was on it's way to me.  I was amazed!  And so grateful.  They even emailed a few days later to see how our dog was doing.  I'll never be without them!
title: We love Healthy Paws!

text: A couple of months ago I acquired a beautiful loving miniature Portuguese Water dog that was a rescue and in need of a loving caring home. To ensure that she had the best pet insurance, I did my due diligence and found this amazing company; Healthy Paws that had outstanding reviews. I subscribed to their best plan and felt confident that in the event that my beautiful dog needed medical care, she would be well protected. Little did I know that within weeks of signing up to Healthy Paws would I need their help and the emergency care of ASEC. Within days the Veterinary bills quickly added up costing thousands of dollars. I submitted my claim/s to Healthy Paws and the only info that they required was for my Vet to submit all the medical records. Within a week I received checks for my claim/s, less my deductibles. Healthy Paws were absolutely outstanding in their handling of my claim (particularly during a very stressful period).
title: Amazing Company and Staff

text:
We love Healthy Paws! Our kitty Sammy has an unfortunate habit of eating strange objects. After his first surgery, I decided to shop around for pet insurance for him. As fate would have it, Sammy decided to swallow another object on the very day the 10-day waiting period was over, so I was worried they might not cover it. But no problem! Claim was very easy to upload (WHY is BCBS-NC not this easy?!), and it was processed very quickly. I had a check in hand in less than a week, for 90% of Sammy's second surgery bill (minus deductible/exam fee). This saved us $thousands!

We also got Healthy Paws insurance for our puppy when we got him last year--haven't had to use it yet, but good to know it's there if needed.

Fast forward to 2 years later (November 2015). Sammy was sick again, and I feared the worst, so off he went to the animal hospital. Turned out to be gastritis/pancreatitis, so luckily no surgery was needed, and after some critical care, Sammy is now back to his old tricks.

Bill was $995, and in the end I paid only $293 out of pocket. Again, I had the check in hand in less than 1 week after filing the claim.

I just can't say enough about the peace of mind I have knowing my pets will get the care they need, without breaking my piggy bank like the first surgery did (pre-insurance). Pets are family, but they can do unpredictable things and come down with unpredictable illnesses, so I am more than happy to pay my monthly insurance to Healthy Paws, because I know they are going to come through for me. If only I could say the same for BCBS-NC!

They even followed up with an email to inquire about Sammy's recovery! Healthy Paws is the best!
title: If only human insurance were this great!

text: An incredibly efficient and honest insurance company.  I only wish my own health insurance was this transparent and expedient.
title: Flawless

text: My rescue mutt suffers from severe hip dysplasia and a rare autoimmune disorder called lupoid onychodystrophy. One of his hips was so bad that our specialist sent us to a surgeon several hours away to have a new hip implanted. The surgery and implant cost upwards of $6000, not to mention all the vet work Buddy had in preparation. In short, that surgery transformed his life. I could never have made it happen without Healthy Paws. They continue to cover the acupuncture he receives (that, by the way, along with fish oil and vitamin e therapy) keeps his arthritis and autoimmune disorder under control. Their service is fast and friendly, and I feel good knowing that they are also committed to helping animals in need.
title: Great people, great insurance

text: . She received excellent care, and we are so grateful we were able to provide her the very best. Working with Heathly Paws has been an absolute pleasure; our claims were processed so efficiently and everyone I communicated with was kind and helpful. Not having to worry about dealing with complicated forms, or any "red tape" was such a welcome relief during this stressful time. I am truly blown away by the outstanding costumer service and efficiency you provided us. I will continue to trust you to protect my pets and will recommend you highly to all the pet parents I know. Thank you again.
title: Excellent Service!

text: We signed up for Healthy Paws when we adopted out Lhasa Apso four years ago from the Humane Society. While it is true for 4 years we paid the premium without any real benefit out of the blue she ruptured a disc in her back. What a blessing it was when we took her to emergency and they had to do an MRI ($2500) and then surgery (almost another $2500) we could just say yes and bring her back to health without worrying about the money. Everything was covered at 90% just as they said they would. It was the best investment in the health of our fur baby.
title: Such a blessing to have

text:
RE: Pet Insurance

John and I talked about pet insurance a few times last year, but didn't know anyone else who had it so we weren't sure if it was worth it or not. Fast forward to June, when the universe brought me a horrific story about a friend's experience with dog sitting and the Pet ER that totally rocked my world. I signed the dogs up immediately with Healthy Paws, the insurance we had been considering, and that was that.

Just after Labor Day Appa was playing ball with some friends - trying to be the best, as he does - and he started limping. The limp got worse, so we called our Vet and had it checked out. Keeping fingers crossed that it was just a soft tissue injury, we waited a few more days and it got worse. Back to the Vet.

This week he had surgery to repair his torn cruciate ligament, and we are embarking on a two month recovery followed by two months of rehab. With a 50% chance he'll damage his other leg at some point, our insurance covered $3,400 of a $4,400 hospital bill. On top of that, since this wasn't a pre-existing condition his other legs are covered (heaven forbid) he should tear another.

No one ever plans for a pet emergency, but in this instance having the insurance and knowing we could afford to pursue the best course of treatment available for our Appa made this whole situation just the teensiest bit less stressful.

So, if you are like we were last year and are considering pet insurance but don't know anyone who has it: we have it. We have used it. And we would happily recommend Healthy Paws if you want a plan that covers the unexpected!
title: Relief In A Stressful Situation

text: I signed up for Healthy Paws Pet Insurance after adopting our dog Vin.  Our previous family dogs required expensive medical care, and I realized how important it is to have insurance.  I did my homework and chose Healthy Paws - they have EXCEEDED my expectations.  Their people are simply the best - professional, quick to respond, and genuinely kind and caring.  And friendly!
title: I recommend Healthy Paws Pet Insurance wholeheartedly!

text: We have been customers of Healthy Paws for almost 4 years now and have been very pleased with the coverage and service we've received. During that time, we've filed several claims for both minor and major illnesses/conditions, including 2 dogs who were diagnosed with cancer. Healthy Paws has always been responsive and fair, quickly processing claims and paying for covered items without delay or question. In addition, company representatives display compassion and concern for customers and their pets. Following our dog's recent surgery for cancer, not only was the claim quickly processed and paid, we received a follow-up email asking how our dog is doing. We will always purchase insurance for our dogs through Healthy Paws and have encouraged (and will continue to encourage) others to do the same. The peace of mind we have from being able to provide the very best care for our four-legged family members without having to worry about whether we can afford to pay for it is priceless.
title: consistently good service

text: My lab ended up in emergency care for vomiting.  She had consumed some plastic and sticks.  The vet performed X-rays and held her over night in case emergency surgery was required due to a blockage.  Having Healthy Paws insurance helped to ease some of the stress of the day.  The customer service team took care of my claim right away.  It is amazing how fast they handled everything.  The reimbursement arrived in less than a week.  What really impressed me today was a follow up email to see how my dog is doing.  I am truly impressed by the service and commitment to their customers.  I tell anyone who will listen to get Healthy Paws!
title: Amazing Customer Service and Claim Handling

text: I don't often write "fan" letters, especially for insurance companies:). However, Healthy Paws is terrific! I got way behind filing claims due to a rough year with my husband's serious illness. Healthy Paws not only processed everything I sent in late (with no hassle), I even got kind notes hoping everything was going better for us. Healthy Paws covers our rescue Golden Retriever, Brady, who had a rough beginning before coming to us and we've had to deal with some health issues that developed after we got him.  When we rescued him two years ago, we went with another insurance company who hassled us about everything! It was a ridiculous nightmare. We cancelled and switched to Healthy Paws. Best decision we could have made. We even convinced our son to use Healthy Paws when he got his new pup.  All of our dogs have been rescues and that can mean issues but we're confident we now have the best protection and customer service we can get with Healthy Paws.  We would highly recommend them; in fact, we already have recommended them to our friends and family.

text: Have been covered by Healthy Paws [HP] for just over 3 years and could not be more impressed and satisfied. My Frenchie has had expensive procedures for both his eyes (scratched corneas) and his spine (multiple bulging disks) and the process for claim and recovery has been easier than that for my Medicare and the cost is trivial compared to the coverage!
title: Spectacular Coverage and Service

text: Excellent customer service, they went above and beyond to check on our dog. They responded to all our questions quickly, along with completing our claim quickly. We didn't expect the process to go so smoothly. Worth every penny to be reassured we didn't have to worry about being able to afford a major surgery for our dog. Thank you Healthy Paws!!

text: We got Healthy Paws coverage right after we got our puppy, and it's literally been a lifesaver.  She needed bladder surgery at a cost of more than $4,000, and without insurance we probably couldn't have afforded it.  Healthy Paws processed the claim quickly and cut a check for 90% of the cost.  How much simpler and efficient could pet insurance be?  From previous, smaller claims, we knew we could count on them to process the claim as promised and not yank us around.  I wish all insurance was this simple.  Getting pet insurance with Healthy Paws was the single smartest decision we've made for our dog.  I would absolutely recommend that you do the same, and that you choose Healthy Paws.

text: We have been with Healthy Paws for just over a year and have had to submit 2 claims in that time. First, the claim process was extremely easy.  I submitted one simple form and a receipt and received email confirmation that it was being processed.  Second, the claim was processed quickly and without any "fine print" exclusions.  The check was in the bank before the incisions fully healed.  Third, I truly appreciated the follow up email from the company asking about my dog's recovery.  Made me feel good about the attention to customer service!  Overall, would highly recommend!!
title: Hassle-Free, Timely, Wonderful Experience

text: Even though it's terrifying to be told your dog has cancer, I have to say one of the bright spots in the whole ordeal of diagnosing and treating him has been working with Healthy Paws.  Healthy Paws has been with me absolutely every step of the way.  Whenever I call them with questions, I'm connected with an actual person who seems to genuinely care about my dog's well-being.  Every representative I've worked with has been caring, knowledgeable, and incredibly helpful.  Filing claims through their website is a  simple process, and all my claims have been handled promptly.  I am truly impressed with the compassionate service I've received from Healthy Paws, and am really happy I chose them to insure my pet. I can honestly say they've really come through for me and my dog during a really difficult time, and I'm deeply thankful for all they've done for my dog and I.
title: Healthy Paws came through!

text: Bella was always really healthy, but we thought it would be a good idea to have her insured just in case.  This last Christmas we had a malignant tumor removed from her foot, and then this summer, we had two mast cell tumors removed.  It's been really hard on my family and Bella.  Making decisions about the welfare of your dog is hard enough, but if you need to factor in how much it will cost, it's even worse.  Healthy Paws has basically done exactly what they said on their website, and they've been extremely friendly and caring through out. Our claims have been processed quickly and I think very fairly.  They basically had our back in the worst of times, and  I honestly can't recommend them enough!
title: Our Life Savers!!

text:
Going in,  you know that ownership of a French bulldog will eventually result in some kind of health issue and it will be an expensive health issue.  Sad but true, and you hope it is many years down the line.  Unfortunately, it happened early on in my case.  I got my Frenchie when he was four months old and started researching pet health companies right away, assuming I could wait awhile to enroll him somewhere. 

I found all kinds of information and ratings online and began obtaining quotes.  HealthyPaws premiums were in line with all of the others I looked at, but they covered hereditary conditions.  Some of the other companies did not but still cost the same.  Even better, with HealthyPaws, you can choose your annual deductible and level of coinsurance.  Knowing that Frenchies are subject to those types of conditions, I enrolled him when he was six months old. The enrollment process was quick and easy and I have access to the website 24/7.  

He was deemed healthy at his first vet visit other than giardia and coccidiosis which are common in kennels and passed onto the puppies.  We got him squared away with some meds and puppy hygiene and all was well.  The vet sent his records to HealthyPaws ensuring that he was now healthy.

Over the summer, I took him in for his visit to get set up with flea meds and arrange for his neuter (not covered under HealthyPaws), and my vet said that his nostrils had closed up (they were wide open at his initial visit) and he had developed cherry eye; she recommended that he receive corrective surgery for both these conditions; she also said that with the nares surgery, there was a good chance his soft palate would have to be corrected as well.  I was devastated; here was an 11-month old sweet puppy going in for a quick neutering procedure and coming out with major surgery ahead of him.

He had his corrective surgery done which cost $3,000+ and was successful. During the procedure, he had a lump develop on his muzzle which the surgeons treated as an allergic reaction but which continued to grow over the next week.  Back to our regular vet for another visit and a biopsy (two surgeries in two weeks on a Frenchie are risky due to their breathing issues) to find that the muzzle issue was a papilloma virus (warts!) which he could have picked up anywhere.  More antibiotics and he is well again.

The second surgery was $500+. Both claims were submitted and adjudicated within 10 days. Given the annual deductible, the neutering, and coinsurance, my cost for everything was less than $900! I know, that still is a lot of money, but had he not had HealthyPaws, he would not have been able to be treated and would have to live a possibly shorter life with compromised health.  His quality of life is now excellent and his energy level has skyrocketed.  

One of my co-workers just got a Boston terrier puppy, and in discussing our new family members, I learned he had chosen HealthyPaws as well after doing his own research.  I told him that he was in good hands and that he will be very happy with them should he ever need them.  

I would recommend anyone to choose HealthyPaws when looking for insurance for their pets.
title: HealthyPaws could not be any better!

text: Our 4 month old Golden Doodle "Chompx" suffered kidney failure. He was hospitalized in ICU for 2 weeks before being transferred to UF for dialysis.  The bill was approximately $18k. Within hours of his discharge from the first hospital I had an email from Healthy Paws closing out the claim and confirming that a check for 90% - our deductible was on the way. Throughout this process, HP has checked in on Chompx, and shown genuine concern for our little man.  When we were first told he was to be hospitalized, HP offered support and told us just to focus on Chompx. That was such a relief. I expected there would be issues with reimbursement, that seems to be the issue with all insurance companies.. there was no issue, no fuss, no drama.  I had the reimbursement check within days!  Afterwards, they emailed to check on Chompx as well. Throughout this nightmare, they have shown genuine concern for Chompx and they have taken the biggest burden off our minds as we focus on Chompx's recovery. Simple, flawless, expedited reimbursement for your pet's medical needs. Finally a pet insurance that actually does what it says. I've never had a dog with any serious medical issue such as this, I never thought I'd need this, but I am so glad we had it. I will never risk being without Healthy Paws pet insurance again, because no matter how careful you are, anything can happen. Throughout our crisis with Chompx (over 5 weeks in ICU) we've seen countless owners forced to make the ultimate sacrifice with their beloved pets simply because of finances.  It's been heartbreaking to see this happen over and over again.  Whatever the end result is with Chompx (still ongoing) we know that because of Healthy Paws, we have been able to provide the very best possible outcome for him and that every measure has been taken to give him a chance for a full recovery.  Without this policy, our hands would have been forced long ago.  If you love your pet, get the insurance.  Don't wait.
title: Healthy Paws is a Life Saver!!! Don't Hesitate!

text: Signing up for Healthy Paws insurance is by far one of the best decisions I‚Äôve ever made.  They have been the most amazing, reliable company.  I can‚Äôt speak highly enough of them for the confidence and the peace of mind they give me. I have submitted HUGE claim after claim because my dog has just had some serious health issues from the very beginning and they are ALWAYS responsive and provide the exact service they advertise.  I get 90% of all my claims after my $250 annual deductible, every single time. Banjo (my dog) has had a plethora of health issues since I brought him home.  He was born with luxating patella stage 3 in both back legs, and had to have surgery only a couple months after I brought him home. Then when he was about 1 the vet thought it was a bowel obstruction and he had another surgery, but it turned out he did not have an obstruction but rather his intestines had swollen almost shut from food allergies. About a month ago (he‚Äôs not even 2 yet) he started limping again, had x-rays and turned out he had torn all the ligaments in his knee and had to have yet another surgery on his leg. Healthy Paws has been there for us through every single obstacle. He‚Äôs the happiest most loving dog, despite all the health problems he has had and I get to provide him with the health care he needs to have a full and complete life thanks to Healthy Paws.
title: Healthy Paws is a must for your dog

text:
We have pet Insurance with "Healthy Paws."  Recently our dog required emergency surgery and ICU care for a bowel obstruction. Our experience with "Healthy Paws" was exceptional!
We received immediate feedback and they processed our claims immediately. They helped us to obtain required records from the Animal Hospital. Every person I spoke with from "Healthy Paws" was so professional and caring. They have had excellent follow-up as well.
This saved us thousands of dollars. 
Excellent company!
title: Best Pet Insurance

text:
I have to say that I'm absolutely amazed at the level of service I received from Healthy Paws. 

It has made our lives SO much easier knowing that our pets are covered with insurance. It's not only the insurance that gives us peace of mind, it's the ease of filing claims (take a photo and submit through an app - couldn't be easier), the genuine care and concern from all of the Customer Service representatives I've spoken with and the speed at which claims are processed. I wish my health insurance company cared as much as they do!

We have three dogs and I wish I had signed up for Healthy Paws years ago. My youngest dog recently tore both her cruciate ligaments, requiring surgery on both her legs. We had the surgery done on a Thursday. By Friday they had already processed the claim and submitted payment.
It's stressful enough having to deal with an injured pet, but having 90% of $16,000 vet bills covered allowed us to focus on our dog and not the cost of the surgery.
Additionally they followed up with an email a week after the surgery asking if she was ok.

I highly recommend Healthy Paws to anyone considering Pet Insurance.
title: Healthy Paws Cares About your Pets!

text:
I just want to say a big THANK YOU for Healthy Paws.  I am so thankful to have Healthy Paws Pet Insurance which gives me the financial peace of mind to cover my best buddy, Button when he has emergency issues.

Button was an owner-surrendered Yorkshire Terrier to a Manhattan, NYC kill shelter in 2012.  He was saved from death by Anarchy Rescue, and then sent to Yorkie 911 Rescue for further rehabilitation.  I counted that I am his 5th home!  We fell in love with him at a dog adoption day, and never looked back.  The term "who rescued who" is so appropriate in our home; since I do not have any children (just plenty of nieces and nephews!!!).  With a rescue, you have a health unknown, and thankfully he had no pre-existing conditions which might exclude him from some coverage.

The decision to have pet insurance was to insure me that this little dog's life would never have a price tag on him again; nor will I every throw him away as many dog owners do when financial issues of pet care could cause a burden.  I read about Healthy Paws through an AAA recommendation, and the company has not let me down.  I can handle the day-to-day, well-doggie costs with the vet; but, my dog has had a few emergencies due to his getting into trouble or from an unexpected illness, and those vet bills were scary.  The insurance has provided me with such peace of mind, knowing that my dog gets great care, when I hand over the credit card.

Button's recent ear canal surgery was health threatening, (sad and scary for the pet parents, we were fearful that we might loose him), and the associated vet bill was even scarier.  I actually called Healthy Paws before the surgery just like I do for my own insurance "just in-case".  Customer support gave me peace of mind to move forward. After the surgery, the reimbursement was at 90% - paid very, very promptly!

Button almost died during the surgery.  He had a TECA (total ear canal ablation), and is now hearing in only one good ear--now a special needs dog (but he has adjusted  to his lost hearing).  He endured two weeks recovering with the "cone of shame", eye drops, while we tried to keep him calm and confined.  After the two weeks, the vet surgeon gave Button a "thumbs up"!  Button is a happy, healthy dog--back to his old self.  Without the expert care of two vets, my Button Buddy would have died.  I am hoping that now he has a lot of dog treats, belly rubs,and life left in him for a few more years.  With your insurance, he will definitely have that emergency care as he ages with the amazing coverage that you provide.  I have been recommending Healthy Paws to many of my dog owners friends for their consideration

Sincerely,

Ann, Mark and Button (aka cute as a button) Pfisterer
title: Healthy Paws = Peace of Mind! + a healthy dog!

text: I'm so happy I chose Health Paws.  We covered out adopted 3 years old Frenchie who was very healthy.  She somehow slipped a disc and required an mri and then surgery.  Healthy Paws covered 90 percent of the changes and with 2 days.  My vet submitted the claim for me so it was easy.  I don't leave comments often but this experience warranted it.
title: saved my frenchie's life

text:
I have three Golden Retrievers, all insured with Healthy Paws.  My two youngest Goldens both have life-threatening, on-going disease.  

Ivy, my 7-year old, has a disease called Granuloma Meningoencephalitis, an auto-immune disease that will eventually kill her.  She is on daily steroid treatments along with chemo treatments every three weeks.  This treatment is very expensive and without the support from Healthy Paws, I would be unable to afford these treatments.  She will need these treatments for the rest of her life.

Thanks to Healthy Paws, she is in remission and able to lead a relatively normal life.  She goes for walks, swims, plays with the other dogs, trains with me and even goes to, and participates in dog shows. 

Hayley, my 3-year old, was diagnosed with refractive epilepsy at age 2.  This means the normal drugs used to control seizures are not very effective on her.  She takes two different types of seizure medications three times a day.  She has had to be hospitalized twice now in order to stop her seizures.  She has at least 3 to 4 seizures a week, they normally come in clusters, and can get out of control easily.  

Healthy Paws has paid EVERY CLAIM without ANY HASSLE at all.  They have stood by, and supported us thought all of this!!  Just like they state, they have been there when it REALLY COUNTS.  Having one sick dog, much less two, is extremely stressful; without the financial support from Healthy Paws it would be unbearable.  I thank them from the bottom on my heart every day.
title: Healthy Paws has saved two of my beloved dogs lives!!!

text: We selected Healthy Paws in 2011 when our first dog Diesel was a puppy and could have been nicknamed "crash." Fortunately, he grew up a little and we didn't have to use it. When we got our second dog Luna in 2013 we added her immediately. We are so glad we did as this year, Luna has had more than her fair share of vet visits. She was hit by a car in February, tore a cruciate in March and had TTA surgery, followed by rehab, and just a few weeks ago tore her meniscus in the same leg and had to have another surgery. Every time we submit a claim, it is processed and paid with no questions and no delay (usually within 10 days). It's been a rough year for Luna, but Healthy Paws has allowed us to focus on her recovery instead of worrying how we are going to pay her vet bills.
title: Great insurance, fast and easy service

text:
We thoroughly researched all of the pet insurance companies and found Healthy Paws to be the best choice for us. The biggest selling points for us was that the deductible is annual (not per incident), and that the maximum payout is unlimited annually and lifetime. Like most pet parents, we took out insurance as we never wanted to have to choose between our dog‚Äôs health and finances.

We hoped we would never have to use it, but in the almost 5 months Dixie has been home with us, we have had to use it multiple times. She has had giardia, surgery to remove a baby tooth that broke off at the gumline, and 2 surgeries for what we thought was a puncture wound that ended up being a dermoid sinus tract that went thru and under her nasal bone. Quite a lot to go thru for a puppy who is only 6 ¬Ω months old. All of her claims have been paid promptly with no questions asked (unlike human insurance which always seems to be a fight to get them to pay for anything). 

Their customer service is outstanding. It was stressful enough watching her go thru all of these procedures, and it was nice not to have to worry about the financial end of it. It is such a nice touch that they followed up after her last major surgery to check on her. We recommend Healthy Paws to any of our friends who ask about insurance for their pets and we will only use them for our pets.
title: Healthy Paws is absolutely the best

text: I did extensive research when looking for Pet Insurance and chose Healthy Paws.  The level of customer service and claims process has been stellar since June 2014 when I enrolled my two West Highland White Terriers.  To prove my point my 17 month old Westie was diagnosed with pancreatitis and admitted to the ICU on Saturday.  She was discharged on Thursday with a bill of close to $5k.  I submitted the claim the day of discharge and was notified the next day the check was in the mail.  The check arrived on Wednesday because of the Labor Day holiday.  Healthy Paws paid 90% of the entire bill.  Unfortunately, my Westie  has some congenital medical issues that added up to close to $15k over the course of 17 months.  All claims were paid quickly and her medical issues have not affected her particular plan.  She will continue to be covered by Healthy Paws until should decide to terminate her coverage.    The client care department also emails me to see how she is doing.  How awesome is that?   I would NEVER change pet insurance.
title: Healthy Paws is Simply The Best!

text: My baby girl Lana had an Addisonian Crisis and was hospitalized for two days.  A team of amazing veterinarians were able to treat her successfully, and I can‚Äôt describe how emotional the experience was‚Ä¶.I was nervous about submitting the claim, partly because of the emotional state I was in, but also because I had never had a good experience with insurance companies (only auto insurance at that point).  The claims submission process was as simple as uploading the vet‚Äôs invoice online.  A few days later I received an email stating my reimbursement check was on it‚Äôs way.  Then another personal email checking up on Lana.  They truly care and allow us to focus on our loved ones‚Ä¶.
title: An Insurance Company that cares!!!

text:
I cannot say enough about Healthy Paws Pet Insurance. Our 2 year old chocolate lab just had to have major intestinal surgery because he ate a piece of a tennis ball that got stuck in his small intestine.

The total cost was over $3500 and we are only paying about $550 ($250 to meet our deductible and then everything was covered at 90%). It gave us such piece of mind knowing that we could commit to having the surgery done without being worried about the cost. It was already a very stressful and emotional time, and it was great to not have to worry about the final bill. Healthy Paws processed our claim within a few days and the reimbursement checks are on their way to us already!

I always knew that having pet insurance (especially for a lab) was important, but after this incident, I'm a believer more than ever.
THANK YOU Healthy Paws!
title: Healthy Paws saved my bank account!

text: We have had this insurance for 6 years and never had a claim , this year is different. Two 2 Major surgeries in 6 months. The first was our Great Pynerees  had a 5 pound tumor removed in Feburary 2015 and then in August had a completely torn ACL repaired and he is recovering great. Also he was diagonised with arturitus and the meds were taken care of by Healthy Paws also. This Year we paid out about $2900 dollars and have been reimbersed about $2400 .  The cost of the insurance has risen from fro $37  to $41 over the years but I believe it is very reasonable considering the cost of veteniary care these days. Healthy Paws is made up of Animal Lovers and have checked on Boomer several times since his surgerys. It only takes a week for them to process your online claim after the first claim is filed.
title: Our Fur Buddy is doing Great.

text: I've done my homework.  That is why I've had Healthy Paws for a few pets.  They are a no hassle, cut and dry, quick paying company.  And they help homeless pets too!  My cane corso mastiff just had two torn Acl surgeries this summer.  Each surgery cost $3,000!  My cost was $300 each leg!  And each claim was processed within a week.  I just LOVE this company because there is no red tape.  Everything is covered except the office visit charge and preventative medicine.  It's awesome!  I also have a pug that had two eye ulcers and both of those were paid within a week as well.  I can say with certainty that you will be very satisfied with Healthy Paws!
title: Healthy Paws is The BEST pet insurance out there!

text: If your in the market for pet insurance, look no further than Healthy Paws. We recently purchased a policy for a dog Kira. Within 3 months Kira was hit by a car and ended up with a badly shattered femur. This was a Sunday.  The emergency vet stated he would most likely lose his leg without emergency surgery from a specialist. We loaded him up and drove him to the San Francisco Bay Area where the surgeon operated for four hours. Kira is now recovering at home with all four legs right where they belong! Healthy Paws has been amazing!  They paid his claims without any issue! Simply submit your claim with a photograph of the final bill. In less than a week we had received the first of 2 reimbursement checks. The 2nd arrived a few days later. And they called to see how Kira was doing after surgery!  How amazing is that? Healthy Paws says what they will do and then does exactly what they said. I researched many pet insurance companies. Little did I know I'd be using it a few short months later. I bought the best because in this world you get what you pay for. Do yourself a favor and go with Healthy Paws. You won't regret it if your pet has the misfortune to need it.
title: Healthy Paws Amazing Insurance

text:
Healthy Paws is hands-down the best pet insurance company available.  We have two dogs, a Rhodesian Ridgeback and a Great Dane and did a lot of research prior to ultimately going with Healthy Paws. We couldn't be happier about our choice. Our Ridgeback, Kobe, has suffered from several puppy illnesses this first year and everyone of them has been covered.  We only have to take a picture of the itemized invoice from our vet on our cell phone, email it in, and within a few days, we have a reimbursement check with no questions asked, and no claim forms required.  Healthy Paws even emailed to check to see if Kobe was feeling better!  
This summer, when we got our Great Dane puppy, Nelson, we noticed pet insurance premiums for Danes are higher, so we found a different pet insurance company that was slightly cheaper, by about $10 per month.  This company required a pre-authorization form first from our vet and claim forms signed by our vet, and had a very negative tone in every email and correspondence about the consequences of lying on claims.  We felt like we were being accused when we hadn't even filed a claim with them!! We have NEVER experienced anything like this with Healthy Paws.  We originally thought it would be worth the small monthly savings.  We immediately regretted our decision.  Within 10 days, we were cancelling this policy and switching Nelson to Healthy Paws as well.  We had so much more peace of mind knowing both of our dogs were insured with this company. 
Healthy Paws has the best coverage, customer service, and ease of use of any of the policies that we investigated and we looked extensively!  Healthy Paws is most certainly the company of choice!
title: Best Pet Insurance Around~ Doesn't even compare to other companies!!!

text: Our Lab, Maggie was recently diagnosed with osteosarcoma (bone cancer). Our vet recommended an advanced radiation therapy and even though it was quite expensive, it would give her the best chance for longer life with us. The Healthy Paws team was great in working with us to verify the coverage and even offered to work directly with our vet so we wouldn't incur out of pocket expenses. The team was great, empathetic to us and concerned for our sick girl. Even though Maggie is a senior (11) the coverage has been great, they didn't question anything we've submitted and turned around the approval process for the largest invoice within the same day. The online submission process is great - if they need more info, they contact my vet directly. Made dealing with Maggie's illness so much easier as I didn't have to worry about this aspect of it at all. They sure provide much better service than my human insurance company!
title: Thank God for Healthy Paws Pet Insurance

text: Our one year old puppy recently had to have surgery on his leg, which was approximately $3000. We submitted all of the paperwork to Healthy Paws and in less than two weeks we received our reimbursement checks! They even sent a follow-up email to us asking how the Jake was doing. It was very easy to communicate with them and their staff was very caring. I was very impressed and will continue to use and recommend Healthy Paws.
title: Outstanding Customer Service

text:
I have a 5 year old collie mix and recently filed my first claim. Maya was having issues with multiple days of diarrhea so we took her to our vet. After some tests, turns out it was parasite and she needed antibiotics. 

Used the Healthy Paws mobile app to submit the claim and received a check with the week! Very easy to use and was great knowing I had it.
title: Very pleased with Healthy Paws

text: Just a great company that truly cares about your pets and you! Knowledgeable and responsive staff and a claims process that is a breeze. I wish my human insurance was this caring and efficient!
title: Just a great company!
